Such programming sleuths are not rewarded for their discoveries with the fame of a Pasteur or a Salk. Nonetheless, they are satisfied—beyond the comprehension of ordinary men—with the work itself. And yet, such a bug-finding genius may be rather inept at correcting a bug once it has been found—indeed, the found bug has lost its interest for him. If forced to make the correction, he will, more often than not, introduce a much cruder bug in its place, or else create a clumsy and inefficient patch. For corrections that fit into a program with a certain elegance, another type of programmer is needed.

纠正其他人程序中的错误需要一种适应性和分寸感，再加上一种机器或一种语言的广泛技巧。换句话说，“修补程序”必须具有“综合”思维，这与“错误发现者”的“分析”思维相对。可以肯定的是，同一个人可以在这两项任务上都表现出色，但我们更有可能发现，一个团队可以比其任何成员做得更好——如果他们有理智和谦逊地认识到自己的才能和缺点.

Correcting errors in other peoples' programs requires a sense of fitness and proportion, plus an extensive repertoire of tricks for one machine or language. The "patcher," in other words, must have a "synthetic" mind, as opposed to the "analytical" mind of the "bug-finder." To be sure, the same person could excel at both of these tasks, but we are more likely to find that a team can do a far better job than any of its members—if they have the sense and humility to recognize their talents and shortcomings.

概括

SUMMARY

编程不是无差别的质量。软件设计人员常常忘记，专业人士需要的工具类型与业余爱好者不同。经理们常常忘记，编程工作是分成几个阶段的，而且不是很整齐或线性。程序员自己也经常忘记他们正试图用不同的程序做不同的事情。

Programming is not an undifferentiated mass. Software designers often forget that professionals need different types of tools than do amateurs. Managers often forget that programming work breaks up into stages, and not very neatly or linearly at that. And programmers themselves often forget they are trying to do different things with different programs.

编程的多样性导致软件设计人员、管理人员和程序员的工作变得混乱和复杂。但对我们来说最重要的是，它导致了编程心理学研究的混乱和复杂化。正如我们不能绝对地说什么是“好程序”一样，我们也不能说什么是“好程序员”、“好编程经理”，或者就此而言，“一个好软件”。结果，我们将被迫通过降低话语水平来提升对编程的讨论：如果我们深入到比通常在“是什么使一个好的程序员。”

The variegated nature of programming leads to confusion and complication in the work of software designers, managers, and programmers. But most important for us, it leads to confusion and complication in the psychological study of programming. Just as we could not say in absolute terms what is a "good program," we cannot say what is a "good programmer," "a good programming manager," or, for that matter, "a good piece of software." As a result, we shall be forced to elevate the discussion of programming by lowering the level of discourse: we shall only be able to make conclusions of general validity if we get down to much more detail than is usually found in discussions of "what makes a good programmer." And perhaps we shall find that what makes a good programmer is much like what makes a good friendship—a mutual recognition and encouragement of individuality.

问题

QUESTIONS

对于经理

For Managers

 

1. 你参加过“执行”编程课程吗？描述你做了什么，以及它与专业程序员的工作有什么关系。还请描述课程中任何误导您了解编程本质的做法。

1. Have you ever taken an "executive" programming course? Describe what you did, and how it relates to the job of the professional programmer. Also describe any practices in the course which misled you as to the nature of programming.

2. 你如何估计编程任务的复杂性？通过检查规格？通过听指定的程序员告诉你什么？通过采纳一些有见地的意见？

2. How do you estimate the complexity of a programming assignment? By examining the specifications? By listening to what the assigned programmer tells you? By taking several informed opinions?

3. 就以下各项的相对重要性而言，您的作业有多明确？

3. How explicit are your assignments in terms of the relative importance of the following?

   • 日程

   • Schedule

   • 规格

   • Specifications

   • 速度

   • Speed

   • 空间

   • Space

   • 文档

   • Documentation

   • 其他因素

   • Other factors

4. 描述您当前项目计划的工作顺序。实际工作是否按原计划进行？您希望它以这种方式继续下去吗？

4. Describe the sequence of work planned for your current project. Is the actual work proceeding according to the original scheme? Do you expect it to continue in this manner?

5. 你的进度报告方案与正在进行的编程工作的实际情况有多接近？您必须进行哪些检查才能确定它是否符合现实？您的方案是否通过强制程序员以符合方案而不是当前任务需要的模式工作来实现与现实的对应？

5. How close is your progress reporting scheme to the reality of the programming work that goes on? What checks do you have to find out if it corresponds to reality? Does your scheme achieve correspondence to reality by forcing programmers to work in patterns that conform to the scheme rather than to the needs of their current task?

6. 作为经理，您采取什么措施来平衡关键设施的负载？

6. What steps do you take as manager to level the load on critical facilities?

对于程序员

For Programmers

 

1.你是专业程序员吗？是什么让你成为一名专业的程序员？

1. Are you a professional programmer? What is it that makes you a professional programmer?

2. 列出您的软件为您做的事情，十五年前您必须自己做这些事情。或者您对十五年前的软件是什么样子一无所知？您认为专业人士应该了解该行业的历史吗？

2. Make a list of things your software does for you that fifteen years ago you would have had to do for yourself. Or don't you know anything about what software was like fifteen years ago? Do you think a professional should know something about the history of the profession?

3. 你的编程是一种平衡的努力，还是倾向于偏爱你最喜欢的工作？你采取了哪些措施来提高你在那些你薄弱或你不喜欢工作的领域的表现？或者，您正在采取哪些步骤来确保您可以在您擅长的领域发挥最大的作用？

3. Is your programming a balanced effort, or do you tend to favor the work you like best? What steps are you taking to improve your performance in those areas where you are weak or where you dislike the work? Or, alternatively, what steps are you taking to ensure you can work most in those areas where you excel?

4. 您当前项目的目标是什么？按重要性列出它们，并询问您的经理他是否会在没有看到您的情况下列出类似的列表。然后比较列表，并报告差异。

4. What are the objectives on your current project? Make a list of them, in order of importance, and ask your manager if he will make a similar list without seeing yours. Then compare the lists, and report on the differences.

5.当你的机器停机一天或更长时间，你怎么办，以至于你无法进行任何调试运行？

5. What do you do when your machine is down for a day or more, so that you cannot make any debugging runs?

6. 你最擅长以下哪项？

6. Which of the following do you do best?

   • 检测输出中的细微错误。

   • Detect subtle errors in output.

   • 一旦检测到代码中的错误，就定位它们。

   • Locate errors in the code, once they have been detected.

   • 选择简单有效的矫正方法。

   • Choose corrections that are simple and effective.

你如何克服其他两个方面的不足？

What do you do to overcome your deficiencies in the other two areas?

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Rosen, S., ed., Programming Systems and Languages，纽约，McGraw-Hill，1967 年。

Rosen, S., ed., Programming Systems and Languages, New York, McGraw-Hill, 1967.

Rosen 收集并注释了大部分关于计算机软件的重要原始论文，尤其是语言和编译器。初级专业程序员可以使用该集合来了解是什么使他的职业达到了今天的水平。

Rosen has collected and annotated most of the important original papers on computer software, particularly languages and compilers. The collection can be used by the beginning professional programmer to get a sense of what has brought his profession to the point in which he finds it today.

Sammet, Jean E.，编程语言：历史和基础，Englewood Cliffs，新泽西州，Prentice-Hall，1969 年。

Sammet, Jean E., Programming Languages: History and Fundamentals, Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Prentice-Hall, 1969.

鉴于罗森回到原始论文，萨米特试图通过将所有主要和次要的工作纳入一个连贯的模式来赋予历史感。她的方法之所以有价值，有两个原因。首先，在尝试将模式带入这个大杂烩中时，她成功地展示了编程工作模式的真正丰富性和复杂性。这种方法的第二个价值与第一个价值相关，因为像罗森这样只收录最好和最成功作品的合集往往给人的印象是进行的实验要少得多。Sammet 成功地抓住了主宰软件开发的试错法（错误多于试验）。当然，即使是她也无法捕捉到所有（很高兴）从未发表过的错误的味道。我能想到一个，叫做 MYSTIC，

Whereas Rosen goes back to the original papers, Sammet tries to give the sense of history by bringing all work, major and minor, into one coherent pattern. Her approach is valuable for two reasons. First, in attempting to bring pattern to this potpourri, she succeeds in displaying how rich and complex the pattern of programming work really is. The second value to this approach is related to the first, for a collection such as Rosen's of only the best and most successful work tends to give the impression that there was much less experimenting going on. Sammet successfully captures the flavor of trial and error (more error than trial) which has dominated software development. Of course, even she fails to capture the flavor of all the errors which were (happily) never published. I can think of one, called MYSTIC, which was so bad that it should be resurrected for the educational purposes that only a horrible example can serve.

Metzger, Phillip W.，编程项目管理指南，IBM 联邦系统部，1970 年 4 月。

Metzger, Phillip W., Programming Project Management Guide, IBM Federal Systems Division, April 1970.

Lecht, Charles P.，计算机编程项目的管理，美国管理协会，1967 年。

Lecht, Charles P., The Management of Computer Programming Projects, American Management Association, Inc., 1967.

这两份文件代表了编程项目管理管理学派的公平样本。Metzger 的书是关于编程项目管理的 IBM 内部课程的指南——该课程由 Al Pietrasanta 和 Joel Aron 发起，也是最初的指南之一。Lecht 卷是美国管理协会在同一主题上所做的努力。这两卷都包含有用的信息，以及管理上的鼓舞人心的谈话。然而，他们所采取的有利位置，从梅茨格收藏的最后一页中摘录的这句话得到了很好的描述：

These two documents represent a fair sample of the management school of programming project management. Metzger's book is a guide for an IBM internal course on programming project management—a course originated by Al Pietrasanta and Joel Aron, and one of the original guides. The Lecht volume is the effort of the American Management Association on the same subject. Both volumes contain useful information, as well as management pep-talk. The vantage point they take, however, is well characterized by this sentence taken from the last page of the Metzger collection:

“你知道，想在管理以外的其他领域工作并不是犯罪。”

"You know, it's no crime to want to work in some field other than management."

 

你几乎期望下一句话是：

You almost expect the next sentence to read:

“为什么我最好的一些朋友不是经理。”

"Why some of my best friends aren't managers."

 

考虑到经理思想中的这种精英主义暗流——或者更准确地说，是为经理准备课程的员工思想——难怪典型的编程项目管理观点与程序员的个性及其任务？

Given this elitist undercurrent in the thought of managers—or, to be more precise, of the staff people who prepare courses for managers—is it any wonder that the typical project management view of programming is rather remote from the individuality of the programmer and his task?

Williams, RJ, Biochemical Individuality , New York, Wiley, 1956。

Williams, R. J., Biochemical Individuality, New York, Wiley, 1956.

威廉姆斯关于身体层面的个性的高度个性化的书应该是所有那些遭受“所有程序员看起来都一样”的错觉的人的必读之物。我们真的能理解有些人有三个肾脏而有些人只有一个，然后仍然相信每个程序员应该花相同的时间来做同样的工作吗？

Williams' highly individual book on individuality at the physical level should be required reading for all those who suffer from the illusion that "all programmers look alike." Can we really comprehend that some people have three kidneys and some have one and then still believe that each programmer should take the same amount of time to do the same job?

Tyler, L. E„人类差异心理学，第 3 版，纽约，Appleton-Century-Crofts，1965 年。

Tyler, L. E„ The Psychology of Human Differences, 3rd ed., New York, Appleton-Century-Crofts, 1965.

泰勒在心理层面为人类所做的，就像威廉姆斯在身体层面所做的一样。这两本书在 1956 年即 FORTRAN 诞生的那一年问世是巧合吗？

Tyler does for humans at the psychological level what Williams does at the physical level. Is it a coincidence that both of these books saw the light in 1956, the year FORTRAN was born?

第 7 章评论：编程任务的变化

Comments on Chapter 7: Variations in the Programming Task

“编程不是无差别的质量。” 今天，也许，我不会想写这一章，因为编程任务的多样性是如此之大，结论对任何观察者来说都是显而易见的。或者应该是。

"Programming is not an undifferentiated mass." Today, perhaps, I wouldn't have thought to write this chapter, for the diversity of programming tasks is so much greater that the conclusion is obvious to any observer. Or should be.

大约在第一版准备期间，Ed Schulman 和我扩展了本章中描述的实验，以衡量除高效程序和快速编程之外的其他维度。从时间的角度来看，带着一点谦逊，我不得不说这些实验是我所见过的关于编程心理学的最重要的实验。我们展示的是，程序员几乎可以做他们被要求做的任何事情。（当然，这并不意味着他们可以像一些经理希望相信的那样，做他们被要求做的所有事情。）

Around the time the first edition was in preparation, Ed Schulman and I extended the experiments described in this chapter to measure other dimensions besides efficient programs and fast programming. With the perspective of time, and with just a bit of humility, I'd have to say that these experiments were the most crucial of any I've seen on the psychology of programming. What we showed was that programmers could do just about anything they were asked to do. (This doesn't, of course, mean that they could do everything they were asked to do, as some managers wish to believe.)

作为这些实验的结果，我决定我的时间投资的最大回报是在发现和传达明确需求方面。事实上，这个主题已经为那些关注的组织带来了丰厚的回报。

As a result of these experiments, I decided that the greatest return on the investment of my time would be in the area of discovering and communicating clear requirements. And, indeed, this subject has paid off handsomely for those organizations that have paid attention.

第 8 章人格因素

Chapter 8. Personality Factors

 

从某种意义上说，人格的概念涵盖了我们在人与人之间发现的所有个体差异。即使对于人类行为最随意的观察者来说，智力和教育也会影响人格。当我们在前一句话的意义上使用“人格”一词时，我们指的是我们通常用来识别人的个人特征的总和——一种对人的总结。从这个意义上说，一个人的个性就是一个人的身份，这一概念可以通过在一个计算装置中进行的研究清楚地说明。

In one sense, the concept of personality encompasses all the individual variations we find among people. Even to the most casual observer of human behavior, it is evident that intelligence and education affect personality. When we use the term "personality" in the sense of the previous sentence, we mean the totality of personal characteristics by which we ordinarily identify people—a kind of summary of the person. In this sense, one's personality is one's identity, a concept which is neatly illustrated by a study done in one computing installation.

疯狂轰炸机

THE MAD BOMBER

在远程批处理环境中，机房中的操作员可能很少（如果有的话）直接与他们运行其作业的程序员进行交互。在这种情况下，我们可能会认为运营商对他们的程序员的个性了解不多，但事实并非如此。人格是构成我们个性的因素的总和，体现在我们所做或所说的一切中。特别是，它反映在我们的程序中，更具体地说，反映在这些程序对机器操作员的看法中。

In a remote batch environment, the operators in the machine room may rarely, if ever, interact directly with the programmers whose jobs they run. Under the circumstances, we might expect that operators will not know much about the personalities of their programmers, but this is not the case. Personality, being the totality of factors contributing to our individuality, is displayed in everything we do or say. In particular, it is reflected in our programs, and, even more particularly, in how those programs look to the machine operators.

首席系统程序员，由于其职责的性质，与程序员和操作员都有面对面的接触，他观察到操作员经常对某些程序员发表贬低性的评论。当他参加我们的“计算机编程心理学”研讨会时，他决定研究这些评论，着眼于将它们与特定的编程实践联系起来。然而，他最有趣的发现与两个程序员的性格有关。

The chief systems programmer, who, by the nature of his duties, was in face-to-face contact with both programmers and operators, had observed that the operators often had disparaging comments to make about certain programmers. As he was attending our seminar on "The Psychology of Computer Programming," he decided to study these comments with an eye to correlating them with specific programming practices. His most interesting findings, however, had to do with the personalities of two of the programmers.

在使用这台机器的七十多个程序员中，这两个在所有操作员的评论中脱颖而出。即使是在不同班次工作因此没有机会讨论此类问题的操作员也认为这两个程序员比其他任何一个都差。经过进一步调查，首席系统程序员发现，这些意见主要是基于整个系统的异常终止——转储和“炸毁”而形成的。这种异常终止是极其罕见的事件——除了这两个人的工作——而且它们对操作员来说也是最烦人的。由于没有固定的渠道与这些程序员沟通，每次“炸毁”时，他们只能互相骂骂咧咧。

Of the seventy or so programmers using this machine, these two stood out in the comments of all the operators. Even operators who worked on different shifts and therefore had no opportunity to discuss such matters agreed that these two programmers were worse than any of the others. Upon further investigation, the chief systems programmer found that these opinions had been formed largely on the basis of the abnormal terminations—dumps and "bomb-outs" of the entire system. Such abnormal terminations were extremely rare events—except for the work of these two individuals—and they were also most annoying to the operators. As there were no regular channels by which the operators could communicate with these programmers, they could only curse among themselves each time a "bomb-out" occurred.

系统程序员开始保存这些灾难情况的例子，在他收集到足够多的东西形成一个确定的模式后，他采访了这两个程序员中的每一个。他发现，第一个是一位没有接受过任何编程培训的工程师。他的工程团队高度依赖于单个程序的结果。当原来的程序员离开时，这个程序就留给了工程师负责。他对编程一无所知——而且太害羞而不敢寻求帮助——他在反复试验的基础上运行程序，现在换一张卡，然后换另一张，直到得到他想要的结果。在这个过程中，他让操作员发脾气，尽管他很自然地没有意识到任何干扰。

The systems programmer began to save examples of these disaster situations, and after he had gathered enough to form a definite pattern, he interviewed each of the two programmers. The first one, he discovered, was an engineer who had no programming training whatsoever. His engineering group was highly dependent on the results from a single program. This program had been left in charge of the engineer when the original programmer had left. Not knowing anything about programming —and being too shy to ask for help—he ran the program on a trial-and-error basis, changing now one card, then another, until he got the results he wanted. In the process, he was giving the operators fits, though he was, quite naturally, unaware of any disturbance.

第二个程序员——两人中罪魁祸首，在操作员中被亲切地称为“疯狂的轰炸机”——结果是一个完全不同的案例。他不仅有编程经验——他有 15 年的经验。据他说，在那十年半的时间里，他用十四种不同的语言编写了十一台不同的机器。而且，他——再一次根据他的说法——是所有这些方面的专家。难怪他的程序轰炸了系统：它们太深奥了，单纯的操作员无法理解，也无法由他自己编写的操作系统来处理。

The second programmer—the worst offender of the two, and affectionately known among the operators as "the mad bomber"—turned out to be a rather different case. Not only did he have programming experience—he had fifteen years of it. In that decade and a half, he had—according to him—programmed eleven different machines in fourteen different languages. Moreover, he was—again according to him—-an expert in all of them. Small wonder his programs bombed the system: they were far too abstruse to be understood by mere operators or to be handled by some operating system which he himself had not written.

这位专家的程序轰炸系统的次数显然被放大了三倍或更多，这是通过重新提交有问题的套牌而不做任何改变的简单权宜之计。按照他的说法，他的程序出错的可能性很小，连续被拒绝三次之前，他不值得花宝贵的时间去看它们。那时他会冲进其他程序员的办公室，要求知道系统运行不正常的原因。

The number of times this expert's programs bombed the system had evidently been magnified by a factor of three or more by the simple expedient of resubmitting the offending decks without change. According to him, the probability was so small that his programs could be wrong that it wasn't worth his precious time to look at them until they had been rejected three times in a row. At that point he would stomp into some other programmer's office and demand to know why the system was not working properly.

即使在耐心地向他指出错误之后，轰炸也没有结束。在系统程序员发现的一个例子中，轰炸机在三步作业的第一步中在作业控制中犯了错误。在看到错误和如何改正之后，他重新提交了作业，结果它又一次炸毁了系统。回来又进行了一次轰炸，又一次，之后他在工作的第二步中指出了同样的错误！甚至那还不够。第三步重复了整个循环，正如我们可能已经猜到的那样，它包含了完全相同的错误。

Even after his errors had been patiently pointed out to him, the bombing was not finished. In one example found by the systems programmer, the bomber had made an error in job control in the first step of a three-step job. After having been shown the error and how to correct it, he resubmitted the job only to have it bomb the system once again. Back it went for another bombing, and another, after which he had the same error pointed out in the second step of the job! And even that was not enough. The whole cycle was repeated for the third step, which—as we might have guessed—contained precisely the same error.

这两个案例都是个性如何影响编程性能的典型例子，尽管这两个案例中的个性就像老鼠和狮子一样不同。这位工程师的轰炸问题是通过送他去参加编程课程来解决的——给他提供了他太害羞而不敢为自己请求的帮助。然而，对于“专家”来说，教育不是解决办法，因为他坚信自己知道关于编程的一切——或者至少是一切值得知道的——他无法被说服去参加课程甚至听取建议和其他任何人的建议。最终，他的问题得到了“解决”，允许他到别处服务，据我们所知，“疯狂轰炸机”至今仍然存在。

Both of these cases are archetypical examples of how personality affects programming performance, although the personalities in the two cases are as different as a mouse and a lion. The engineer's bombing problems were solved by sending him to a programming course—giving him the aid he was too shy to request for himself. For the "expert," however, education was no solution, inasmuch as he held an absolute faith that he knew everything about programming—or at least everything worth knowing—he could not be convinced to attend a course or even to listen to the advice and counsel of anyone else. Eventually, his problem was "solved" by permitting him to take his services elsewhere, and, for all we know, the "mad bomber" still lives today.

性格变化

PERSONALITY CHANGES

尽管不存在普遍接受的人格定义，但我们可以将以下“作为我们研究人格的良好工作模型，因为它影响并受编程影响：

Although there exists no universally accepted definition of personality, we can take the following" as a good working model for our study of personality as it affects—and is affected by—programming:

人格是将一个人的所有特征整合到一个独特的组织中，这个组织决定了他为适应不断变化的环境而做出的努力，并受其影响。（D. Krech，RS Crutchfield 和 N. Livson，Elements ot Psychology，第 2 版，纽约，Knopf，1969 年。）

Personality is the integration of all of an individual's characteristics into a unique organization that determines, and is modified by, his attempts at adaptations to his continually changing environment. (D. Krech, R. S. Crutchfield and N. Livson, Elements ot Psychology, 2nd ed., New York, Knopf, 1969.)

 

这个定义中的第一件事可能会让一些读者感到惊讶，那就是人格不是固定不变的明确声明。然而，人格具有某种持久的品质，因此如果没有理由改变，人格就不会改变，尽管有时看起来是这样。例如，一个相对温文尔雅、和蔼可亲的程序员开始避开他的同事，并且对帮助他工作的尝试反应相当暴躁。这种行为变化通常发生得相当缓慢，并且在我们意识到这种变化之前可能已经过去了相当长的时间。有时，事实上，产生它们的条件是短暂的，在我们有时间将其确定为“人格改变”之前，行为改变就会自行逆转。但是当变化持续存在时，背后总是有原因的，

The first thing in this definition that may surprise some readers is the clear statement that personality is not fixed. Nevertheless, there is a certain enduring quality to personality, and therefore personality does not change when there is no reason for it to change, although it may sometimes seem that way. For instance, a relatively mild-mannered and amiable programmer began to shun his fellow workers and to react rather testily to attempts to help him in his work. Such behavioral changes often arise quite slowly, and considerable time may elapse before we recognize the change. Sometimes, in fact, the condition engendering them is a transient one, and the behavior change reverses itself before we have had time to identify it as a "change in personality." But when a change persists, there is always a reason behind it, although the reason may not be related in any direct way to the actual behavior.

在我们的示例中，温文尔雅的程序员的变化通过其他程序员的抱怨引起了他的经理的注意。在一次采访中，这位程序员承认他注意到自己的行为发生了变化，但无法解释。经理推测了原因，但没有比这个人本人更成功。然而，几周后，这位程序员不得不因牙痛而提前下班。在去看牙医时——这是他多年来一直没有做的事情——他被告知他的四颗牙齿感染非常严重，必须立即拔掉。拔牙后一周内，他以前甜蜜的自我出现了，他转变的源头是感染对他的健康造成的衰弱影响。

In our example, the change in the mild-mannered programmer came to the attention of his manager through the complaints of other programmers. In an interview, the programmer acknowledged that he had noticed a change in his behavior, but was at a loss to account for it. The manager speculated on the cause, but had no more success than the man himself. After a few weeks, however, this programmer had to leave work early with a racking toothache. Upon visiting a dentist—something he had failed to do for several years—he was informed that four of his teeth were so badly infected that they would have to come out immediately. Within a week after the extractions, his former sweet self had emerged, the source of his transformation having been the debilitating effect of the infection upon his health.

不幸的是，事后比之前更容易确定性格变化的来源。我们不能得出结论说，每当一个友善的人变得不友善时，他就应该被拔掉几颗牙齿。相同的性格变化可能由多种原因引起——身体上的、精神上的，或者完全是男人本人的外部原因。在一个例子中，一个上编程学校的人表现很差，尽管他从他的家庭办公室带来了很好的建议。学校的校长正要让他失望并送他回家，但先不厌其烦地请他吃午饭，让他有机会为自己交代。直到甜点上桌，这个可怜的学生才说出他的妻子——在 1500 英里外——死于癌症的事实。上学对他来说是一个重要的晋升机会，他的妻子也坚持要他去。但是，尽管他努力满足她的愿望，却无法专心学习。不想为自己博得特殊的恩惠，他没有把这件事告诉全校的任何人。如果不是导演的耐心，他会因为妻子的死而悲痛欲绝地被送回家。

Unfortunately, it is easier to identify the source of a personality change after the fact than before. We cannot conclude that whenever a friendly person turns unfriendly he should have a few teeth removed. The same personality change could have come about from any number of causes—physical, mental, or strictly external to the man himself. In one instance, a man attending programming school was doing very poorly, in spite of the fine recommendations he had brought with him from his home office. The director of the school was about to fail him and send him home, but first took the trouble to take the man to lunch to give him a chance to account for himself. Not until dessert was served did the poor student reveal the fact that his wife—1500 miles away—was dying of cancer. Going to the school had represented an important opportunity for his advancement, and his wife had insisted he go. But, though he tried to fulfill her wishes, he was unable to concentrate on study. Not wishing to earn special favors for himself, he had not told anyone at the school of the situation. Were it not for the director's patience, he would have been sent home in disgrace for no more of a crime than being distraught over his wife's dying.

像我们最后两个例子这样的情况给经理带来了严重的道德困境，至少在我们的社会中，一个人的“私人生活”不应该进入办公室事务或被经理审查。然而，由于无法根据症状确定原因是在办公室还是在外面，因此经理别无选择，只能尝试了解破坏手头工作的行为。如果问题的根源确实在办公室，那么纠正起来可能很容易。也许程序员与他的办公室伙伴相处不来。除非他无法与任何办公室伙伴相处，否则可以通过改变地点来消除“个性”问题。

Situations such as our last two examples present a grave moral dilemma for a manager, at least in our society where one's "private life" is not supposed to enter into office affairs or be examined by one's manager. However, since there is no way to determine from the symptoms whether the cause lies in the office or out, a manager has no choice but to try to understand behavior disruptive to the work at hand. If the source of trouble does lie in the office, it may prove an easy matter to rectify. Perhaps the programmer does not get along with his office mate. Unless he is unable to get along with any office mate, the "personality" problem can be erased by a change of venue.

即使困难的来源不能如此简单地消除，调整也至少可以缓解问题。例如，如果一个程序员在与机器操作员打交道时变得暴躁，这可能是由于压力迫使他完成一个他无法找到错误的麻烦程序。如果他倾向于成为一个有主见的人，他可能根本不愿意承认自己遇到了麻烦，更不用说寻求帮助了。不让他进机房，只能是治标不治本，他的毛病很快就会在别处显现出来。如果能够发现困难的真正根源，他可能会得到帮助，而不必承认自己有麻烦。他可能会对这种对他编程能力的指责感到恼火，但一旦发现错误，他可能很快就会忘记它。我们都觉得，

Even if the source of difficulty cannot be so trivially removed, an adjustment may at least alleviate the problem. For example, if a programmer has become irascible in his dealings with the machine operators, it may be a result of pressures put on him to complete a troublesome program whose bugs he cannot locate. If he tends to be an assertive person, he may be unwilling to admit that he is having trouble at all, much less to seek assistance. Prohibiting him from entering the machine room will only eliminate the symptom, and his trouble will shortly manifest itself somewhere else. If the true source of difficulty can be detected, he may be given assistance without his having to admit that he is in trouble. He may be annoyed at this impugning of his programming ability, but once the bug is found, he will probably soon forget it. We all feel, at times, that a strong medicine is worse than the disease, but at least its effects are over sooner.

在所有这些情况下，如果不发现其真正根源，就无法采取有效措施来纠正或调整人格问题。心理意识可以帮助定位此类问题的根源，但心理学还没有发展到——而且永远不会——可以在没有人本人帮助的情况下用于诊断。没有人可以通过观察一个男人的工作来判断他的妻子患了癌症，或者他的牙齿受伤了，或者他担心他不能在最后期限前完成。如果试图根据外部症状对人们做出心理判断，任何管理者都不会成功。但是，如果他以这些症状为指标，在采取行动之前获得更多信息——这些信息只能通过人们自己获得，如果有的话——他的行动很可能会获得成功。

In all of these cases, no effective action can be taken to correct or adjust for a personality problem without uncovering its true source. Psychological awareness can help in locating the source of such a problem, but psychology has not developed to the point—and never will—that it can be used for diagnoses without the aid of the person himself. Nobody can tell from watching a man work that his wife has cancer, or that his teeth hurt, or that he fears he will not meet his deadline. No manager will be successful if he tries to make psychological judgments of people on the basis of external symptoms. But, if he takes those symptoms as indicators to attain further information before taking action—information which can only be obtained, if at all, through the people themselves—his actions are quite likely to be rewarded with success.

人格不变量

PERSONALITY INVARIANTS

如果人格“通过……尝试适应而改变”，我们可以将人格变化作为一个人所处环境发生变化的信号。但是性格的变化——尽管它们可能代表极其严重的情况——并不那么频繁。从长远来看，可能更值得关注的是程序员或多或少不变的个性如何影响他作为程序员的工作。

If personality "is modified by . . . attempts at adaptation," we can use personality changes as signals that a person's environment has changed. But changes in personality—although they may represent extremely serious situations—are not that frequent. What may be of more concern in the long run is the way in which a programmer's more or less invariant personality affects his work as a programmer.

一种流行的人格观点——心理学家和普通人都很流行——认为人格可以用一系列特征来表征。这个人被描述为“保守、稳重、精明”，另一个被描述为“害羞但富有想象力”。这种描述的直觉吸引力是令人信服的，我们可能会试图描述构成“理想程序员人格类型”的特征。由于“编程”这个名称下包含的情况多种多样，因此我们最多只能希望某些特征与某些类型的编程工作之间存在某种关系。

One popular view of personality—popular both with psychologists and with the man in the street—is that personality may be characterized by a collection of traits. This person is said to be "conservative, stable, and shrewd," and another is described as "shy but imaginative." The intuitive appeal of such descriptions is compelling, and we might be tempted to try describing the traits that make up the "ideal programmer personality type." Because of the variety of situations that are subsumed under the name of "programming," the best we can hope for is a relation between certain traits and certain types of programming work.

我们不必讨论各种“特质理论”，因为我们不寻求这种精确性，即使它存在于理论中。此外，如果这些理论存在争议或不准确，这并不意味着它们不具有启发性。例如，经常使用的一对特征是“信任-怀疑”，我们可能会问自己，程序员最适合处于光谱的哪一端。显然，当一个人在调试时，最好是多疑，几乎到了偏执的地步。另一方面，在与他人的任何工作中，最好有一定的信任，因为不信任的人是不值得信任的。然而，在某些情况下，这两种需求会发生冲突。如果一个程序员在“产品测试”组工作，他肯定对别人的程序持怀疑态度。如果有人告诉他，“ 不要费心检查那个。我自己修好了，检查过了，”他作为一个信任的人的冲动是相信，他的工作要求是怀疑。

We need not discuss the various "trait theories," for we are not seeking such exactitude, even if it existed in the theories. Also, if the theories are controversial, or inexact, that need not mean that they are not suggestive. For example, one pair of traits often used is "trusting-suspicious," and we might ask ourselves at which end of the spectrum it is best for a programmer to be. Clearly, when one is debugging, it is best to be suspicious, almost to the point of paranoia. On the other hand, in any work with other people, it is best to have a certain amount of trust, for people who are not trusted are not trustworthy. In some situations, however, these two needs come into conflict. If a programmer works in a "product test" group, he must be suspicious of other people's programs. If someone tells him, "Don't bother to check that. I fixed it up and checked it myself," his impulse as a trusting person is to believe, and the requirements of his job are to be suspicious.

那么，产品测试程序员就进退两难了，但是这个进退两难的严重程度取决于他的其他性格特征。如果他非常需要被人喜欢，那么不得不通过质疑某人的话来表现出不友善会让他感到困扰。但是，如果他比较独立，甚至有点敌视别人，怀疑别人对他们节目的陈述可能不会让他烦恼。因此，在所有其他条件相同的情况下，某些人会在心理上发现产品测试程序员的工作更容易。

The product test programmer, then, is in a quandary, but how serious this quandary is depends on his other personality traits. If he has a great need to be liked, it will bother him to have to seem to show unfriendliness by calling someone's word into question. But, if he is of more independent mien, or even a bit antagonistic to other people, suspecting others' statements about their programs may not bother him a bit. Thus, all other things being equal, certain people will find the job of product test programmer easier psychologically.

像往常一样，所有其他事情从来都不是真正平等的。情绪稳定或不稳定等人格特征会影响一个人对长时间处于任何矛盾状态的容忍度。由于时间段很重要，经理可以通过更频繁地更改工作分配来放宽对产品测试程序员的工作可能需要的严格的个性要求。这种类型的工作交替是通过无私的编程自动完成的，因为没有人会受到对其特定个性的无情攻击——这种攻击会迫使人们“尝试适应”。

As usual, all other things are never really equal. Such personality traits as emotional stability or instability will affect how well a person can tolerate being in any paradoxical position for an extended period. Because the period of time is important, a manager can, by changing work assignments more frequently, relax the stringent personality requirements that might otherwise be necessary for the job of product test programmer. This type of alternation of jobs is accomplished automatically through egoless programming, for no person is subjected to unrelenting assault on his particular personality—the type of assault that forces people into "attempts at adaptation."

那么，通过无私编程，我们牺牲了让每个人始终从事其个性最适合他的工作的可能性，从而以这种方式产生一些潜在的安全性和稳定性效率。此外，效率的全部潜力可能不会丧失，因为我们不可能一开始就拥有完美的个性组合。那么，“穿别人的鹿皮鞋”也一直是培养宽容人格特质的好方法。

Through egoless programming, then, we sacrifice the possibility of having each person always in the job for which his personality best suits him, yielding, in this way, some potential efficiency for security and stability. Moreover, the full potential for efficiency may not be lost, since we are not likely to have had the perfect mix of personalities in the first place. Then, too, "wearing the other man's moccasins" has always been a good way to develop the personality trait of tolerance.

试图让每个人从事最适合他个性的工作，从另一个方面来说，都会失败。人格不是简单的单一的表层，而是贯穿于很多层面。相同的表层可能隐藏着截然不同——甚至截然相反的——内部结构。一个“友好”的人可能看起来是这样，因为他急于在不安全的情况下表现出对自己的良好印象；或者，他的友善可能是他在这种情况下完全放松的表现。显然，我们在从外在的简单观察中推断人格的内层时必须多加小心。

Attempts to place each person in the job best suited to his personality are subject to failure from another direction. Personality is not simply a single surface layer, but runs through many layers. Identical surface layers may conceal rather different—even quite opposite—interiors. A "friendly" person may seem that way because he is anxious to present a good impression of himself in a situation where he is insecure; or, his friendliness may be a manifestation of his complete relaxation in the situation. Evidently, we must be more than a little cautious in inferring the inner layers of personality from simple observations of the outer.

另一个扭曲我们对某人性格的看法的因素是，许多人倾向于向权威人士展示与他们的同事或员工不同的面孔。此外，由于性别或年龄等其他原因，许多人与人的行为会有所不同。一天深夜，在一家计算机制造商的测试室中，一个编程团队正在测试一台新机器时，发生了一个说明这一原理的有趣例子。凌晨两点左右，一名厂长发现了正在工作的团队，他非常不高兴，还有些傲慢地向大家解释说，女性在午夜后不得在工厂工作。这群人中的三名年轻男子中有一名站出来为他的经理辩护——四人中的一名女性。

Another factor that distorts our perception of someone's personality is that many people tend to show a different face to people in authority than to their associates or to their employees. Also, many people behave differently with people for other reasons, such as sex or age. An amusing instance illustrating this principle occurred late one night in the test cell of a computer manufacturer where a programming team was testing a new machine. At about two in the morning, a plant guard discovered the team at work, and he became quite upset and a little arrogant as he explained to the group that women were not permitted to work in the plant after midnight. One of the three young men in the group rose to the defense of his manager—the one female among the four of them.

“你的意思是，在什么情况下女人不能在午夜后在这里工作？” 他要求。

"You mean there are no circumstances under which a woman can work here after midnight?" he demanded.

“没有，”带着权威的语气回答道。“你得赶紧离开这里，我送你到出口。”

"None," was the reply, clothed in tones of authority. "You'll have to get out of here immediately. I'll escort you to the exit."

“但是我们得到了厂长的许可，我们必须在晚上工作，因为白天没有机器。”

"But we have permission of the plant manager. We must work at night because the machine is not available during the day."

一提到厂长，警卫的回答就带了一丝不确定：“只有当经理在场时，女人才能在午夜后在这里工作。” 然后，他环顾了四名小队成员，确定没有一个超过三十岁，这才恢复了肯定的语气。“可是这里没有经理，是吗？”

The mention of the plant manager introduced a faint note of uncertainty in the guard's answer: "The only time a woman can work here after midnight is when a manager is present." Then, surveying the four members of the team and reassuring himself that not one was over thirty, he regained his positive voice. "But there is no manager here, is there?"

就在这时，女队员走上前来，带着她最妩媚的笑容和管理的口吻说道： “可是我是这个团的负责人。”

At this point, the female member of the team stepped forward and with her most seductive smile and managerial manner of speaking said, "But I am the manager of this group."

警卫的困惑是如此之大，以至于他无法控制自己的下巴，在他考虑一个女人，一个年轻的女人，一个有魅力的女人担任经理的含义时，他的下巴只是张开一会儿。当他恢复平静时，他的声音柔和而恭顺。“哦，我知道了。对不起，女士。对不起，我打扰了你。如果你愿意，我会每隔一小时左右来这里看看是否一切都好。”

The guard's confusion was so great that he lost control of his jaw, which simply hung open for a few moments while he considered the implications of a woman, a young woman, an attractive woman, being a manager. When he regained his composure, his voice was soft and subservient. "Oh, I see. I beg your pardon, ma'am. I'm sorry I disturbed you. If you'd like, I'll come around here every hour or so and see if things are all right."

感觉到他的不适，她也将语气软化为一种管理上的慷慨。“这不是必需的，我敢肯定。但谢谢你的提议。我们感谢你所做的工作。” 这是一个明确的解雇，他明白这一点，转身没有再发出任何声音，然后走进空荡荡的测试室的黑暗角落。如果他有尾巴，它就会夹在两腿之间。

Sensing his discomfort, she, too, softened her tone to one of managerial largesse. "That won't be necessary, I'm sure. But thank you for offering. We appreciate the job you're doing." It was a clear dismissal, and he understood it, turning around without another sound and walking off into the dark recesses of the empty test cells. If he had had a tail, it would have been between his legs.

现在，工厂守卫不是程序员，可能不像程序员那样熟悉女性、年轻女性，甚至是有魅力的年轻女性担任权威职位的一些常见编程情况。尽管如此，程序员和工厂守卫都有个性——个性会根据周围人的社会角色改变他们的外表。那么，当经理无法理解为什么一个程序员在他看来是友好、安静合作的典范，而在他的同事面前却咄咄逼人、吵闹，而且通常很难相处时，我们不应该感到惊讶和。

Now, a plant guard is not a programmer and may not be as familiar as programmers with the somewhat common programming situation of women, young women, or even attractive young women in positions of authority. Nonetheless, programmers as well as plant guards have personalities—personalities that change their external appearance in response to the perceived social roles of the people around them. We should not be surprised, then, when a manager is unable to understand why a programmer who, with him, seems the very model of friendly, quiet cooperation is, with his co-workers, aggressive, noisy, and generally difficult to get along with.

重要的人格特质

CRITICAL PERSONALITY TRAITS

衡量性格是困难的，将性格与工作描述相匹配甚至是不可能的；但是有没有什么办法可以选择那些性格适合自己的人来编程呢？毕竟，如果个性对编程很重要，我们不能不尝试就放弃。或许我们可以从对极端案例的考虑中有所收获，即使我们对一般案例无能为力。

Measuring personality is difficult, and matching personalities to job descriptions is perhaps even impossible; but isn't there some way we can select those people whose personalities suit them for programming? After all, if personality is important for programming, we cannot just give up without trying. Perhaps we can gain something from consideration of extreme cases, even if we cannot do very much with the general case.

性格与编程成功相互作用的方式的本质是微妙的，但我们可能可以对性格特征如何导致编程失败做出一些断言。虽然一般的编程经理会说在编程成功中智力比个性更重要，但很少有人能举出那些人的智力不足以编程的案例，但每个人都知道一些性格不适合编程的人的案例程序员的工作。正是在这个意义上，我们可以断言，在编程中人格比智力更重要。

The nature of the way that personality interacts with programming success is subtle, but we probably can make some assertions about how personality traits may lead to programming failure. Although the average programming manager would say that intelligence is more important than personality in programming success, very few could cite cases of people who turned out not to be intelligent enough to program, but everyone knows of cases of people who were not temperamentally suited to the programmer's job. It is in this sense that we can assert that personality is more important than intelligence in programming.

如果我们更深入地观察在程序员失败中所观察到的人格因素的主导地位，我们就可以很容易地理解为什么我们在雇用程序员时更有可能犯人格错误而不是智力错误。首先，有大量的人员预选，这限制了谁可能申请编程工作——即使是编程实习生。部分预选是在明确的招聘政策中实施的，例如要求具有大学学位，甚至是特定领域的学位。可能更重要的是发生的自我选择，因为外行人认为编程需要“大量数学知识”。不久前，外界对编程的看法如此扭曲，以至于年轻人被建议“学习电子学” 如果他们表示有兴趣使用计算机工作。当然，这个标准自动将年轻女性排除在外，因为年轻女性并不是为了成为“工程师”而学习的。

If we look more deeply into the observed dominance of personality factors in programmer failures, we can easily understand why we are more likely to make a personality mistake in hiring a programmer than an intelligence mistake. In the first place, there is an enormous amount of preselection of people, which places limits on who is likely to be making application for a programming job—even as a programming trainee. Part of the preselection is imposed in explicit hiring policies, such as requiring a college degree, or even a degree in specific fields. Possibly even more important is the self-selection that takes place because the uninitiated believe that programming requires "a lot of math." Not too many years ago, the external perception of programming was so distorted that young men were advised to "study electronics" if they expressed an interest in working with computers. Young women, of course, were automatically excluded by this criterion, for young women did not study to be "engineers."

不管这种预选将那些可能作为程序员取得巨大成功的人排除在外有什么错误，它确实在很大程度上消除了智力低于平均水平的人。这样的人，如果他们以大量程序员的身份出现，可能会大量失败，这让我们觉得有必要衡量程序员申请人的智力。但是，是否也没有类似的基于个性的选择过程？毫无疑问，但人格比智力有更多的维度——尽管智力无论如何不能通过智商或程序员能力测试的简单分数来衡量。因此，基于个性的选择不太可能产生与编程需求相关的统一结果。此外，即使学校说，

Whatever the faults of this preselection in excluding people who might have made great success as programmers, it does have the effect of largely eliminating people of below-average intelligence. Such people, if they had presented themselves for jobs as programmers in great numbers, might have failed in great numbers, making us feel a need to measure intelligence of programmer applicants. But is there no comparable selection process on the basis of personality, as well? No doubt there is, but personality has many more dimensions than intelligence—although intelligence is not by any means measurable by a simple score on an IQ or programmer's aptitude test. Thus, selection on a personality basis is not likely to produce such uniform results with respect to the needs of programming. Moreover, even if the schools, say, did make a personality selection as strong as an intelligence selection (and, make no mistake, school success involves a large element of personality), personality is more changeable than intelligence.

事实上，关于一个人的这两个方面，心理学家能说的为数不多的真正可靠的事情之一是，智力对环境的反应远不如对个性的反应。例如，婚姻不太可能对大学毕业生的智力产生可衡量的影响，但它肯定会引起即使未经训练的人也能察觉的性格变化。因此，一个在他的兄弟会时代是一个轻浮的花花公子的人可能会对他现在所做的认真的编程工作感到惊讶；但如果他在大学里连一句简单的陈述句都写不出来，婚姻和家庭恐怕也帮不上什么忙。

In fact, one of the few really reliable things psychologists can say about these two aspects of a person is that intelligence is much less responsive to environment than is personality. Marriage, for example, is not likely to have a measurable effect on a college graduate's intelligence, but it will most assuredly provoke personality changes that can be perceived even by the untrained eye. Thus, a man who was a frivolous playboy in his fraternity days might well surprise us with the conscientious programming job he now does; but if he was unable to write a simple declarative sentence in college, marriage and family will probably not help one bit.

那么，哪些特征会表明程序员可能会失败呢？我们只能根据轶事材料谈论这个主题，因为目前还没有对这个问题的正式研究。然而，我们可以肯定地说，没有能力在一周或更长时间内忍受压力情况的人不是好的程序员材料——考虑到当今编程工作的现实。当然，我们说的是专业编程——工作和时间表是从外部强加的。业余编程并不是一种压力很大的消遣，可能是因为一个人的整个职业生涯似乎并不依赖于在下周四之前找到一个特定的错误。

What traits, then, would give an indication of potential failure in a programmer? We can speak on this subject only from anecdotal material, for there have as yet been no formal studies of this question. Nevertheless, we can probably say with assurance that someone without the ability to tolerate stressful situations for a period of a week or more is not good programmer material—given the realities of programming work today. We are speaking of professional programming, of course—where the work and schedules are imposed from the outside. Amateur programming is not such a stressful pastime, possibly because one's entire career does not seem dependent on finding a particular bug by next Thursday.

由于编程工作的多样性，在某种程度上不能适应快速变化的人可能很难成为专业程序员。程序员不太可能经历一个月——更不用说整个职业生涯——而不必面对他的工作被从他手下抽走的心理冲击，或者至少发生了足够大的变化，以至于他以前的努力变成了垃圾。

Because of the diversity of programming work, people who are not in some measure adaptable to rapid change will probably have trouble as professional programmers. It is unlikely that a programmer will go through a month—not to speak of an entire career—without having to face the psychological shock of having his work pulled out from under him, or at least changed sufficiently so that his previous efforts become garbage.

说到垃圾，编程中最容易识别的个性需求之一就是一点点整洁。我们在这里不是在谈论个人打扮，尽管在一个案例中，一个程序员实际上闻起来很难闻，以至于没有人能在他旁边坐足够长的时间来查看他的清单。我们的意思是让一个人的文件井然有序的轻微强迫，没有它，计算机的纸张生成能力不可避免地会导致悲伤。一个计算中心通过进行测试并选择提交最整洁的论文而不是得分最高的候选人来选择其程序员实习生。

And speaking of garbage, one of the most easily identifiable personality needs in programming is a modicum of neatness. We are not speaking here of personal grooming, though in one case a programmer actually smelled so bad that nobody could sit next to him long enough to look at his listings. What we mean is a slight compulsion to keep one's papers in order, without which the computer's paper-generating capacity inexorably leads to grief. One computing center selects its programmer trainees by giving a test and choosing the candidate who turns in the neatest paper, not the one with the highest score.

编程中另一个重要的人格因素是至少要有一点谦逊。没有谦逊，程序员就注定了希腊戏剧的经典模式：成功导致过度自信（狂妄自大），导致盲目自我毁灭。Sophocles 自己无法构想出比程序员学习一些简单技术，感觉自己是专家，然后被计算机不可抗拒的力量击垮（Deus ex）更好的情节（以揭示我们能力的不足）机器）。

Another essential personality factor in programming is at least a small dose of humility. Without humility, a programmer is foredoomed to the classic pattern of Greek drama: success leading to overconfidence (hubris) leading to blind self-destruction. Sophocles himself could not frame a better plot (to reveal the inadequacy of our powers) than that of the programmer learning a few simple techniques, feeling that he is an expert, and then being crushed by the irresistible power of the computer (the Deus ex Machina).

谦逊的另一面是自信，或性格的力量。程序员的工作是完成任务，而完成任务有时需要绕过障碍物、跳过障碍物，或者干脆将它们击倒。谦虚的人敏锐地意识到自己可能犯错的方式；他的批判性思维往往会支配他的性格力量。现在，尽管没有批判性思维的人格力量确实像没有安全阀的蒸汽锅炉，但没有人格力量的批判性思维就像没有蒸汽锅炉的安全阀。没有爆炸的危险，但也没有完成任何工作的可能性。

The other side of the coin of humility is assertiveness, or force of character. A programmer's job is to get things done, and getting things done sometimes requires moving around obstacles, jumping over them, or simply knocking them down. The humble person is acutely aware of the ways in which he may be wrong; his critical mind tends to dominate his force of character. Now, although it is true that force of character without a critical mind is like a steam boiler without a safety valve, a critical mind without force of character is like a safety valve without a steam boiler. There is no danger of explosion, but then there is no possibility of getting any work done, either.

关于编程中的谦逊与自信的问题，我们从意想不到的来源获得了一些经验证据。在细读我们旨在测试指令效果的研究中的数据时，我们绘制了每个程序员在批处理系统中研究他的运行所花费的时间长度。当研究周期的长度与频率作图时，我们发现我们有两种不同类型的图表，如图 8-1 所示。

We have some empirical evidence from an unexpected source on the question of humility versus assertiveness in programming. In perusing the data from our study designed to test the effect of instructions, we plotted the lengths of time each programmer spent studying his runs from the batch system. When length of study period was plotted against frequency, we found we had two distinct types of graph, as shown in Figure 8-1.

以分钟为单位绘制的工作周期频率与周期长度的关系图

Frequency of work periods plotted against period length in minutes

 

图 8-1 两种程序员性格的工作模式。

Figure 8-1 Work patterns of two programmer personalities.

 

“谦虚”的图表仅显示频率与时间周期关系图中的一个峰值，而“自信”的图表也显示了这个豌豆，但在低端添加了另一个峰值。第二个峰值主要是一分钟、两分钟或四分钟的工作间隔，我们能够追踪到更正粗心的编码或键入错误。

The "humble" graph shows only one peak in the plot of frequency versus time period, while the "assertive" graph also shows this pea, but with another peak added at the low end. This second peak is a preponderance of one-, two-, or four-minute work intervals, which we were able to track down to corrections of careless coding or keying errors.

我们不厌其烦地在其他工作中寻找这样的模式，尤其是当我们研究 PL/I 语法中的错误时。以前，我们忽略了这种模式，因为我们只要求语法研究中的程序员上交有语法错误的运行。当我们开始收集所有运行时，就像我们在“说明”研究中所做的那样，我们以不同的方式看到了相同的模式。某些程序员，一旦他们消除了所有原始语法错误，基本上就不会犯下另一个语法错误。当他们进行修改时，一次修改一两个，他们仔细而有条不紊地检查并键入它们，以便在前几次之后的每次运行都没有语法错误。然而，其他程序员，他们在这个群体中占了大约三分之一，一直陷入仓促变化的模式，以至于几乎总是需要两次运行才能进行一次更正。第一次运行后，程序员会花一两分钟的时间来修复语法错误，如果他倾向于以更谦逊的方式看待自己的能力，他一开始就不会犯这种错误。

We took the trouble to look for such a pattern in other work, particularly when we were studying errors in PL/I syntax. Previously, we had overlooked this pattern because we only asked the programmers in the syntax study to turn in runs with syntax errors. When we started collecting all runs, as we had in the "instructions" study, we saw the same pattern in a different way. Certain programmers, once they removed all their original syntax errors, essentially never made another syntax error. As they made their modifications, one or two at a time, they carefully and methodically checked and keyed them so that every run after the first few was free of syntax errors. The other programmers, however, and they formed about one-third in this group, consistently fell into a pattern of hasty changes so that two runs were almost invariably required to make a single correction. After the first run, the programmer would make a one- or two-minute work period to fix the syntax error he would not have made in the first place had he been inclined to a more humble view of his abilities.

在图 8-1 中，我们冒昧地将一张图标记为“谦逊”，将另一张标记为“自信”。尽管模式确实存在，而且虽然它们是稳定的模式（同一个程序员在不同的程序上做同样的事情），但我们真的不能说这些模式对应于某些标准所衡量的“谦虚”和“自信”的特征心理测试仪。这是一个需要进一步研究的明确领域——例如，不仅在程序员的选择和培训方面，而且在在线系统的设计和评估方面，研究都是重要的。我们可能会在这里推测，“谦虚”的程序员在批处理环境中表现得更好，而“自信”的程序员更有可能在线上大放异彩，

In Figure 8-1, we have taken the liberty of labeling the one graph "humble" and the other "assertive." Although the patterns are definitely there, and although they are stable patterns (the same programmer does the same thing on different programs), we really cannot yet say that these patterns correspond to the traits "humble" and "assertive" as measured by some standard psychological testing instrument. This is a clear area for further research—research that will be important, for example, not only in the selection and training of programmers, but in the design and evaluation of on-line systems. We might conjecture here that "humble" programmers perform much better in batch environments, and "assertive" ones will be more likely to shine on-line, where their assertiveness will not be severely penalized, and their willingness to push ahead will blast them through problems that will leave the "humble" programmer just gaping at the terminal.

最后在编程的基本人格特质中，我们可能会列出幽默感。计算机“确实会把我们所有人都当成傻瓜”，因此任何缺乏自嘲能力的傻瓜都无法长期忍受编程。有人说，程序员的国歌是“aaaaahhhhh”，非常有洞察力。当我们终于看到曙光时，我们会看到我们是如何再次陷入一些愚蠢的假设、一些愚蠢的做法或一些愚蠢的错误中。只有唱到第二段“哈哈哈哈”，才能长久地忍受小丑的角色。

Last among the essential personality traits for programming, we might list sense of humor. The computer "doth make fools of us all," so that any fool lacking the ability to share a laugh on himself will be unable to tolerate programming for long. It has been said with great perspicacity that the Programmer's National Anthem is "aaaaahhhhh." When we finally see the light, we see how once again we have fallen into some foolish assumption, some oafish practice, or some witless blunder. Only by singing the second stanza, "ha ha ha ha ha," can we long endure the role of the clown.

性格测试

PERSONALITY TESTING

我们描绘的理想编程人格的印象主义画面——理想是排除了会导致失败的极端特征——并不是通常的“僵化”人。似乎有一些流行的民间智慧认为，因为程序员在严格的机器上工作，所以他们自己必须是严格的。实际上，恰恰相反，因为机器是如此的不灵活，程序员必须足够灵活，以提供将任何系统的能力与现实世界的需求相匹配所需的弹性。那么，我们是否可以引入一些性格测试系统来帮助我们克服在选择程序员或程序员培训生时的民间偏见？

The impressionistic picture we painted of the ideal programming personality—ideal by virtue of exclusion of extreme traits that should lead to failure—is not the usual one of a "rigid" person. There seems to be some current folk wisdom which imagines, because programmers work with rigorous machines, they must themselves be rigid. In effect, the opposite is true, for since the machine is so inflexible, the programmer must be flexible enough to supply the elasticity needed in matching any system's abilities to real world needs. Is it possible, then, that we could introduce some system of personality testing to help us overcome our folk prejudice in the selection of programmers or programmer trainees?

今天存在许多“性格测试”，其中一些有时被用来帮助选择人作为潜在的程序员。其中一些已经开发出来并主要用于检测人格障碍——著名的罗夏墨迹测验、主题统觉测验 (TAT) 和明尼苏达多相人格量表 (MMPI)。例如，MMPI 是根据部分来自制度化精神病学研究的经验信息制定的，因为他们的人格特征据称已由训练有素的心理学家和精神病学家很好地确定。也使用了“正常”人，但 MMPI 的主要目的是帮助诊断精神疾病，而不是区分各种“正常”人格类型或特征。

There exist today a number of "personality tests," some of which have been used on occasion to aid in the selection of people as potential programmers. A number of these have been developed for, and used primarily in, the detection of personality disorders—the famous Rorschach Ink Blot Test, the Thematic Apperception Test (TAT), and the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI). The MMPI, for instance, was developed on the basis of empirical information arising in part from a study of institutionalized psychotics, since their personality characteristics had supposedly been well determined by trained psychologists and psychiatrists. "Normal" people were also used, but the main thrust of the MMPI was to aid in diagnosis of mental illness, not in differentiating among various "normal" personality types or traits.

很自然地，我们觉得在雇用程序员时，精神病患者并不是我们要找的人——尽管没有经验数据支持或反驳这种观点。然而，是否对招聘程序员使用此类测试的问题不是有效性或适当性，而只是正常招聘实践的道德规范之一。对任何申请任何工作的人进行精神疾病测试是否合适？

Naturally, we feel that mentally ill people are not what we are looking for when we hire programmers—although there are no empirical data to support or contradict that view. The question of whether to use this type of test for hiring programmers, however, is not one of effectiveness or appropriateness, but simply one of the ethics of normal hiring practices. Is it appropriate to give tests for mental illness to anyone applying for any kind of job?

最后一个问题的答案不仅限于编程，因此我们将回避所涉及的道德问题。但是作为选择工作甚至职业的人的性格测试呢？这种类型的典型考试是 Strong Vocational Interest Blank。（Strong 是一个人的名字，而不是一个形容词，表明该测试衡量的是强烈的兴趣。）在诸如此类的测试中，解释是基于对“分数”与从已经从事各种职业的人那里获得的分数集进行比较。因此，如果职业顾问对一名高中生进行了这项测试，他会将学生的分数或概况与被认为是各种职业的“典型”概况进行比较。辅导员试图确定最像学生的职业，然后，大概，

The answer to this last question is not limited to programming, so we shall sidestep the ethical issues involved. But what about personality tests devised as a way of selecting people for jobs or even for careers? A typical examination of this type is the Strong Vocational Interest Blank. (Strong is the name of a man, not an adjective suggesting that the test measures strong interests.) In tests such as this, interpretations are based on a comparison of "scores" with sets of scores obtained from people already in various professions. Thus, if a career counselor had given this test to a high school student, he would compare the student's score, or profile, with profiles considered "typical" of various professions. The counselor tries to determine the professions that most resemble the student in profile, and then, presumably, he recommends that the student choose his career from among that set.

当然，在招聘时，雇主通常对一种或最多几种类型的工作感兴趣。通过将求职者与每个合适的个人资料进行比较，他可以判断该求职者是否具备适合这份工作的性格。现在，考虑到我们对人格与编程之间关系的了解，这个过程可能有多合适？

In hiring, of course, the employer is usually interested in one or, at most, a few types of work. By comparing the applicant with each appropriate profile, he may make a judgment as to whether or not that applicant possesses a suitable personality for the job. Now, how suitable is this procedure likely to be, given what we know about the relationship of personality to programming?

此过程的第一个弱点是可能没有称为“程序员”的组的配置文件。许多公司在没有程序员简介的情况下使用 Strong 测试来选择程序员，通过判断程序员“像”数学家、工程师、作家或你有什么。由于这些判断的基础是纯粹的推测，因此这种选择程序可以通过掷骰子来进行。然而，掷骰子并没有正确的声音。人事经理可以说：“我们使用 Strong Vocational Interest Blank 来帮助我们选择程序员。” 这肯定比说“我们掷骰子来帮助我们选择程序员”更能打动他的经理。

The first weakness of this procedure is that there may be no profile for the group called "programmers." A number of firms have used the Strong test for selecting programmers in the absence of programmer profiles by making a judgment that a programmer is "like" a mathematician, engineer, writer, or what have you. Since the basis for these judgments is pure speculation, such selection procedures could have been equaled by throwing dice. Throwing dice, however, does not have the right sound to it. A personnel manager can say, "We use the Strong Vocational Interest Blank to help us select programmers." This will certainly impress his manager more than saying, "We throw dice to help us select programmers."

然而，现在我们有了程序员的档案（Perry 和 Cannon，1966 年）——如果人事经理真的按预期使用它，可能会完成比掷骰子更好的事情，尽管有很多理由怀疑它。例如，我们在谈论哪种类型的程序员？或者我们会为系统程序员、应用程序程序员、产品测试程序员、维护程序员等提供单独的配置文件吗？

Now, however, we have a profile for programmers (Perry and Cannon, 1966)—and if personnel managers actually use it as intended, something better than dice-throwing might be accomplished, though there are many reasons for doubting it. For instance, which type of programmer are we talking about? Or will we have separate profiles for systems programmer, applications programmer, product test programmer, maintenance programmer, and so forth?

即使假设这些配置文件具有足够的职位描述分辨率，它们是否真的反映了我们想要的东西？毕竟，这些资料是通过测试已经在这个行业的人获得的，而不是我们在知道自己想要什么的情况下必然希望进入的人。对于古老的、成熟的和稳定的职业，假设从事该职业的人大体上应该是从事该职业的人可能是正确的——即使他们可能是被强烈的职业兴趣空白引导到那里的，完成自我实现预言的循环。但可以肯定的是，我们还没有达到编程知识的高级状态。相反，有理由相信雇主对他们雇用的普通程序员一点也不满意。

Even assuming that the profiles are available with sufficient resolution of job descriptions, do they really reflect what we want? After all, these profiles are obtained by testing people already in the profession, not the people we would necessarily want to be in it if we knew what we wanted. For old, established, and stable professions, it may be valid to assume that people in the profession are, by and large, the ones who should be in it—even though they may have been steered there by the Strong Vocational Interest Blank, completing the cycle of a self-fulfilling prophecy. But surely we are not as yet in that advanced state of knowledge about programming. There is, on the contrary, reason to believe that employers are not at all satisfied with the average programmer they employ. Why then should this group be used as a template into which all programming applicants must fit?

在这方面还有一点值得一提——“作弊”的问题。基本上所有的心理测试——当然包括所有的性格测试——都假设做测试的心理学家比做测试的人聪明。事实上，如果我们要对那些被心理测试作为一种职业所吸引的人进行性格盘点，我们可能会发现这些人通常认为自己比其他人更聪明。或许不可能，因为他们怎么能得到相反的证据呢？但仅仅因为他们相信自己更聪明并不意味着他们更聪明。

One other point deserves mention in this regard—the question of "cheating." Essentially ail psychological tests—certainly including all the personality tests—assume that the psychologists who made the tests are smarter than the people who take them. Indeed, if we were to take a personality inventory of people who are attracted to psychological testing as a profession, we should probably find that these people generally hold themselves to be smarter than other people. Perhaps it could not be otherwise, for how would they get evidence to the contrary? But just because they believe they are smarter does not mean that they are smarter.

在某种程度上，性格测试是一种智力测试——将智慧与做测试的人相匹配。例如，假设一名应聘编程工作的申请人参加了一项测试，他被要求同意或不同意以下陈述：“当我过于专注于一个问题时，我经常会头疼，这使我无法工作。” 任何愚蠢到回答“同意”该陈述的人可能都不够聪明，无法成为一名程序员。正如我们所知，编程工作的申请人可能是一群相当聪明的人，所以我们可以假设如果他们接受这样的测试，就会发生大量的“作弊”。但这种作弊不应该让我们担心，因为如果他们作弊成功，

In a way, a personality test is an intelligence test—a matching of wits with the person who made the test. Suppose, for example, an applicant for a programming job takes a test where he is asked to agree or disagree with the statement, "When I concentrate too hard on a problem, I often get a headache, which keeps me from working." Anyone who would be stupid enough to answer "agree" to that statement probably isn't smart enough to be much of a programmer. As we know, applicants for programming jobs are likely to be a rather clever bunch, so we can assume that a great deal of "cheating" will take place if they are given such tests. But such cheating should not worry us, for if they cheat successfully, they are probably going to have a number of the critical personality traits we desire—adaptability to sense the direction of the test, ability to tolerate the stress of being examined by someone they don't know under assumptions they cannot challenge, assertiveness to do something about it, and sense of humor enough to enjoy the challenge.

当然，心理测试人员会否认这种作弊的可能性，或者至少会否认这种作弊的重要性或频率。但是程序员之间存在作弊行为。一家大公司聘请了一家心理咨询公司来推导他们的性格概况，以供他们在招聘程序员时使用。像往常一样，概要是基于一群已经是这家公司的程序员的人——增加的特点是只使用公司公认的“最好”的程序员（尽管一点也不清楚我们想要一个完全由“最佳”程序员组成的编程人员）。

Psychological testers, of course, will deny the possibility of such cheating, or at least pooh-pooh its importance or frequency. But cheating is practiced among programmers. One large company had hired a psychological consulting firm to derive a personality profile for them to use in the hiring of programmers. As usual, the profile was to be based on a group of people who already were programmers in this company—with the added feature that only the acknowledged "best" programmers in the company were to be used (although it is not at all clear that we want a programming staff composed entirely of "best" programmers).

为创建标准而被测试的程序员是根据被选中参加公司范围的程序员会议的标准来选择的。预留了几个小时来进行测试，但是当心理学家到达测试室时，他发现有 60 人要测试，而不是他预期的 30 人。他没有足够的空白测试，但由于这个特殊的人格清单分为两部分，所以通过让一半先做 A 部分，一半做 B 部分来解决问题。在前半部分结束时，论文是交换意见后，心理学家用标准说明向小组讲话，最后以敷衍的问题结束，“还有什么问题吗？”

The programmers to be tested for creating the standard were chosen by the criterion of having been selected to attend a company-wide programmers' meeting. A few hours were set aside for the administration of the tests, but when the psychologist arrived at the testing room, he discovered that there were 60 people to be tested instead of the 30 he had anticipated. He did not have enough test blanks, but since this particular personality inventory was in two parts, the problem was solved by having half do part A first and half do part B. At the conclusion of the first half of the session, the papers were exchanged and the psychologist addressed the group with the standard instructions, terminating with the perfunctory question, "Are there any questions?" To his utter astonishment—since the group had already completed one-half of the test, one of the programmers raised his hand.

当心理学家恢复镇定来询问提问者时，他得到了一个完全直截了当的问题：“我们应该在这一半上使用与在另一半上使用的相同的人格吗？”

When the psychologist regained his composure enough to call on the questioner, he got the perfectly straight-faced query, "Are we supposed to use the same personality on this half as we used on the other?"

面对压力似乎不像一般程序员那样适应力强的心理学家涨红了脸，结结巴巴地说了一会儿，才用幼儿园里最居高临下的语气说道：“你应该诚实地回答问题，尽你最大的能力。”

The psychologist, who did not seem to be as adaptable in the face of stress as the average programmer, turned red in the face, then sputtered for a while before he managed to say in his most kindergarten-condescending tone, "You're supposed to answer the questions honestly, to the best of your ability."

“你把我们当成什么样的傻瓜了？” 是另一个程序员的回答，这时整个房间都爆发出阴谋般的笑声。

"What kind of fools do you take us for?" was the reply from another of the programmers, at which point the whole room broke up in waves of conspiratorial laughter.

程序员的性格测试

PERSONALITY TESTING OF PROGRAMMERS

考虑到所有这些关于性格测试的注意事项，我们可以看看程序员性格测试的一些结果。David B. Mayer (1968) 提供了对 Strong Vocational Interest Blank 和其他测试工具的一些结果的有用调查，对 Strong Interest Blank 感兴趣的读者应该去那里寻找进一步的启发。Mayer 首先适当地提醒说，该工具的作者并未声称它可以预测工作表现。它的作用是引出有关此人兴趣的信息。一个人的兴趣与他从事的工作之间的关系由用户决定。

With all of these cautions about personality tests in mind, we may look at some of the results of personality testing of programmers. David B. Mayer (1968) provided a useful survey of some of the results with the Strong Vocational Interest Blank and other testing instruments, and the reader with a stronger interest than we shall satisfy in the Strong Interest Blank should look there for further illumination. Mayer first appropriately cautions that the author of this instrument does not claim it predicts performances on the job. What it does is to elicit information regarding the person's interests. The relationship of a person's interests to the kind of job he does is left to the user to decide.

Mayer 指出，Strong Blank 确实显示了测试的程序员与一般人群之间的某些差异，他提供了一些可能引起公众兴趣的精选示例。例如，与一般人群相比，更多的程序员“喜欢保守的人”而更少的人“喜欢进步的人”。在用这些引人入胜的例子引起读者的兴趣后，梅耶尔降低了热潮。他问道，“我们能否查看 SVIB 中的个别项目，看看它们是否表明了与一般兴趣模式相关的任何东西，而这种模式应该是成功程序员的模式？对此的答案是否定的。”

Mayer points out that the Strong Blank did show certain differences between the programmers tested and the general population, and he offered a few selected examples of the type likely to catch the public interest. For instance, more programmers "like conservative people" and fewer "like progressive people" than do people in the general population. After arousing the reader's interest with such titillating examples, Mayer lowers the boom. He asks, "Can we look at individual items in the SVIB to see if these indicate anything in regard to the general interest pattern that should be the pattern of a successful programmer? The answer to this is a decided NO."

为什么迈耶如此坚决地拒绝这种单项强项的游戏呢？因为，首先，该仪器仅用于分析 400 个响应的整个模式。要进行这样的分析，必须使用基于大样本计算出的评分键，例如 Perry (1966) 开发的评分键。Perry 的程序员评分标准并非适用于 Strong Vocational Interest Blank 的所有用户，但至少在 1968 年，一项组织调查显示，他们都没有使用 Strong，这是程序员唯一需要进行的任何类型的性格测试得分然后存在。

Why is Mayer so emphatic in rejecting this kind of game with individual Strong items? Because, in the first place, the instrument was only intended to be used with an analysis of the entire pattern of 400 responses. To make such an analysis, one would have to use a scoring key worked out on the basis of a large sample, such as that developed by Perry (1966). Perry's scoring key for programmers is not available for all users of the Strong Vocational Interest Blank, but as of 1968, at least, a survey of organizations revealed that none of them were using Strong, the only personality test of any kind for which a programmer scoring then existed.

在 Mayer 进行调查时很少使用的性格和兴趣领域的其他测试是 Thurstone Temperament Schedule、Activity Vector Analysis 和 Kuder Preference Test，尽管 282 个组织中只有大约 10 或 15 个使用任何这样的测试。鉴于我们对在编程中使用这些测试持保留意见，似乎许多公司做出了明智的决定，即等待更多的工作，然后再对他们的程序员申请人进行性格测试。

Other tests in the personality and interest area which were in slight use at the time Mayer made his survey were the Thurstone Temperament Schedule, the Activity Vector Analysis, and the Kuder Preference Test, although only about 10 or 15 out of 282 organizations were using any such tests. In view of our reservations on the use of these tests in programming, it seems that many companies have made a wise decision in waiting for much further work before plunging into personality testing of their programmer applicants.

即使存在用于测试兴趣和性格的有效测试工具，人事经理仍将面临以下重要问题：哪些测试用于哪些目的以及以何种顺序进行——以及在获得结果后如何处理。由于测试的管理和评分都需要花钱，因此证明有用性的责任落在那些建议优先使用测试而不是更简单、更直观的方法的人身上。Mayer 提到了一个“X 因素”，它可以从简单的访谈中提取出来，他怀疑这与能力有关。正如我们所讨论的，我自己的面试经历倾向于将我的“X 因素”更多地放在个性项目上。物有所值，心理测试工具必须比 X 因素做得更好——明显更好。

Even given the existence of valid testing instruments for testing interest and personality, the personnel manager would be faced with the nontrivial problem of which tests to use for which purposes and in what order—and what to do with the results once he had them. Since tests cost money to administer and to have scored, the burden of proof of usefulness rests on those who propose a test be used in preference to simpler, more intuitive methods. Mayer refers to an "X-factor which can be extracted from simple interviews, and which he suspects is related to aptitude. My own interviewing experience tends to weight my "X-factor" more to personality items, as we have discussed. To be worth its cost, a psychological testing instrument is going to have to do better than X-factors—demonstrably better.

沿着这条线，引用一个经典的（虽然可能是杜撰的）故事可能是合适的，该故事是有史以来根据心理测试选择人的最大努力之一。第二次世界大战期间，美国陆军面临着在不同战线作战的问题，他们很快发现有些人在热带地区表现很差，而另一些人在寒冷气候下表现很差。为了为一个或另一个战区预选士兵，委托进行了一项大型研究，并测试了数百个问题与战场表现的相关性。在这项努力结束时——恰逢战争结束，因此为时已晚而无法奏效——只有一个问题被证明与气候对战斗行为的影响有显着相关性。那是什么问题？就是这样：

Along this line, it may be appropriate to cite the classical, though perhaps apocryphal, story of one of the largest efforts ever made to select people on the basis of psychological tests. During World War ll, the United States Army was faced with the problem of fighting on widely different fronts, and they soon discovered that some men performed very poorly in tropical areas and others performed very poorly in wintry climes. In an effort to preselect soldiers for one theater of operation or another, a large study was commissioned, and hundreds of questions were tested for correlation with battlefield performance. At the end of this effort—which coincided with the end of the war and was thus too late to be effective-—only one question turned out to have significant correlation with climatic influence on fighting behavior. And what was that question? Simply this:

“你更喜欢哪一个，炎热的天气还是寒冷的？”

"Which do you like better, hot weather or cold?"

 

有没有人想过问应聘者喜不喜欢编程？

Has anyone ever thought of asking applicants whether or not they like programming?

概括

SUMMARY

由于编程任务的复杂性，程序员的个性——他的个性和身份——是他成功的重要因素，远比人们通常认为的要重要。然而，性格测试并没有成功地用于选择将成为优秀程序员的程序员。失败的部分原因可能是测试的不足，部分原因是我们对编程本身的理解不足，部分原因是我们对哪些人格因素在编程过程的哪个部分发挥什么作用的认识不足。

Because of the complex nature of the programming task, the programmer's personality—his individuality and identity—are far more important factors in his success than is usually recognized. Nevertheless, personality tests have not been used successfully for selecting programmers who will become good programmers. Part of the failure may be attributed to the inadequacies of the tests, part to the inadequacies of our understanding of programming itself, and part to the inadequacy of our knowledge of which personality factors play what role in which part of the programming process.

尽管如此，似乎有证据表明，关键人格因素可以被隔离并与特定的编程任务相关联——至少在它们拥有的意义上使一个人无法很好地执行该任务。因此，对人格主题的关注应该对提高程序员的绩效做出重大贡献——无论这种关注是由心理学研究人员、经理还是程序员本人给予的。

All the same, there seems to be evidence that critical personality factors can be isolated and associated with particular programming tasks—at least in the sense of their possession rendering one incapable of performing that task well. Consequently, attention to the subject of personality should make substantial contributions to increased programmer performance—whether that attention is paid by a psychological researcher, a manager, or the programmer himself.

问题

QUESTIONS

对于经理

For Managers

 

1. 你有没有遇到过员工性格突然改变的情况？你做了什么，今天在同样的情况下你会做些什么不同的事情？

1. Have you ever had an employee display a sudden change in personality? What did you do about it, and what would you do differently today in the same situation?

2. 你在选择程序员时看重哪些人格特质？在评估你的程序员时，你认为哪些人格特质是有利的？它们是否具有相同的特征，如果不同，原因何在？

2. What personality traits do you look for in selecting your programmers? What personality traits do you regard as favorable when evaluating your programmers? Are they the same traits, and if not, why not?

3. 贵组织在选择程序员时是否使用性格测试？如果是这样，使用这些测试的人（包括你自己）是否接受过正确的解释培训？您是否知道这些用于选择程序员的测试的有效性验证？您是否尝试过在您的组织内进行任何验证，或者为了您自己的信息？

3. Does your organization use personality tests in selecting programmers? If so, are the people (including yourself) who use these tests properly trained in their interpretation? Are you aware of any validation of the effectiveness of these tests for selecting programmers? Have you attempted any validation within your organization, or for your own information?

对于程序员

For Programmers

 

1. 作为一名程序员，你觉得哪种性格因素对你最有用？当你的雇主雇用你做这份工作时，你觉得这个因素对你的雇主很重要吗？

1. What single personality factor do you feel is most useful to you as a programmer? Do you feel that this factor was important to your employer when he hired you for the job?

2. 你觉得哪种性格因素对你从事程序员的工作最有害？你入职的时候考虑过这个因素吗？你正在做什么来减少这个因素对你表现的影响？

2. What single personality factor do you feel is most harmful to you in performing your job as a programmer? Was this factor considered when you were hired? What are you doing to diminish the effect this factor has on your performance?

3. 请您的一些同事为您回答问题 1 和 2。他们给出的答案是否与您为自己给出的答案相同，或者您是否从同事那里了解到了一些关于您自己的信息？你打算怎么办？

3. Ask some of your coworkers to answer Questions 1 and 2 for you. Do they give the same answers as you gave for yourself, or did you learn something about yourself as seen by your fellow workers? What do you intend to do about it?

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Mayer、David B. 和 AW Stalnaker，“在选择计算机人员时使用心理测试”，SHARE/GUIDE Presentation，1968 年 10 月。

Mayer, David B., and A. W. Stalnaker, "Use of Psychological Tests in the Selection of Computer Personnel," SHARE/GUIDE Presentation, October, 1968.

本调查改编自 ACM 人事研究特别兴趣小组 SIG/CPR 主办的第五届计算机人事研究年会上的教程演示。该论文对该小组自 1962 年成立以来的工作进行了很好的回顾，并且有很好的参考书目。

This survey was adapted from a tutorial presentation given at the Fifth Annual Conference on Computer Personnel Research sponsored by the ACM special interest group in personnel research—SIG/CPR. The paper gives a good review of the work of that group since its founding in 1962, and has a good bibliography.

Perry、DK 和 WM Cannon，“计算机程序员的职业兴趣量表——最终报告”，第四届年度计算机人员研究会议论文集，计算机协会，纽约，1966 年，第 61-82 页。

Perry, D. K., and W. M. Cannon, "A Vocational Interest Scale for Computer Programmers—Final Report," Proceedings of the Fourth Annual Computer Personnel Research Conference, Association for Computing Machinery, New York, 1966, pp. 61-82.

Cronbach, LJ，《心理测试要点》，第 3 版，纽约，Harper，1970 年。

Cronbach, L. J., Essentials of Psychological Testing, 3rd ed., New York, Harper, 1970.

认真审查测试。

A serious review of testing.

Wernick, Robert, They've Got Your Number , New York, Norton, 1956。一个不严肃的，因此非常严肃的测试回顾。

Wernick, Robert, They've Got Your Number, New York, Norton, 1956. A non-serious, and therefore very serious, review of testing.

Cronbach, Lee J. 和 Goldine C. Gleser，心理测试和人事决策，第 2 版，厄巴纳，伊利诺伊大学出版社，1965 年。

Cronbach, Lee J., and Goldine C. Gleser, Psychological Tests and Personnel Decisions, 2nd ed., Urbana, University of Illinois Press, 1965.

即使对心理测试进行了正确的应用和分析，经理仍面临着做出并非由测试结果唯一决定的人事决定。或者，他必须决定要进行哪些测试，以及是否要进行测试。这些都不是容易的决定，也没有神奇的答案，但这本书对一些问题进行了艰苦的、通常是数学的审视。

Even given the correct application and analysis of a psychological test, the manager is faced with making a personnel decision which is not uniquely determined by the test outcome. Or, alternatively, he must decide which tests to give, and whether to test at all. These are not easy decisions, and there are no magic answers, but this book takes a hard, and often mathematical, look at some of the problems.

Hall, CS 和 G. Lindzey，《人格理论》，第 2 版，纽约，Wiley，1970 年。

Hall, C. S., and G. Lindzey, Theories of Personality, 2nd ed., New York, Wiley, 1970.

有相当多的人格理论，毫无疑问，每一种理论都包含了不止一点点的真理，以及对程序员和编程经理的不止一克的见解。Hall 和 Lindzey 对 12 种最著名的人格理论进行了公正的描述和批判性分析，他们的书似乎是非心理学家开始探索这一领域的好地方。

There are rather many theories of personality, each of which, no doubt, contains more than a grain of truth and more than a gram of insights for the programmer and programming manager. Hall and Lindzey give fair descriptions and critical analyses of twelve of the most prominent personality theories, and their book seems a good place to start exploring this field for the non-psychologist.

White, RH,生活在进步：人格自然成长的研究。第二版。, 纽约，霍尔特、莱因哈特和温斯顿，1966 年。

White, R. H., Lives in Progress: A study of the Natural Growth of Personality. 2nd ed., New York, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1966.

很多关于人格发展的工作都集中在成长中的孩子身上，在我们开始招募儿童程序员之前，这对我们没有多大用处。然而，怀特对成年人的人格发展很感兴趣。由于他大约在大学毕业时开始接触案例——许多程序员开始第一份工作的时间——编程经理对这本书的兴趣超出了一般人的兴趣。

Much of the work on the development of personality has concentrated on the growing child, which is not much use to us until the time comes when we start recruiting child programmers. White, however, is interested in the development of personality in adults. Since he picks up his cases starting about at college graduation—the time when many programmers are taking their first jobs—this book is of more than average interest to programming managers.

White, R. W„异常人格，第 3 版。，纽约，罗纳德，1964 年。

White, R. W„ The Abnormal Personality, 3rd ed., New York, Ronald, 1964.

为了阻止编程经理如此迅速地将他们不了解其个性的人贴上“疯狂”的标签，怀特编写了这本谨慎的教科书，给出了许多“正常”个性范围之外的人的案例。像这样的书，与过度流行的管理“心理学”相反，需要制服即时心理治疗运动。

To discourage programming managers from being so quick to label as "crazy" people whose personalities they do not understand, White has written this careful textbook, giving a number of cases of people outside the "normal" range of personalities. Books such as these, as opposed to over-popularized accounts of management "psychology," are needed to subdue the instant psychotherapy movement.

第 8 章：人格因素的评论

Comments on Chapter 8: Personality Factors

如果我今天从头开始写《计算机程序设计心理学》，这一章变化最大，因为这是我在过去 25 年中学到最多的地方。首先，Isabel Briggs Myers 在 1980 年发表了她的 Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI)，这让我放弃了所有其他与编程无关的性格测试理论。然后，在 1984 年，David Kiersey 和 Marilyn Bates 发表了他们的相关气质理论，该理论与 MBTI 一样，处理“正常”人格差异。从那以后，我和其他人在软件业务的背景下探索了这种个性化方法。

Were I writing The Psychology of Computer Programming from scratch today, this chapter would change the most, for this is where I have learned the most in the past twenty-five years. First of all, Isabel Briggs Myers published her Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) in 1980, causing me to drop all other personality testing theories as of slight relevance to programming. Then, in 1984, David Kiersey and Marilyn Bates published their related theory of temperaments, which, like the MBTI, deals with "normal" personality differences. I and others have since explored this approach to personality in the context of the software business.

同一时期，我师从弗吉尼亚·萨提亚，了解“不一致”的人格立场——当压力超出“正常”范围时的应对方式。MBTI 和 Satir 的应对立场理论彻底改变了我在人类行为领域的思考、培训和咨询。

During the same period, I studied with Virginia Satir, learning about "incongruent" personality stances—ways of coping when stress grows beyond the "normal" range. The MBTI and Satir's theory of coping stances have revolutionized my thinking, training, and consulting in the area of human behavior.

最近，我有一个亲身经历，印证了我当时所知道的一些心理测试知识。我患有模糊、神秘的症状，这让我的医生很沮丧，他们把我送到了一位有执照的心理学家那里接受精神疾病测试。心理学家管理了 MMPI，并得出结论说我是个酒鬼。因为我这辈子只喝过一次酒（即使是在我 12 岁的新年），我否认了她的结论。当然，我的否认只会让她更加坚信我是个酒鬼。当然，她的信念只会巩固我的信念，即 MMPI 应用于一个理智的人时是胡说八道。（而且，哦，是的，我原来患有一种罕见的癌症——胸腺癌。）

Recently, I had a personal experience that affirmed something I did know about psychological testing back then. I was suffering from vague, mysterious symptoms, so frustrating to my physicians they sent me to a licensed psychologist to be tested for mental illness. The psychologist administered the MMPI and concluded that I was an alcoholic. Inasmuch as I had taken only one alcoholic drink in my life (on New Years Even when I was 12), I denied her conclusion. My denial, of course, only solidified her conviction I was an alcoholic. Her conviction, of course, only solidified my conviction the MMPI was nonsense when applied to a sane person. (And, oh yes, I turned out to have a rare cancer—thymic carcinoma.)

早在我第一次写这本书时，我就预测“......对人格主题的关注应该对提高程序员的表现做出重大贡献——无论这种关注是由心理学研究人员、经理还是程序员本人给予的。” 尽管当时我对人格几乎一无所知，但事实证明这是我最成功的预测之一。

Back when I first wrote this book, I predicted "...attention to the subject of personality should make substantial contributions to increased programmer performance—whether that attention is paid by a psychological researcher, a manager, or the programmer himself." Even though I knew next to nothing about personality at the time, this turned out to be one of my most successful predictions.

第 9 章智力，或解决问题的能力

Chapter 9. Intelligence, or Problem-Solving Ability

 

正如我们所见，与程序员一起工作就是与智力高于平均水平的人一起工作。虽然还没有关于这个主题的正式研究报告，但我们可以合理地猜测，普通程序员的 IQ 甚至远高于大学毕业生的平均水平，而且更成功的程序员，总的来说，平均 1Q 甚至更高。当然，这并不是说智力就是问题的全部——我们早就消除了这种谬误。但由于大多数程序员都拥有高于平均水平的智力，如果我们在编程工作如何受智力影响的背景下看待它，我们肯定会更好地理解编程，无论智力是什么。

Working with programmers, as we have seen, is working with people possessing above average in intelligence. Although no formal study has been reported on the subject, we could make a fair guess that the average programmer's IQ is well above the average even of college graduates, and that the more successful programmers, by and large, have an even higher average 1Q. Not, of course, that intelligence is all there is to the matter—we have long since disposed of that fallacy. But since above-average intelligence is something most programmers possess, we are sure to understand programming better if we look at it in the context of how programming work is affected by intelligence, whatever that may be.

心理设定

PSYCHOLOGICAL SET

对于某些类型的错误定位活动，心理定势证明是一个主要障碍。无数实验证实，眼睛倾向于看到它期望看到的东西。例如，当快速浏览单词列表时，受试者可能会遇到一个实际上根本不是单词的“单词”，例如“dack”。集合的第一个影响可以从以下事实中看出：受试者将这个非词视为词，因为他在词中找到它，因此具有将其视为词的倾向或集合。其次，如果受试者被告知列表中的单词与“动物或鸟类”有关，他很可能会将“dack”读为“duck”。另一方面，如果有人告诉他这些词与“交通工具”有关，他会更经常地把它读作“

For certain types of error location activities, psychological set proves a major impediment. Numerous experiments have confirmed that the eye has a tendency to see what it expects to see. For instance, when looking rapidly over lists of words, a subject may encounter a "word" which is actually not a word at all, such as "dack." The first influence of set can be seen in the fact that the subject sees this nonword as a word, for he finds it among words and thus has a predisposition, or set, to see it as a word. Secondly, if the subject has been told that the words in the list have to do with "animals or birds," he is quite likely to read "dack" as "duck." If, on the other hand, he has been told the words have to do with "means of transportation," he will much more often read it as "deck" or "dock."

任何曾经尝试过校对的人都知道这种固定现象，而任何曾经试图在计算机程序中找到打错字的人都不仅仅是意识到——他是伤痕累累的。在校对等工作中，难以衡量克服成套效应的难度，因为难以获得足够完美的标准文本和难以模拟实际情况的文本。在计算机程序中并非如此，因为计算机为校对效果提供了一个自动测试平台。
