In poetic language, the patterning of the language itself—for esthetic reasons—is uppermost. But what, in programming, is there to correspond to Keats' lines such as these?

阁楼形状！态度公道！与布雷德

O Attic shape! Fair attitude! with brede

 

大理石般的男男女女过度劳累，

Of marble men and maidens overwrought,

与森林的树枝和被践踏的野草；

With forest branches and the trodden weed;

 

你，沉默的形式，逗弄我们的思想......

Thou, silent form, dost tease us out of thought ...

如果我们想大声朗读，答案是什么，因为我们已经知道编程语言不是语音，更不是歌曲。但是，难道真的没有某种为了形式而形式的东西“确实使我们失去了思想”吗？

If we mean to read aloud, the answer is nothing, for we have already seen that programming language is not speech, let alone song. But is there not, indeed, something in form for form's sake which "dost tease us out of thought"?

如果一个程序员不曾将他的程序视为一个审美对象，那么他就不是真正的程序员。这部分不是很对称；那部分很笨拙，没有以适当的方式流动；整件事在页面上看起来不合适。可以肯定的是，粗犷、强硬和务实在程序员中很流行，但在内心深处，每个程序员都知道程序仅仅能工作是不够的——它还必须在其他方面“正确”。稍后，当我们讨论语言设计和程序测试时，我们将看到程序的审美价值和实用价值之间的相关性并非偶然——越赏心悦目，越可能是正确的。或者，更诗意地说，“美即是真，真即美。”

A programmer would not really be a programmer who did not at some time consider his program as an esthetic object. This part is not quite symmetrical; that part is clumsy and doesn't flow in an appropriate manner; the whole thing does not look proper on the page. To be sure, it is fashionable among programmers to be rough and tough and pragmatic, but deep down each programmer knows it is not enough for a program just to work—it has to be "right" in other ways. Later, when we discuss language design and program testing, we shall see that the correlation between the esthetic and the pragmatic value of a program is not accidental—the more pleasing to the eye and mind, the more likely to be correct. Or, put more poetically, "Beauty is truth, truth beauty."

编程的散文主要由参考和内涵部分组成。指称陈述是关于事实的陈述或问题——“那是海蒂”，“这是一个有 13 位和一个符号的定点二进制数。”

The prose of programming consists largely of referential and connotative parts. Referential statements are statements or questions of fact—"That is Heidi," "This is a fixed-point binary number with 13 bits and a sign."

内涵式陈述给出了指示——“停止拉我的腿”，“找到这个矩阵的逆矩阵”。这几种，后面再说。但在这里我们应该注意，虽然这两者在自然语言和编程语言中都很常见，但在编程中的讨论范围要小得多。因此，即使 PL/I 中的赋值语句或声明的数量基本上没有限制，但英语中可能的表达数量要大得多。我们知道编程语言中话语域大小的重要性，但正如我们希望展示的那样，这可能对他们的心理最重要。

Connotative statements give instructions—"Stop pulling my leg," "Find the inverse of this matrix." Of these types, we shall say more later. But here we should note that, although both are common in natural and programming languages, the universe of discourse is much, much smaller in programming. Thus, even though there is essentially no limit to the number of assignment statements or declarations in PL/I, the number of possible utterances in English is enormously greater. We are aware of the importance of the size of the universe of discourse in programming languages, but it is probably most important for their psychology, as we hope to show.

元语言话语——谈论语言——在编程中是最重要的，尤其是在学习过程中，在对诸如编译器之类的东西进行编程时，以及在设计和定义编程语言时。直到最近，编程语言与自然语言的不同之处在于，它们完全依赖自然语言作为一种元语言——可能会使用一点数学。例如，本章是一个关于编程语言的长元语言陈述，完全用英语表达。然而，现在，越来越多的注意力转向旨在促进元语言表达和推理的特殊正式或非正式语言。而且，某些编程语言开始包含强大的元语言特征——使我们不仅能够操纵编程语言，而且能够操纵关于编程语言的断言。尽管这些努力的未来不明朗，而且几乎完全缺乏经验证据，但我们希望能够提供一些线索，说明元语言特征在编程语言的心理学中所扮演的角色。

Metalingual utterances—talking about language—are of primary importance in programming, especially in the learning process, when programming such things as compilers, and when designing and defining programming languages. Until recently, programming languages differed from natural languages in that they relied exclusively on natural language as a metalanguage—with the possible use of a little mathematics. This chapter, for example, is one long metalingual statement about programming languages, completely couched in English. Now, however, increasing attention is being turned to special formal or informal languages designed to facilitate metalingual expression and reasoning. Moreover, certain programming languages are beginning to incorporate metalingual features of great power—giving us the ability not only to manipulate programming languages but to manipulate assertions about programming languages. Although the future of these efforts is not clear, and empirical evidence is almost entirely lacking, we hope to be able to give some hints of the role which metalingual features can play in the psychology of programming languages.

编程语言设计

PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE DESIGN

如果不回顾“天才裁缝莱文”的故事，就不可能开始讨论编程语言设计的心理学原理。

It is impossible to begin a discussion of psychological principles of programming language design without recalling the story of "Levine the Genius Tailor."

好像是有人去莱文找了一套便宜的西装，可是西装做好了，他去试穿，根本不合身。“你看，”他说，“这件夹克后面太大了。”

It seems that a man had gone to Levine to have a suit made cheaply, but when the suit was finished and he went to try it on, it didn't fit him at all. "Look," he said, "the jacket is much too big in back."

 

“没问题，”莱文回答，并向他展示如何弯腰收起夹克的松弛部分。

"No problem," replied Levine, showing him how to hunch over his back to take up the slack in the jacket.

 

“但是那右臂呢？它太长了三英寸。”

"But then what about the right arm? It's three inches too long."

 

“没问题，”莱文重复道，并示范如何通过向一侧倾斜并伸出右臂，使袖子合身。

"No problem," Levine repeated, demonstrating how, by leaning to one side and stretching out his right arm, the sleeve could be made to fit.

 

“那这条裤子呢？左腿太短了。”

"And what about these pants? The left leg is too short."

 

“没问题，”莱文第三次说，并开始教他如何在臀部拉起腿，这样一来，虽然他一瘸一拐的很厉害，但这套衣服看起来很合身。

"No problem," said Levine for the third time, and proceeded to teach him how to pull up his leg at the hip so that, though he limped badly, the suit appeared to fit.

 

男人没有更多的抱怨，一瘸一拐地走在街上，觉得自己被莱文骗了。他还没走到两个街区，就被一个陌生人拦住了，他说：“对不起，你穿的是新西装吗？”

Having no more complaints, the man set off hobbling down the street, feeling slightly duped by Levine. Before he went two blocks, he was stopped by a stranger who said, "I beg your pardon, but is that a new suit you're wearing?"

 

男人有点高兴有人注意到他的西装，所以他没有生气。“是的，”他回答道。“你为什么要问？”

The man was a little pleased that someone had noticed his suit, so he took no offense. "Yes it is," he replied. "Why do you ask?"

 

“嗯，我自己也在市场上买一套新西装。你的裁缝是谁？”

"Well, I'm in the market for a new suit myself. Who's your tailor?"

 

“是莱文——就在街上。”

"It's Levine—right down the street."

 

“好吧，非常感谢，”陌生人说着匆匆离去。“我相信我会去莱文买我的西装。为什么，他一定是个天才，适合你这样的瘸子！”

"Well, thanks very much," said the stranger, hurrying off. "I do believe I'll go to Levine for my suit. Why, he must be a genius to fit a cripple like you!"

 

编造一个名为“天才语言设计师莱文”的故事版本会不会不合适？讨论语言设计的第一个问题是我们不知道该问题的答案。不知是语言设计者是天才，还是我们普通程序员是瘸子。一般来说，只有当我们最终克服心理障碍并学习一门新的语言时，我们才知道我们现在的编程语言有多糟糕。换句话说，我们的标准正在发生变化——在编程语言设计中必须充分考虑这一事实。

Would it be inappropriate to concoct a version of this story called "Levine the Genius Language Designer"? The first problem in discussing language design is that we do not know the answer to that question. We do not know whether the language designers are geniuses, or we ordinary programmers are cripples. Generally speaking, we only know how bad our present programming language is when we finally overcome the psychological barriers and learn a new one. Our standards, in other words, are shifting ones—a fact that has to be taken into full consideration in programming language design.

为什么我们的标准在这个问题上如此灵活，而在其他问题上却常常是死板的？问题在于我们机器的僵化，并通过它们导致我们编程语言的僵化。每当一个人面对一台新机器时，他都被迫在自己进行一些调整或调整机器以缩小所需与现有之间的差距之间做出选择。虽然机器，尤其是计算机，是可以调整的，但它们被改变的时间尺度通常比一个人要长得多。编程语言试图调整原始计算机以更好地适应人类的倾向和局限性，但它们也有更新周期长的问题。因此，

Why are our standards so flexible in this matter when they are all too often rigid in others? The problem lies in the rigidity of our machines and, through them, in the rigidity of our programming languages. Whenever a man is confronted with a new machine, he is forced to choose between making some adjustments himself or adjusting the machine to narrow the gap between what is desired and what exists. Although machines, and especially computers, are adjustable, the time scale for them to be changed is generally much longer than for a person. Programming languages are attempts to adjust the raw computer to better fit human propensities and limitations, but they too suffer from a long update cycle. Thus, the user is faced with the choice of waiting for months or years while he develops his own programming language—a primrose path which many a man has trod—or gritting his teeth and learning to live with what he has.

人文主义者经常争辩说，机器往往会通过强迫人们具有僵化的个性来使他们失去人性，但事实恰恰相反。因为机器是刚性的，所以使用它们的人——如果它们要成功的话——必须提供超过他们应得的灵活性。也许这就是人文主义者所描述的“非人性化”的效果，因为在普通的人类交往中，每一方都给予和索取自己的一份。一方完全给予或全部索取的关系并不完全是人性化的，并且往往会在一方或另一方产生人格扭曲。

Humanists often contend that machines tend to dehumanize people by forcing them to have rigid personalities, but really, the contrary is true. Because the machines are rigid, the people who use them must—if they are to be successful—supply more than their share of flexibility. Perhaps this is the effect that the humanists are describing as "dehumanization," for in ordinary human intercourse, each party gives and takes his share. Relationships in which one party does all the giving or all the taking are not fully human, and tend to produce personality distortions in one or the other.

在对我们特定的编程语言进行调整时，我们很容易对它产生依恋，这仅仅是因为我们现在对它投入了太多。我们常听男人抱怨妻子唠叨、邋遢、败家，当被问到为什么不离开她时，他回答说没有她就活不下去。大多数人宁愿承受几乎任何程度的痛苦，也不愿为了未知的数量而放弃一些不变的伴侣的熟悉。当我们试图教程序员他的第二语言时，我们会看到这种效果。教第一个人不是什么大问题，因为他没有投资其他任何人。当他学会了两个或更多的时候，他意识到这个世界上存在的东西比他梦想的要多。但放弃第一个，对他来说，只是痛苦的承诺，没有补偿性快乐的承诺。

In making our adjustments to our particular programming language, we can easily become attached to it simply because we now have so much invested in it. We often listen to a man complaining about his nagging, slovenly, and prodigal wife, only to find that when asked why he doesn't leave her, he replies that he cannot live without her. Most people would prefer almost any amount of pain to giving up the familiarity of some constant companion for an unknown quantity. We see this effect when we try to teach a programmer his second language. Teaching the first is no great problem, for he has no investment in any other. By the time he has learned two or more, he is aware that more things exist in this world than he has dreamed of. But letting go of the first is, to him, just a promise of pain with no promise of compensating pleasure.

如果我们能够阐明和教授与特定语言无关的某些原则，也许这种情况会得到改善，这样即使是初学者也会有一些相对较小的措施来对抗他正在学习的语言。但是今天我们大学和编程学校的教学实践似乎指向了完全相反的方向。学校似乎没有尝试教授原理，或者至少尝试同时教授两种截然不同的编程语言，或者至少尝试教授一种相当广泛地代表主要可能性的编程语言，而是致力于教授如何在单一语言中进行编程简单的人工语言。

Perhaps this situation could be improved if we could enunciate and teach certain principles that are not tied to particular languages, so that even the beginner would have some less relative measure to hold up against the language he is learning. But teaching practice today in our universities and programming schools seems to be pointing in exactly the opposite direction. Instead of trying to teach principles, or at least trying to teach two contrasting programming languages simultaneously, or at the very least trying to teach one programming language which rather broadly represents the major possibilities, the schools seem devoted to teaching how to program in a single simple and artificial language. The objective seems to be to get the student writing some kind of program as soon as possible—a not unworthy aim—but at the expense of limiting the future growth of the programmer.

公平地说，我们应该回顾一下专业和业余之间的区别。学校似乎主要致力于培养大量的业余爱好者——也许是在假设专业人士能够而且应该照顾好自己的前提下。但是，当语言设计者开始相信业余语言设计的基本原则与专业语言所基于的原则相同时，我们就有麻烦了。

To be fair, we should recall our distinction between the professional and amateur. The schools, it seems, are devoting themselves primarily to turning out vast quantities of amateurs—perhaps under the assumption that the professionals can and should take care of themselves. But when the language designers begin to believe that the principles underlying the design of an amateur's language are the same as those upon which a professional's are based, then we have trouble.

为了了解编程语言设计的基本原则以适应心理现实，我们必须深入研究基本的经验数据。阅读程序会有帮助，但阅读是不够的。当我们阅读一个程序时，我们很少能确定地告诉我们为什么会出现一段特定的代码。要了解编程语言的心理，我们要做的不仅仅是阅读程序——我们还必须观察正在制作的程序。即使是这个过程——甚至采访程序员——也不会告诉我们所有我们想知道的，我们将不得不求助于许多来源和设备来获得比我们凭直觉得到的稍微好一点的画面。这些复杂性的一个原因是程序员自己很少知道他为什么做他所做的事情——这是任何人类行为研究中的普遍问题。

In order to get at the principles underlying the design of programming languages to fit psychological realities, we shall have to get down to fundamental empirical data. Reading programs will be a help, but reading is not enough. When we read a program, we can seldom tell with certainty why a particular piece of coding is present. To understand the psychology of programming languages, we shall have to do more than read programs—we shall have to observe programs being made. Even this process—even interviewing programmers—will not tell us all we want to know, and we shall have to resort to many sources and devices to get even a slightly better picture than we have by intuition. One reason for these complexities is that the programmer himself seldom knows why he does what he does—which is a general problem in the study of any human behavior.

例如，考虑以下情况。一位用 FORTRAN 编写的程序员想要使用下标表达式，例如 (J-21)。他知道关于哪些下标表达式是允许的，哪些是不允许的，存在一些非常明确和明确的规则。但是他不太确定适用于这种情况的规则，所以他做了什么？好吧，他可能会在他的手册中查找规则，但如果他是一个聪明人，他可能会通过这样的说法进行初步计算

Consider, for example, the following situation. A programmer writing in FORTRAN wants to use a subscript expression such as (J-21). He knows that there are rules—perfectly explicit and unambiguous—about which subscript expressions are permitted and which are not. But he is not quite sure of the rule as it applies to this case, so what does he do? Well, he might look up the rule in his manual, but if he is a clever fellow, he will probably just make a preliminary calculation by such a statement

K = J-21

K = J-21

他确定K是可接受的下标，使用这个中间计算比查找规则要快得多。它可能——可以肯定——在程序中更慢，但这不是他此时此刻最关心的问题。

He is sure that K is an acceptable subscript, and using this intermediate calculation is much faster than looking up the rule. It may—to be sure-—be slower in the program, but that is not the question uppermost in his mind at this moment.

那么，为什么程序员要这样做呢？因为 FORTRAN 语言的限制？但是，您可能会争辩说，J-21 并没有被 FORTRAN 禁止，所以它一定是程序员的限制——他对 FORTRAN 的理解。尽管这个论点受到指责，但它在设计或评估编程语言时误导了我们，因为如果说在 PL/I 中，程序员犯这个错误的可能性要小得多，这不是也正确吗？为什么？因为他更有可能知道PL/I 中没有下标限制，所以他甚至不会担心某个特定的表达式是否被允许。

Now, why did the programmer do this? Because of a limitation in the FORTRAN language? But, you might argue, J-21 is not prohibited by FORTRAN, so it must be a limitation of the programmer—of his understanding of FORTRAN. Although this argument places the blame, it misleads us in designing or evaluating a programming language, for would it not be also correct to say that in PL/I, the programmer would have been much less likely to make this error? Why? Because he would be more likely to know that there were no restrictions on subscripts in PL/I, so it would not even occur to him to worry about whether a particular expression was permitted or not.

当我们从心理学的角度评估一种编程语言或一台机器时，我们不能奢侈地把糟糕的编程的所有负担都放在可怜的程序员身上。如果相同的程序员使用语言 A 始终比使用语言 B 获得更好的结果，那么如果他们足够聪明地掌握语言 B，他们使用语言 B 会做得更好的论点有什么用呢？

When we assess a programming language, or a machine, from a psychological point of view, we cannot grant ourselves the luxury of putting all the burden of poor programming on the poor programmer. If the same programmers get consistently better results using language A than using language B, what good are arguments that they would have done better in language B, if only they had been smart enough to master it?

当然，这个论点有一个时间维度，因为一个人必须学会使用一种编程语言或一台机器。因此，对这些东西的评估取决于整个系统，包括课程、教材、语言、编译器提示、编程帮助和其他任何东西，这可能导致一种语言比另一种语言更好用。也许在一个系统中发生错误时从终端发出的消息比在另一个系统中更有激励作用。也许程序员觉得如果他被选择用机器语言而不是 FORTRAN 编程，他会更重要。如果我们要有效地提高语言质量，我们就不能立即排除任何此类因素。

Of course, there is a time dimension to this argument, for one must learn to use a programming language or a machine. Thus, the evaluation of these things depends on the entire system comprising the courses, teaching materials, language, compiler hints, programming assistance, and anything else, which may lead to one language being better used than another. Perhaps the messages coming from the terminal when an error is made are more motivating in one system than another. Perhaps the programmer feels he is more important if he is chosen to program in machine language instead of FORTRAN. If we are to be effective in improving the quality of languages, we shall not be able to dismiss any such factor out of hand.

在某种程度上，之所以很难将编程效率低下的根源归因于程序员或编程语言，是因为如果我们有理想的程序员，就不需要编程语言了。这是一种心理上的困难，它阻止我们直接用机器语言编写我们的问题规范。让我们正视现实吧：人们的思考方式与计算机不同——这就是我们使用计算机的原因。编程充其量是两个外来物种之间的交流，而编程语言及其所有系统工具都是为了让其中一个物种的交流更简单。哪一个？当然不是计算机，因为从来没有人听到计算机抱怨它无法完成工作。

In a way, the reason it is so hard to attribute the source of programming inefficiency to either programmer or programming language is that if we had ideal programmers, programming languages would not be necessary. It is a psychological difficulty which prevents us from writing our problem specifications directly in machine language. Let's face up to it: people don't think the same way computers do—that's why we use computers. Programming is at best a communication between two alien species, and programming languages with all their systems paraphernalia are an attempt to make the communication simpler for one of those species. Which one? Not the computer, certainly, for nobody ever heard a complaint from a computer that it couldn't do the work.

概括

SUMMARY

在短语“编程语言”中使用术语“语言”在很多方面都对人机通信的进步造成损害。仅仅称它为一种语言并不能使它成为一种语言，反而可能会导致错误的类比，进而导致误入歧途的研究工作。要在编程语言方面取得进步，我们必须首先放弃试图用“真实”语言编程的圣杯，因为编程语言永远不可能与人类语言相同。然后我们可能会把我们的追求转移到让编程语言更“自然”，不是在等同于英语或其他文化对巴别塔的贡献的意义上，而是在表达方式和思想之间的协调意义上的表达者。但最终，为了获得良好的“契合度”，也许客户将不得不稍微考虑一下——也许我们最终将不得不改变我们的思维方式以适应我们的计算机。为什么不？人类的其他发明不是都改变了人吗？

The use of the term "language" in the phrase "programming language" is in many ways damaging to progress in communication between man and machine. Just calling it a language doesn't make it one, and may instead lead to false analogies which, in turn, lead to misguided research efforts. To make progress in programming languages, we must first give up the holy grail of trying to program in a "real" language, for programming languages can never be the same as human speech. We may then transfer our quest to making programming languages more "natural," not in the sense of being identical to English or some other culture's contribution to the Tower of Babel, but in the sense of a consonance between the mode of expression and the mind of the expresser. But in the end, to get a good "fit," perhaps the customer will have to scrunch over a little—perhaps we are ultimately going to have to change our ways of thinking to fit our computers. Why not? Hasn't every other human invention changed man?

问题

QUESTIONS

对于经理

For Managers

 

1. 黑板是你们编程办公室的标准设备吗？你有没有拒绝过要黑板（​​或白板）的请求？

1. Are chalkboards standard equipment in your programming offices? Have you ever turned down a request for a chalkboard (or whiteboard)?

2. 您的商店使用的编程语言是如何选择的？

2. How were the programming languages used in your shop chosen?

3. 将您的任何经历与您商店中编程语言的变化联系起来。

3. Relate any experiences you have had with a change in programming languages in your shop.

对于程序员

For Programmers

 

1. 设计你的语言的人是天才吗？从你自己的经历中举出一些他的天才的例子。

1. Is the person who designed your language a genius? Give some examples of his genius, from your own experience.

2. 讲述你学习第一、第二和第三编程语言的经历，尝试指出这些经历中的心理差异不是基于语言本身，而是基于你学习它们的顺序。

2. Relate your experiences in learning your first and second and third programming languages, trying to point out psychological differences in the experiences based not so much on the languages themselves but on the order you learned them.

3. 如果你是一个有经验的FORTRAN 程序员，你能给出下标表达式的精确规则吗？你确定吗？当您不确定规则时，它如何影响您的编程？你查一下吗？

3. If you are an experienced FORTRAN programmer, can you give the precise rules for subscript expressions? Are you sure? How does it influence your programming when you are not sure of a rule? Do you look it up?

4. 成为一名程序员是否改变了你不编程时的思维方式？如果有，请举出一些例子。

4. Has being a programmer changed the way you think when you are not programming? If so, give some examples.

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Morrison、Phillip 和 Emily 合着，Charles Babbage and His Calculating Engines，纽约，Dover Publications，1961 年。

Morrison, Phillip, and Emily, eds., Charles Babbage and His Calculating Engines, New York, Dover Publications, 1961.

除了 Babbage 关于他的机器的著作外，我们还找到了 Lovelace 夫人的评论，这些评论显示了对编程语言的许多基本原理的清晰理解。那些认为知识的进步是单调递增的人应该仔细阅读这本书。他们应该问，在 1860 年到 1940 年间，这种理解发生了什么？也许是因为巴贝奇无法将他的机器的原理与其机械体现清楚地分开，他的作品散落在世界各地的图书馆中并被遗忘，直到他的发明以电气和电子形式被重新发明后才被重新发现。这里也有关于编程语言的课程吗？

Along with Babbage's writings on his machines, we find Lady Lovelace's comments, which show a clear understanding of many of the fundamental principles of programming languages. Those who believe that the progress of knowledge is monotonic and increasing should read this book carefully. What happened, they should ask, to this understanding between the years 1860 and 1940? Perhaps because Babbage was unable to separate clearly the principles of his machine from their mechanical embodiment, his works lay scattered and forgotten in libraries all over the world, only to be rediscovered after his inventions had been reinvented in an electric and electronic embodiment. Is there a lesson here, too, about programming languages?

Zemanek, H., Semiotics and Programming Languages, Communications of the ACM，9，第 3 期（1966 年 3 月），第 139-43 页。Zemanek 是 IBM 维也纳实验室的负责人，当时它正在为 PL/I 开发通用语言文档，这可能是有史以来最雄心勃勃的元编程文档——也可能是最成功的。这篇文章给出了他思想的一些结构，这显然影响了 ULD 的发展过程。

Zemanek, H., Semiotics and Programming Languages, Communications of the ACM, 9, No. 3 (March 1966), pp. 139-43. Zemanek was the head of the IBM Vienna Laboratory while it was developing the Universal Language Document for PL/I, probably the most ambitious meta-programming document ever attempted—and probably the most successful. This article gives some of the structure of his thought, which clearly influenced the course of the ULD development.

Greenberg, Joseph H., Universals of Language，第 2 版，马萨诸塞州剑桥市，MlT 出版社，1966 年。

Greenberg, Joseph H., Universals of Language, 2nd ed„ Cambridge, Mass., M.l.T. Press, 1966.

这本书基于 1961 年的一次会议，但不是逐字记录，很好地介绍了寻找语言的普遍特征。除了 Hockett 的论文外，它还包含至少六篇编程语言设计者应该感兴趣的其他论文，尽管这些语言学家当然不认为编程语言是语言。

Based on, but not a verbatim account of, a 1961 conference, this book gives a good introduction to the search for universal features of languages. In addition to Hockett's paper, it contains at least six other papers that should be of interest to programming language designers, although, of course, programming languages are not considered languages by these linguists.

Bruner, Jerome, Toward a Theory of Instruction，剑桥，马萨诸塞州，哈佛大学贝尔纳普出版社，1966 年。

Bruner, Jerome, Toward a Theory of Instruction, Cambridge, Mass., Belknap Press of Harvard University, 1966.

布鲁纳给出了他的六种一般语言功能，以及许多其他想法。布鲁纳是语言、学习和思想领域最重要的现代思想家和研究者之一，这本书很好地介绍了他的思想。

Bruner gives his six general functions of language, along with many other thoughts. Bruner is one of the most important modern thinkers and researchers in the areas of language, learning, and thought, and this book is a good introduction to his ideas.

Miller, George A., Language and Communication, 修订版„ New York, McGraw-Hill, 1963。

Miller, George A., Language and Communication, revised ed„ New York, McGraw-Hill, 1963.

在阅读本书之前，任何编程语言设计师都不应被允许设计另一种语言。正如米勒在他的介绍中所说：“与推测性讨论相反，对语言的科学研究始于对交流个体的直接观察，并寻找这些观察与现有科学知识体系的关系。”

No programming language designer should be permitted to design another language until he has read this book. As Miller says in his introduction: "A scientific study of language, as opposed to a speculative discussion, begins with direct observations of communicating individuals and searches for the relation of these observations to the existing body of scientific knowledge."

Vygotsky, Lev Semenovlch, Thought and Language , Cambridge, Mass., MlT Press, 1962.

Vygotsky, Lev Semenovlch, Thought and Language, Cambridge, Mass., M.l.T. Press, 1962.

这位伟大但短命的俄罗斯心理学家的作品翻译至今可能仍然是关于思想和语言之间关系的最激动人心和最易读的作品。没有程序员不能从阅读本书中获益。

The translation of the work by the great but short-lived Russian psychologist remains today probably the most stimulating and readable work on the relationship between thought and language. No programmer could fail to profit from reading this book.

Steel, T. B„ Jr., ed., Formal Language Description Languages for Computer Programming，阿姆斯特丹，North-Holland Publishing Co.，1966 年。

Steel, T. B„ Jr., ed., Formal Language Description Languages for Computer Programming, Amsterdam, North-Holland Publishing Co., 1966.

这些论文是关于形式语言描述语言（即编程语言的形式元语言）的 IFIP 工作会议的记录。虽然参差不齐，但对于那些对语言的语言、语言的语言或……感兴趣的人来说，它是一个丰富的概念金矿。

These papers are the proceedings of an IFIP working conference on formal language description languages—that is, on formal metalanguages for programming languages. Although uneven, it is a rich mine of conceptual nuggets for those interested in the language of language, or the language of language of language, or ... .

可扩展语言研讨会，Sigplan 通知，第 4 期，第 8 期，计算机协会，纽约，1969 年。

Symposium on Extendible Languages, Sigplan Notices, 4, No. 8, Association for Computing Machinery, New York, 1969.

可扩展的或可扩展的编程语言是程序员可以操纵语言本身的语言，本次研讨会很好地代表了它发布时的最新技术水平。

Extendible, or extensible, programming languages are languages in which the language itself can be manipulated by the programmer, This symposium fairly well represents the state-of-the-art at the time it was published.

Sammett, JE, The Use of English as a Programming Language, Communications of the ACM , 9, 3（1966 年 3 月），第 228-30 页。

Sammett, J. E., The Use of English as a Programming Language, Communications of the ACM, 9, 3 (March 1966), pp. 228-30.

Higman, Bryan，A Comparative Study ot Programming Languages，第 15.3 节：英语子集，纽约，美国 Elsevier，1967 年。

Higman, Bryan, A Comparative Study ot Programming Languages, Section 15.3: Subsets of English, New York, American Elsevier, 1967.

两篇文章劝阻那些认为我们所有问题的答案是用“真实”语言编程的人。

Two essays to discourage those who think that the answer to all our problems is to program in a "real" language.

第 11 章的评论：编程语言

Comments on Chapter 11: Programming Languages

多年来，编程语言在某些方面变得更加“自然”，与此同时，我们似乎终于放弃了用“自然语言”编程的荒谬想法。这种变化是双向的，因为编程中的许多术语和概念已经开始在我们的自然语言中使用。例如，尽管转储在软件开发中变得很少见，但“内存转储”一词已成为描述无聊独白的一种方式。

Over the years, programming languages have in some ways become more "natural," while, at the same time, we finally seem to have given up the rather ridiculous idea of programming in "natural language." The change has been two-way, as many terms and concepts from programming have crept into use in our natural language. For example, even as dumps have become rare in software development, the term "memory dump" has become a way of describing a boring monologue.

二十五年来我们都学到了很多东西，但我们可能没有注意到学到了其中的大部分。当我重新阅读关于编程语言缺乏“声音-听觉”通道的文字时，我意识到在我写这部分的时候我从未和盲人程序员一起工作过——所有使用声音-听觉编程语言的人时间。唉，在为盲人程序员改进声音-听觉通道的同时，编程语言正在转向视觉——这极大地复杂了盲人程序员的生活。细节发生了变化，但原则保持不变：对一个人来说好的语言对另一个人来说是一种诅咒。

We've all learned things in twenty-five years, but we may not have noticed learning most of them. When I re-read my words on the lack of a "vocal-auditory" channel for programming languages, I realize that at the time I wrote the section I had never worked with blind programmers—people who use the vocal-auditory programming language all the time. Alas, at the same time the vocal-auditory channel is improving for blind programmers, programming languages are taking a turn for the visual—which enormously complicates the blind programmer's life. The details change, but the principle remains the same: What is a good language for one person is anathema for another.

面向对象的语言提供了一个很好的例子。尽管许多 OO 爱好者没有意识到，第一种 OO 语言早在 25 年前就已经存在了。当然，您不会从Psychology的第一版中了解到这一点，因为我没有包含有关该主题的材料。那时，我不认为 OO 思想对于通用编程来说会很重要。1968 年，我曾在奥斯陆与 Simula 的创建者一起工作，我自己也是 Simula 的狂热爱好者，但我是通过模拟开发人员而非语言开发人员的视角来看待该语言的特性的。

Object-oriented languages provide a case in point. Although many OO enthusiasts don't realize it, the first OO language existed more than twenty-five years ago. Of course, you wouldn't know it from the first edition of Psychology, because I didn't include material on the subject. Back then, I didn't think the OO ideas would ever be important for general-purpose programming. I had worked with Simula's creators in Oslo in 1968 and was a Simula enthusiast myself, but I saw the language's features through the eyes of a simulation developer, not a language developer.

当时，我没有意识到 Simula 的潜力，部分原因是我注意到我的学生中似乎很少有人能够掌握新的思维方式。即使在今天，许多程序员仍然没有掌握面向对象的范式，尽管这种情况可能会随着比我更好的老师接手而改变。

At the time, I failed to realize Simula's potential partly because I noticed how few of my students seemed able to master the new way of thinking. Even today, many programmers just don't grasp the object-oriented paradigm, although this situation may change as better teachers than I take over.

尽管技术发生了变化，但有些事情根本没有改变。尽管白板已经取代了黑板，但它们具有相同的基本功能（并且仍然没有足够频繁地擦除）。

Even though technology has changed, some things haven't changed at all. Though whiteboards have replaced chalkboards, they serve the same essential function (and still aren't erased frequently enough).

尽管在当今的个人计算机时代，对句法“罪恶”（syn？）的惩罚已经不那么严厉了，但程序员仍然向他们的机器祈祷。

Though the penance for syntactic "sin" (syn?) is less severe in these days of personal computers, programmers still pray to their machines.

尽管语言水平普遍提高了一两级，但当事情真的开始出错时，我们仍然不得不求助于十六进制乱码。

Though the level of languages has generally been raised a notch or two, we still have to resort to hex gibberish when things really start going wrong.

最后一个例子，“天才裁缝莱文”（或天才语言设计师）仍然是我的读者最喜欢的故事。我们还不知道“是语言设计者是天才，还是我们普通程序员是瘸子”。

And, to take a final example, "Levine the Genius Tailor" (or Genius Language Designer) remains a favorite story among my readers. We still don't know "whether the language designers are geniuses, or we ordinary programmers are cripples."

第 12 章编程语言设计的一些原则

Chapter 12. Some Principles For Programming Language Design

 

已经说过编程语言设计原则的阐明是一个经验问题，我们现在将继续对一些已作为良好设计的一般原则提出的想法进行主要的推测性调查。由于大多数实证数据不存在，所以介绍必须主要是推测性的。然而，这些数据并不一定难以获得——我们可以引用的大多数研究都是由学生在有限的时间和低预算下完成的。真正的问题是心理因素没有被认为是编程语言设计问题的一部分——或者，即使它们被识别，它们也被认为可以通过语言设计者和他的朋友的内省来解决。

Having said that the elucidation of programming language design principles is an empirical matter, we shall now proceed to give a largely speculative survey of some ideas that have been put forth as general principles of good design. The presentation must be largely speculative simply because most of the empirical data do not exist. Yet such data are not necessarily difficult to obtain—most of the studies which we can cite were done by students working with limited time and low budgets. The real problem is that psychological factors are not recognized as part of the programming language design problem-—or, if they are recognized, they are thought to be solvable by introspection on the part of the language designer and his pals.

均匀性

UNIFORMITY

在某些情况下，我们可以从主流心理学中提取实验数据，至少可以针对潜在的编程困难领域提出建议。一个这样的例子是统一性原则。许多实验表明，记住一组项目的难度与该组项目的“信息内容”有关。然而，“信息内容”很难衡量，因为它不仅取决于集合中的内容，还取决于集合中没有的内容——记忆者头脑中的内容。假设，例如，我们要求受试者记住集合

In some cases, we can draw experimental data from the mainstream of psychology, at least for suggestions as to areas of potential programming difficulty. One such case is the principle of uniformity. The difficulty of remembering a set of items has been shown in numerous experiments to be related to the "information content" of the set. The "information content," however, is difficult to measure, for it depends not only upon what is in the set, but on what is not in it—what is in the rememberer's mind. Suppose, for instance, we ask a subject to memorize the set

000 001 010 011 100 101 110 111

000 001 010 011 100 101 110 111

如果他知道二进制数字系统，他将不会遇到什么困难。但是假设受试者知道二进制数字系统并被要求记住集合：

He will have little difficulty if he knows the binary number system. But suppose the subject knows the binary number system and is asked to memorize the set:

000 001 010 100 101 111

000 001 010 100 101 111

现在，虽然只有六个案子要记住，但工作难度更大了。为什么会这样？因为记忆的复杂性——对于了解“系统”的人来说——与案例的数量无关，而是与系统异常的数量有关。一旦了解了二进制数字系统，“记住”前 1024 个数字就像记住前 8 个数字一样容易。在我们的第一个例子中，受试者只需要记住“前八个二进制数”，但在第二个例子中，他可能已经记住了“前八个二进制数——不包括 011 和 110”的形式。我们不必成为心理学专家也能看出第二种情况至少不比第一种容易，而且应该更难一些。

Now, although there are only six cases to remember, the job is more difficult. Why should that be? Because the complexity of remembering —for the person who knows the "system"—is not related to the number of cases, but to the number of exceptions from the system. Once one knows the binary number system, it is just as easy to "memorize" the first 1024 numbers as it is to memorize the first eight. In our first example, the subject only had to remember "the first eight binary numbers," but in the second example, he might have remembered in the form, "the first eight binary numbers—excluding 011 and 110." We do not have to be expert psychologists to see that the second case is at least no easier than the first, and should be somewhat harder.

现在，如果受试者在二进制数字系统方面是天真的，那么前面的论点将是无效的，因为这两个列表对他来说可能或多或少是“随机的”。在那种情况下，六项应该比八项更容易记忆——与更复杂的主题完全相反的结果。

Now, the preceding argument would be invalid if the subject was naive with respect to the binary number system, for then the two lists might appear more or less "random" to him. In that case, six items should be somewhat less difficult to memorize than eight—exactly the opposite result obtained by the more sophisticated subject.

在编程语言中，也存在完全相同的情况。在上一章中，我们提到了 FORTRAN 下标的情况。如果程序员对算术表达式的主题完全天真，我们可以争辩说 FORTRAN 下标规则比 PL/I 或 APL 下标规则更容易记住，因为 FORTRAN 中可能的下标集显然更小。但是程序员也不是完全天真，他们可以通过记住一个简单的规则来学习大多数可能的 PL/I 或 APL 下标：“任何标量表达式都可以是下标”。然而，在 FORTRAN 中，他们必须学习以下七种形式：

In programming languages, precisely the same situation prevails. In the previous chapter, we mentioned the case of FORTRAN subscripts. If programmers were perfectly naive on the subject of arithmetic expressions, we could argue that the FORTRAN subscript rules were easier to remember than, say, the PL/I or APL subscript rules, for the set of possible subscripts is obviously smaller in FORTRAN. But programmers are not perfectly naive, and they can learn most possible PL/I or APL subscripts by remembering only one simple rule: "any scalar expression can be a subscript." In FORTRAN, however, they must learn the following set of seven forms:

一个

a

v

v

v + 一个

v + a

v - 一个

v - a

a*v

a*v

a*v+b

a*v + b

a*v - b

a*v - b

其中 v 表示无符号、无下标的整数变量，a 和 b 表示必须大于零的无符号整数。

where v represents an unsigned, non-subscripted, integer variable, and a and b represent unsigned integer numbers which must be greater than zero.

为了测试记住这些规则的难度，对 117 名有经验的 FORTRAN 程序员进行了调查。首先，我们要求他们说出表达式 (21 - K) 是有效的 FORTRAN 下标、无效的 FORTRAN 下标，还是他们不确定。31 人表示有效，9 人表示无效，77 人表示不确定。作为对照，我们向 53 位经验丰富的 PL/I 程序员询问了关于 PL/I 的相同问题，除了 4 位以外，所有人都说这是一个有效的下标。这 4 人是前 FORTRAN 程序员。

In order to test the difficulty of remembering these rules, a survey was taken of 117 experienced FORTRAN programmers. First we asked them to say whether the expression (21 - K) was a valid FORTRAN subscript, an invalid FORTRAN subscript, or they didn't know for sure. 31 said it was valid, 9 said it was not valid, and 77 said they were not sure. As a control, we asked 53 experienced PL/I programmers the same question about PL/I, and all but 4 said it was a valid subscript. These 4 were former FORTRAN programmers.

在这个测试之后，我们要求 9 个正确的 FORTRAN 程序员写下允许的 FORTRAN 下标的确切规则。这 9 个人中没有一个能够准确地给出规则。在 49 个正确的 PL/I 程序员中，所有人都能够给出大致相当于“任何东西”的答案。虽然这不是一个确切的规则——它包含例如无效的数组表达式——但它是一个至少不会阻止程序员尝试一些有效的东西的规则，例如 FORTRAN 中的 (K-21) . 如果 PL/I 程序员确实碰巧将数组表达式写为下标，他将被编译器抓住；但是 FORTRAN 编译器不太可能告诉避免使用 (K-21) 下标的程序员他没有使用该语言的全部功能。

Following this test, we asked the 9 correct FORTRAN programmers to write down the exact rules for permissible FORTRAN subscripts. None of the 9 were able to give the rules exactly. Of the 49 correct PL/I programmers, all were able to give the answer roughly equivalent to "anything." Although this is not an exact rule—it encompasses, for example, array expressions, which are not valid—it is a rule which at least does not prevent the programmer from trying something that is valid, such as (K-21) in FORTRAN. If the PL/I programmer does, indeed, happen to write an array expression as a subscript, he will be caught in the act by the compiler; but a FORTRAN compiler is not likely to tell the programmer who avoids the (K - 21) subscript that he is not using the full power of the language.

那么，从这个例子中，我们所说的均匀性的意思应该相当清楚，尽管不能给出该原理的精确陈述，因为它是一个心理学原理而不是数学原理。粗略地说，编程语言设计的统一性原则可以表述为：

What we mean, then, by uniformity should be reasonably clear from this example, although no precise statement of the principle can be given, since it is a psychological principle rather than a mathematical one. Roughly speaking, the principle of uniformity in programming language design might be stated thusly:

“无论发生什么事情，都应该以同样的方式去做。”

"The same things should be done in the same way wherever they occur."

 

如果语言包含对这一规则的偏差，它就违反了统一性原则，因此将更难学习，更难无错误地使用，更难用于产生“新”技术。

To the extent that the language contains deviations from this rule, it violates the principle of uniformity and will thus be more difficult to learn, more difficult to use without error, and more difficult to use for producing "new" techniques.

我们通过比较两种语言进一步探讨了这个问题，其中一种语言是另一种语言的“子集”，用于同一问题。这两种语言是 PL/I 的 OS/360 和 DOS/360 版本。DOS 版本不是 OS 版本的完美子集，但在很大程度上它可以被表征为具有某些限制和遗漏（这是限制的特例）的 OS 版本。有 14 名相对较新的 PL/I 程序员使用每种语言解决同一个问题，我们发现操作系统组在获得工作版本方面的难度明显较小，而且代码更短。在分析生成的不同程序时，我们发现 DOS 程序员经常未能使用实际上属于他们的子集的功能。当被问到这个问题时，他们总是回答说，“我不是”

We explored the question further by comparing two languages, one of which was a "subset" of the other, used on the same problem. The two languages were the OS/360 and the DOS/360 versions of PL/I. The DOS version is not a perfect subset of the OS version, but to a large extent it can be characterized as such—as the OS version with certain restrictions and omissions (which are a special case of restrictions). With 14 relatively new PL/I programmers working in each language on the same problem, we found that the OS group had detectably less difficulty in getting working versions and that the code was shorter. In analyzing the different programs produced, we found that the DOS programmers often failed to use a feature that was, in fact, in their subset. When asked about this, they invariably replied, "I wasn't sure I could write that." (See Figure 12-1.)

图 12-1 编程语言及其子集的比较。

Figure 12-1 Comparison of a programming language with its subset.

 

那么，似乎发生的事情是，“隐蔽类别”越多——你不能做或说的事情——人们就越期望语言中存在其他此类隐蔽类别。即使限制在语言的另一部分，它们也可能影响没有这种限制的部分的实际使用。另一种放置统一规则的方法可能是这样的：

What seems to happen, then, is that the more "covert categories" there are—things that you cannot do or say—the more one expects other such covert categories in the language. Even if the restrictions are in another part of the language, they may affect the actual usage of a part without such restrictions. Another way of putting the rule of uniformity, then might be this:

“如果一个程序员问，‘我可以写……吗？’ 答案应该是“是的”。“

"If a programmer asks, 'Can I write . . . ?' the answer should be 'yes.' "

就像经常被告知“不”的孩子一样，使用不统一语言工作的程序员往往会被劝阻尝试新事物。

Just like the child who is told "no" too often, the programmer working in a nonuniform language will tend to be discouraged from trying new things.

统一性的另一个重要方面是，相同的句法结构在不同的语境中不应有不同的含义。例如，我们在 PL/I 中被告知“从不需要多余的括号，但如果需要可以始终使用”。这是一个很好的规则，但不幸的是，它有一些相当关键的例外。例如，这两个声明

Another important aspect of uniformity is that the same syntactic construction should not mean different things in different contexts. For example, we are told in PL/I that "redundant parentheses are never required, but may always be used if desired." This is a good rule, but one which, unfortunately, has a few fairly critical exceptions. For instance, the two statements

呼叫 X(A)；

CALL X(A);

呼叫 X((A));

CALL X((A));

通常根本不是同一件事，因为第二个总是导致将伪参数传递给 X（粗略地说，按值调用而不是可能的按引用调用）。在这枚硬币的另一面，考虑以下两个陈述：

do not usually mean the same thing at all, for the second always causes a dummy argument to be passed to X (roughly, a call-by-value instead of a possible call-by-reference). On the other side of this coin, consider these two statements:

GET LIST(A(I) DO I = 1 TO N);

GET LIST(A(I) DO I = 1 TO N);

GET LIST((A(I) DO I = 1 TO N));

GET LIST((A(I) DO I = 1 TO N));

它们的意思不同，因为第一个在句法上是不正确的——数据列表和迭代规范需要“冗余”括号。

They do not mean the same thing because the first is syntactically incorrect—"redundant" parentheses being needed for the data list and for the iteration specification.

这种句法上的不一致肯定会阻碍语义探索，因为它使程序员不确定他使用该语言的能力。例如，遇到括号规则的这两个例外情况后，程序员可能不愿意在复杂的表达式中加上括号来阐明其含义，或者他可能觉得有必要加上额外的括号，因为他必须“确定”。总的来说，他是会糊涂的，程序员也不应该糊涂自己的编程语言。

Such syntactic non-uniformity definitely discourages semantic exploration, for it renders the programmer uncertain about his power with the language. For instance, having encountered these two exceptions to the parentheses rules, the programmer may be reluctant to put parentheses in a complex expression to clarify its meaning, or he may feel impelled to put in extra parentheses because he has to "make sure." In general, he is going to be confused, and programmers should not be confused about their programming language.

作为统一性问题的一个有趣的侧面说明，我们可能会注意到 PL/I 中括号的这种麻烦源于由于字符集有限而需要的括号的过度使用。这种限制字符集的效果非常普遍，因为任何时候在两个不同的上下文中使用相同的字符时，都会出现不一致性。APL 可能是当前任何语言中在利用大字符集方面走得最远的，甚至达到了对运算符“减号”和数字的“减号”使用不同符号的程度。APL 的支持者声称，由于这种统一性，它是一种最强大的语言。

As an interesting sidelight on the uniformity question, we might note that this trouble over parentheses in PL/I stems from the overuse of parentheses required because of the limited character set. This effect of limiting the character set is quite general, because any time the same character is used in two different contexts, you have non-uniformity. APL probably goes the furthest of any current language in the exploitation of a large character set, even to the extent of using a different symbol for the operator "minus" and the "minus sign" of a number. Supporters of APL claim that it is a most powerful language because of this uniformity.

当然，此类陈述可能会受到实验检验。作为如何进行此类测试的示例，请回想一下图 3-1 中带括号的长语句，它在 PL/I 中有六层括号。这条语句可以用APL重新编码，如图12-2所示（由于缺少APL字符集，不太正确——“<-”用于APL的左箭头赋值）。

Such statements, of course, should be potentially subject to experimental test. As an example of how such a test can be made, recall the long parenthesized statement of Figure 3-1, which in PL/I had six levels of parentheses. This statement can be recoded in APL, as shown in Figure 12-2 (not quite correct because of lacking the APL character set—"<-" is used for APL's left arrow for assignment).

 

图 12-2 图 3-1 的 APL 版本（不完全是，因为字符集）。

Figure 12-2 An APL version of Figure 3-1 (not quite, because of the character set).

 

粗略看来，这个语句并不像图 3-1 中的那样复杂，部分原因是因为有两种类型的括号，部分原因是 APL 的函数形式和从右到 - 可以去掉两对括号左规则。这种偶然的观察可以证实吗？我们通过对这两个格式错误的语句进行多种变体并测试在 PL/I 和 APL 方面经验丰富的程序员识别格式错误的版本的能力来研究这个问题。APL 声明在速度和准确性方面都有明显的优势，这似乎表明 APL 对一致性的声明至少部分是有根据的。

To the casual eye, this statement does not appear as complex as the one in Figure 3-1, partly because of the two types of brackets, and partly because two pairs of parentheses can be eliminated because of APL's function form and right-to-left rule. Is this casual observation verifiable? We studied the question by making several variations of the two statements which were ill-formed and testing the ability of programmers experienced in PL/I and APL to identify the ill-formed versions. There was a definite edge in both speed and accuracy to the APL statement, which seems to indicate that APL's claim to uniformity is at least partially well founded.

字符集的限制只是机器限制导致统一性失败的一种情况。FORTRAN 下标的限制是另一个例子，或者至少是实施者神经失败的例子，他们认为如果下标是无限的，他们就不能给出有效的代码。不统一的另一个来源是对某些其他设计原则的追求，但并非所有这些原则都是有根据的。这些原则中最深层次的原则没有受到挑战，尤其是明确性假设。即使像 Bryan Higman 这样老练的作家也会说：“因为每种语言都必须有一个字符集和一个明确的、可判定的语法……”，但他对明确性的假设没有提出质疑。任何关于 deep 的假设都应该偶尔受到挑战，只是为了保持健康。

The limitation of the character set is but one case of machine limitations leading to failure of uniformity. The restriction of FORTRAN subscripts to another example, or at least an example of failure of nerve on the part of the implemented, who thought they could not give efficient code if subscripts were unlimited. Another source of nonuniformity is the quest for certain other design principles, not all of them well founded. The deepest of these principles go unchallenged, particularly the assumption of unambiguity. Even so sophisticated a writer as Bryan Higman says: "Because every language must have a character set and an unambiguous, decidable grammar . . . ," but he leaves the assumption of unambiguity unchallenged. Any assumption that deep should be challenged once in a while, just to keep it healthy.

PL/I 中 WHILE 子句的语法是对明确性的痴迷的一个很好的例子。跟在关键字 WHILE 之后的是一个逻辑条件，就像在 IF 语句中跟在关键字 IF 之后一样。然而，在 WHILE 的情况下而不是 IF 的情况下，括号必须围绕条件——这种不统一导致语法中的许多错误。看似额外括号的原因是，如果程序员声明了一个名为 WHILE 的数组并编写如下语句，则会出现语法歧义

A nice example of the obsession with unambiguity is the syntax of the WHILE clause in PL/I. Following the keyword, WHILE, is a logical condition, as is found following the keyword IF in an IF-statement. However, in the case of the WHILE but not in the case of the IF, parentheses must surround the condition—a nonuniformity which leads to a number of errors in syntax. The reason for the seemingly extra parentheses is that a syntactic ambiguity can arise if the programmer has declared an array named WHILE and writes a statement such as

当 (I) = 1 时做；

DO WHILE(I) = 1;

对于这种情况，每个使用 WHILE 的程序员都必须使用一对额外的括号。

For this one case, every programmer using a WHILE must use an extra pair of parentheses.

实际上，即使编程语言设计者对歧义有病态的恐惧，它也会渗透到所有语言中。但在大多数情况下，潜入的歧义是心理歧义——这似乎在设计师的考虑范围之内。一个典型的例子是混合乘法和除法，如

Actually, even with the morbid dread that programming language designers have of ambiguity, it creeps into all languages. But the ambiguity that creeps in is, in most cases, psychological ambiguity—which seems to be beneath the designers' consideration. A classic case is intermixed multiplication and division, as in

A = B/C*D；

A = B/C*D;

尽管语言设计者和编译器不认为这样的陈述是模棱两可的，但程序员肯定会这样做——正如我们发现的与此类情况相关的错误数量所证明的那样。

Although the language designer and the compiler do not regard such a statement as ambiguous, programmers certainly do—as evidenced by the number of bugs we find related to this type of situation.

关于歧义，需要做的是认识到有两种类型——生理的和心理的。编译器，当然，永远不会模棱两可。一个人可能将上述陈述解释为 A = B/(C*D)，而另一个人可能将其解释为 A = (B/C)*D，但每个人的解释都是一致的。由于编译器编写者可能有不同的解释（这实际上是心理上的歧义），所以从一种语言中消除这种歧义很重要，这样所有的实现都不会比必要的更远。但消除生理上的歧义并不能解决心理问题。

What needs to be done about ambiguity is to recognize that there are two types—physical and psychological. Compilers, of course, are never ambiguous. One may interpret the above statement as A = B/(C*D) while another may interpret it as A = (B/C)*D, but each will be consistent in its interpretation. Because of possible different interpretations by compiler writers (which is really psychological ambiguity in the end), it is important to eliminate this kind of ambiguity from a language so that all implementations will be no farther apart than necessary. But eliminating physical ambiguity does not solve the psychological problem.

APL 的发明者和开发者 Ken Iverson 曾告诉我，APL 用于解决歧义的“从右到左”规则比 PL/I 中使用的规则“更自然”。当然，严格的从右到左规则更容易表述比 PL/I 规则（在正式意义上通常不定义执行顺序），但它的“自然性”是一个开放的心理学问题，作为解决歧义的一种方式，当然值得探索。从内省的角度来看，我可以说，在编写了大约 400 个 APL 程序之后，我从未完全转向从右到左的思维方式。当然，我的学生在写了几十个之后还没有过来，他们早期习惯从左到右和其他规则留下的心理歧义仍然是最大的，如果不是最大的，我看到的 APL 错误的单一来源之一。就我自己而言，我已经适应了过度括号化（即使在 PL/I 中）的适应性反应，以避免可能的心理歧义。

Ken Iverson, the inventor—the developer—of APL, once told me that APL's "right-to-left" rule for resolving ambiguity was "more natural" than the rules used, say, in PL/I. Certainly the strict right-to-left rule is simpler to state than the PL/I rules (which in a formal sense often leave the order of execution undefined anyway), but its "naturalness" is an open psychological question certainly worth exploring as a way of resolving ambiguity. From an introspective point of view, I can say that I have never entirely come over to a right-to-left way of thinking, after writing perhaps 400 APL programs. Certainly my students have not come over after writing a few dozen, and the psychological ambiguity remaining from their early habits with left-to-right and other rules remains one of the greatest, if not the greatest, single sources of APL errors I see. For myself, I have come to the adaptive reaction of over-parenthesizing (even in PL/I) to avoid possible psychological ambiguity.

编程语言的发明者意识到这两种歧义之间的区别，希望之光在地平线上出现。Klerer 和 May 采取了一种有趣的方法，允许用户以他自然的方式书写，然后给他一条消息，内容如下：

There is some ray of hope on the horizon that programming language inventors realize the difference between these two kinds of ambiguity. Klerer and May have taken the interesting approach of permitting the user to write in a way which is natural to him, and then to give him a message which says:

这是我们解释您的陈述的方式。

THIS IS THE WAY WE INTERPRET YOUR STATEMENTS.

如果有任何不正确的地方，请正确地重新输入声明。

IF ANY ARE INCORRECT PLEASE RETYPE THE STATEMENT CORRECTLY.

这种方法在最终情况下变得特别有吸引力，在这种情况下，我们最终会得到一些接近自然语言对话的东西。它要求我们修改我们关于什么是“语言”的静态概念。

Such an approach becomes particularly appealing in a terminal situation, where we at last get something approaching the dialogue of a natural language. It requires that we revise our static notion of what is a "language."

这种方法对于像 PL/I WHILE 这样罕见的歧义特别有用。如果需要完全明确，为什么不简单地用仅在程序员使用名为 WHILE 的数组时应用的语言制定一个秘密规则。在那种情况下，编译器可以告诉他在出现这样的 WHILE 子句时更改它，而我们其他人不必费心。在实践中，当然，编译器认识到这种情况并警告我们他们已经为我们插入了括号。为什么不取消警告，而只惩罚愚蠢到使用关键字作为变量名的程序员呢？

This approach would be especially useful for such rare ambiguities as the PL/I WHILE. If complete unambiguity is desired, why not simply make a secret rule in the language that is applied only when the programmer uses an array named WHILE. In that circumstance, the compiler can tell him to change such a WHILE-clause should it appear, and the rest of us need not bother. In practice, of course, compilers recognize this situation and warn us that they have inserted the parentheses for us. Why not dispense with the warning, and only punish the programmer who is stupid enough to use keywords as variable names?

这就引出了我们关于均匀性的最后一点。并非所有的责任都在语言设计者身上——个别程序员可能会犯下更大的罪过。例如，选择关键字作为变量名意味着该名称在程序中的使用方式不统一，这肯定会使任何试图阅读该程序的人感到困惑。（在我早期书中的一些示例中，我对此感到特别内疚。）不均匀性的其他来源是没有特殊原因的不同大小的变量声明；有时使用缩写，有时使用全名；源程序的任意缩进和间距；并在某些地方密集评论，而在其他看起来更困难的地方根本没有评论。

Which leads us to our final point about uniformity. Not all of the blame lies with the language designers—individual programmers can be far more guilty of this sin. For example, choosing keywords as variable names means that the name is used in a nonuniform way in the program, which certainly confuses the task for anyone trying to read the program. (I have been particularly guilty of this in some of my examples in earlier books.) Other sources of nonuniformity are declaration of variables with different sizes for no particular reason; use of abbreviations sometimes and full names at other times; arbitrary indenting and spacing of the source program; and commenting densely in some places and not at all in others that seem more difficult.

但是程序员不统一的主要来源仍然是助记名称的选择。亚伯拉罕林肯曾经问过这个谜语：“如果我们称尾巴为腿，那么狗有几条腿？” 当受访者可以回答“五”时，林肯会告诫说，“不，四。称它为一条腿并不能使它成为一条腿。” 多少次——几千次——我们见过这样的程序，其中 OLDX 没有被赋予 X 的旧值，SUMAB 没有被赋予 A 和 B 的和，或者 BIGGEST 实际上没有被赋予最大值？称它为 OLDX 并不能使它成为旧的 X；但无论我们多久发出一次这样的警告，这种谬误似乎都会延续下去。就像语言本身的不统一一样，这种做法伤害了我们，因为它让我们相信一些不真实的事情。

But the major source of programmer non-uniformity remains the choice of mnemonic names. Abraham Lincoln used to ask this riddle: "If we call tail a leg, how many legs does a dog have?" When the respondent could answer "five," Lincoln would admonish, "No, four. Calling it a leg doesn't make it a leg." How many times—how many thousands of times—have we seen a program in which OLDX has not been assigned the old value of X, SUMAB has not been assigned the sum of A and B, or BIGGEST has not actually been given the biggest value? Calling it OLDX doesn't make it the old X; but no matter how often we deliver this admonition, the fallacy seems to perpetuate itself. Just as with non-uniformity in the language itself, this practice hurts us because it leads us to believe something that is not true.

从调试的角度来看，少量的不均匀确实比大量的不均匀更糟糕，因为一般的均匀性会让我们昏昏欲睡。如果大多数时候，OLDX 是 X 的旧值，那么我们更有可能错过它不是的一次；如果大多数时候 (A) 表示与 A 相同，我们可能永远找不到程序中的错误。

From a debugging standpoint, a slight amount of non-uniformity is really worse than a great deal, for the general uniformity lulls us to sleep. If most of the time, OLDX is the old value of X, we are more likely to miss the one time that it isn't; and if most of the time (A) means the same as A, we may never find the bug in our program.

紧凑

COMPACTNESS

我们已经提到了人类思维在能力上具有某些固有局限性的原理。尽管这些限制因人而异，也因材料而异，但我们可以有把握地说，对于给定的人来说，短程序比长程序更容易理解。例如，我们对注释的研究似乎表明，即使添加不可执行的文本也往往会增加阅读程序的难度——即使明确添加该文本是为了使程序更具可读性。

We have already mentioned the principle that the human mind has certain inherent limitations in capacity. Although these limitations vary from person to person and from one sort of material to another, we can safely say that for a given person, a short program will have a tendency to be more easily comprehended than a long one. Our studies of comments seemed to indicate, for instance, that even the addition of non-executable text tended to increase the difficulty in reading a program—even when that text was added explicitly to make the program more readable.

然而，程序的紧凑性并不仅仅通过计算表达它所需的字符数来衡量。虽然当我们试图考虑诸如键入错误之类的因素时，字符数很重要，但关键单位通常可能比一个字符大一些。例如，表达式 A + B 的理解难度不及表达式 BIG + SMALL 的三分之一。之所以不是这样，是因为我们很少使用单个字母作为思维过程的基本单位：我们处于使用“词”的习惯。许多实验表明，像 BIG 这样的词可以像 A 一样容易地被大脑处理。

The compactness of a program, however, is not measured merely by counting the number of characters needed to express it. Although the number of characters is important when we are trying to account for such factors as keying errors, the critical unit may generally be somewhat larger than one character. For instance, the expression, A + B, is not one-third as difficult to understand as the expression, BIG + SMALL The reason it is not is that we rarely use single letters as our fundamental units of thought processes: we are in the habit of using "words." Many experiments have shown that a word such as BIG can be handled by the mind as readily as the word A.

在心理学中，人类这种将几个小单元组合成一个大单元的信息处理能力——就像它的各个部分一样容易处理——被称为组块。分块是一个重新编码的过程，我们通常在没有意识的情况下就这样做了。尽管如此，尽管分块的过程是我们很自然地做的事情，但每个单独的分块都必须通过经验来学习。当我们第一次开始遇到像 110010111100 这样的二进制字符串时，我们必须将它们记住为十二个单独的字符。然而，过了一段时间，我们开始学习八进制或十六进制，它们或多或少都是正式的组块系统。很快，我们开始立即将这个字符串“看”为 6274 或 CBC，因此包含它的任何程序的长度都变得“更短”。

In psychology, this information processing ability of human beings that combines several small units into one large unit—as easy to handle as its individual parts—is called chunking. Chunking is a recoding process, one which we usually do without conscious effort. Nevertheless, even though the process of chunking is something we do quite naturally, each individual chunk has to be learned by experience. When we first begin to encounter such binary strings as 110010111100, we have to remember them as twelve separate characters. After a while, however, we begin to learn octal or hexadecimal, both of which are more or less formal systems of chunking. Soon, we begin to "see" this string immediately as 6274 or CBC, so that the length of any program containing it becomes "shorter."

一些程序分块是从别处学到的分块的自然产物，例如识别 DO、READ 和 ALLOCATE 等“词”。其他分块我们在第一次将铅笔放在编码板上时就开始学习，因此在程序员使用一种语言的不同阶段，同一程序将具有不同的长度。对于一个有经验的 PL/I 程序员来说，下面的语句大概一眼就能看懂。

Some program chunking is a natural outgrowth of chunking learned elsewhere, as in the recognition of such "words" as DO, READ, and ALLOCATE. Other chunking we begin to learn the moment we first set pencil to a coding pad, so that at different stages in a programmer's experience with a language the same program will have different lengths. To an experienced PL/I programmer, the following statement can probably be taken in at a single glance.

我 = 1 到 N；

DO I = 1 TO N;

然而，新手可能不得不将其分成六到七个更小的块。

The novice, however, might have to break it into six or seven smaller chunks.

尽管分块往往会使常用的字符序列看起来更短，但编程语言设计者仅限于利用分块的优势，他们可以假设程序员将这种分块带到了语言中，或者是他在使用该语言时恰好学到的东西。然而，通过为用户提供表达同一事物的替代方式，语言设计者为程序员提供了进行另一种压缩的机会。这种类型最简单的例子是为关键字提供缩写，例如 PL/I 中的 PROCEDURE 的 PROC。在自然语言中，有一个被称为 Zipf 定律的经验观察，它说最常用的词往往是最短的词——比如“is”、“the”、“a”、“I”、“he” ,”和英文的“it”。

Although chunking tends to make commonly used character sequences seem shorter, the programming language designers are limited to taking advantage of the chunking they can assume the programmer brings to the language, or to that which he just happens to learn as he uses the language. By providing the user with alternative ways of expressing the same thing, however, the language designer gives the programmer a chance to do another kind of compression. The simplest example of this type is the provision of abbreviations for keywords, such as PROC for PROCEDURE in PL/I. In natural languages, there is an empirical observation known as Zipf's law, which says that the most frequently used words tend to be the shortest words—words such as "is," "the," "a," "I," "he," and "it" in English. We also see the operation of Zipf's law in the creation of contractions, such as "don't" or "there's," but the most common operation is probably concealed in the long dead past.

然而，在编程中，我们经常可以看到这种压缩的趋势，就像程序员开始一直编写 PROC 而不是 PROCEDURE 一样。他可能永远不会学会很少使用的单词（例如 STRINGRANGE）的缩写，即使它可能比他缩写的某个单词长得多。其他缩写是通过用功能更强大的功能替换功能更弱的功能来实现的，例如当程序员学习编写 SUM(X) 而不是 DO-group 或 DO-group 来表示顺序写出的情况列表时。当然，迭代是编程中可能进行的最基本的压缩步骤——洛夫莱斯夫人知道这一点，如果没有它，现代计算机基本上是不可能的。函数——例如 SUM——也是我们第一个程序员所熟知的概念，并且，

In programming, however, we can often see the tendency to this type of compression in action, as when a programmer begins to write PROC all the time instead of PROCEDURE. He may never learn the abbreviation for seldom used words such as STRINGRANGE, even though it may be much longer than some word he does abbreviate. Other abbreviation occurs through the substitution of more powerful functions for less powerful ones, as when the programmer learns to write SUM(X) instead of a DO-group, or a DO-group for a list of cases written out sequentially. Iteration, of course, is the most basic of the compression steps possible in programming—it was known to Lady Lovelace, and without it modern computers would essentially not be possible. Functions —such as SUM—were also a concept known to our first programmer and, although they are not conceptually as important as iteration, they are probably more important from a psychological and practical point of view.

当然，语言设计者既可以提供 SUM 和 SORT 等内置函数，也可以提供工具让程序员编写自己的函数。可能没有现代编程语言同时缺少这两种通用特性，但在实际提供的细节上存在很大差异。使用程序员定义的函数的一个特殊限制是，程序员很少有机会复制语言设计者可以构建到他们的函数中的内容。例如，PL/I 有许多强大的子程序定义特性，但程序员还不能为他的程序提供完全通用的能力，即使这种能力存在于内置函数中。

The language designer, of course, can provide either built-in functions such as SUM and SORT or facilities for the programmer to make his own functions. Probably no modern programming language lacks both of these general features, but there exist great differences in the details of what is actually provided. One particular limitation on the use of programmer-defined functions is that the programmer is seldom given the facilities to duplicate what the language designers can build into their functions. For instance, PL/I has many powerful subroutine-defining features, but the programmer cannot yet provide such things as full generic capability for his routines, even though that ability exists in the built-in functions.

另一个紧凑的来源——使用较新，但最终可能比迭代或子程序定义更强大——是数据结构化。例如，在 APL 中，大多数操作以统一的方式应用于各种数组以及标量。在PL/I中，可以有很多数组操作，也有结构操作。为了说明这些操作允许将多个操作指定为一个操作的强大功能，请考虑我们之前提出的 OLDX 问题。如果我们没有声明 OLDX、OLDY 等，而是声明了一个结构，例如

Another source of compactness—newer in use, but perhaps ultimately more powerful than iteration or subroutine definition—is data structuring. In APL, for instance, most operations apply in uniform ways to arrays of all sorts as well as scalars. In PL/I, many array operations are possible, and there are also structure operations. As an illustration of the power of these operations to permit many actions to be specified as one, consider the OLDX problem we raised earlier. If, instead of declaring an OLDX, OLDY, and so forth, we had declared a structure such as

1 旧，2（X，Y，Z，...）

1 OLD, 2 (X, Y, Z, ...)

我们本来可以执行一条语句

we would have been able to execute a single statement

旧=新；

OLD = NEW;

这确保所有旧值都被所有新值所取代。

which assured that all the old values were replaced by all the new ones.

许多专用编程语言从它们提供的高级数据结构中汲取力量，这些结构在多用途语言中还没有发现。如果这些结构符合用户的需求，那么由此产生的压缩可能是多方面的。如果不是这样——比如当我们尝试在 LISP 或 SNOBOL 中进行简单的算术运算时——数据结构就会产生相反的效果。摆脱这种困境的最有希望的方法是在 PL/I 等多用途语言中嵌入特殊数据结构。PL/I 确实提供了许多功能，这些功能可帮助程序员创建未内置在语言中的数据结构处理系统，尽管无法复制语言本身的一般能力再次成为一个障碍。

Many special-purpose programming languages draw their power from the higher-level data structures they provide, structures not yet found in multipurpose languages. Where these structures are in consonance with the user's needs, the resulting compression can be manifold. Where they are not—as when we try to do simple arithmetic operations in LISP or SNOBOL—the data structures have just the opposite effect. The most promising escape from this dilemma is through embedding special data structures in a multipurpose language such as PL/I. PL/I does provide a number of features which assist the programmer in creating data-structure-processing systems not built into the language, although the inability to replicate the general abilities of the language itself is once again an impediment.

适当的数据结构导致压缩的另一种方式是使较低级别的操作产生较高级别的结果。例如，如果我们按顺序处理一个排序的文件，假设记录是有序的，我们就可以推断出丢失的记录，否则就需要精心设计。将一种结构叠加在另一种结构上是操作提升的另一种情况——就像我们通过设置整个字符串来设置字符串中的所有位，而不是一次处理一个位。这种操作与通过数组和结构表达式进行的隐含重复操作之间的区别实际上在于语言指定的内容与实现该语言的计算机可以执行的操作之间的关系。给定合适的机器，

Another way in which appropriate data structures lead to compression is by causing lower-level operations to have higher-level results. For instance, if we are processing a sorted file in sequence, the assumption that the records are in order permits us to make inferences about missing records which would otherwise require elaborate programming. Overlaying of one structure on another is a further case of promotion of operations—as when we set all bits in a string by setting the whole string, rather than processing them one at a time. The difference between this sort of operation and the operation of implied repetition through array and structure expressions is really in the relationship between what the language specifies and what the computer on which the language is implemented can do. Given the appropriate machine, array processing can be done directly, too, just as we now do the assignment of strings.

在结束压缩这个话题之前，我们必须仔细研究一下硬币的另一面。也许压缩的最终形式是完全省略某些情况——通常是最常见的情况。在 PL/I 中，我们写 SKIP 而不是 SKIP(1)，因为这是迄今为止最常见的情况。在声明一个变量的时候，我们默认会得到很多属性，这样当我们写的时候

Before leaving the subject of compression, we must scrutinize the other side of the coin for a moment. Perhaps the ultimate form of compression is the elision of certain cases entirely—usually the most frequent ones. In PL/I, we write SKIP instead of SKIP(1), since that is by far the most frequent case. When declaring a variable, we get many attributes by default, so that when we write

声明 X；

DECLARE X;

我们得到类似的东西

we get the equivalent of something like

DECLARE X FLOAT DECIMAL(6) REAL 自动内部；

DECLARE X FLOAT DECIMAL(6) REAL AUTOMATIC INTERNAL;

事实上，在许多情况下，声明可以完全省略，导致 X 被隐式或上下文声明。这些极端之间的差异很像中文和英文语法之间的差异。英语有很多冗余，就像我们说的

Indeed, in many cases the declaration can be left out altogether, causing X to be declared implicitly or contextually. The difference between these extremes is much like the difference between Chinese and English grammar. English has many redundancies, as when we say

他去了两次。

He went two time(s).

 

复数结尾是多余的，因为复数是明确由“二”指定的，而在中文中，没有任何东西可以对应这个多出的字母。这种冗余在正常的语音传输中非常有用，因为它们有助于捕捉话语的准确含义，即使其中的某些部分已经失真。然而，在书面上，它们似乎是一种负担，而不是它们的价值，因此在任何编程语言中拥有一个合理的默认系统似乎是值得的。

The plural ending is redundant, in that plurality is clearly specified by the "two," and in Chinese, there would be nothing to correspond to this extra letter. Such redundancies are quite useful in normal speech transmission, for they help in catching the precise meaning of the utterance even though there have been distortions in parts of it. In writing, however, they seem more of a burden than they are worth, so it seems worthwhile to have a sensible default system in any programming language.

然而，使用这种默认系统的能力取决于有限论域的存在，或者至少是统计上受限的论域。也就是说，如果 default case 只在一小部分时间使用，它对我们帮助不大。随着可能的情况越来越多，记住哪个是默认值的负担可能比简单地编写完整的规范要大。如果这些情况以大致相同的频率发生，那么默认系统就会失去其价值，因为它的使用频率不足以使它变得有价值。另一方面，如果经常使用默认值，当我们必须使用它们时，我们可能不记得非默认情况。虽然我们没有根据经验研究这种情况，但我们可以推测默认值在使用得相当频繁时最有用，

The ability to use such a default system, however, depends on the existence of a limited universe of discourse, or a least a universe of discourse which is statistically limited. That is, the default case does not help us much if it is used only a small fraction of the time. As there are more and more possible cases, the burden of remembering which is the default can become greater than simply writing the complete specification. If the cases occur with more or less equal frequency, the default system then loses its value because it cannot be used often enough to make it worthwhile. On the other hand, if, the defaults are used often, we may not remember the non-default cases when we have to use them. Although we have not studied this situation empirically, we might conjecture that defaults are most useful when they are used fairly frequently, but not too frequently.

当然，上述原则适用于使用该语言的特定程序员的心理。当几种不同类型的程序员使用该语言时，默认值可能非常有用。例如，REAL 的默认值仅在与 COMPLEX 对比时才需要，这个特性可能十分之九的 PL/I 程序员甚至都不知道，更不用说使用了。诸如此类的默认值用于从单一语言生成不同的语言，因为实际上，十分之九的不了解 COMPLEX 的人是在使用无法处理复杂算术的语言进行编程。

Of course, the above principle applies to the psychology of a particular programmer using the language. Defaults may be very useful when several different types of programmers use the language. For instance, the default of REAL is needed only in contrast to COMPLEX, a feature which perhaps nine-tenths of PL/I programmers will not even know about, let alone use. Defaults such as these serve to produce different languages from a single language, for, in effect, the nine-tenths who do not know about COMPLEX are programming in a language that cannot handle complex arithmetic.

然而，这种通过默认值自动子集化的类型将不起作用，除非考虑了许多细节。例如，在 PL/I 中，内置函数是通用的，因为它们根据传递给它们的数据类型调整它们的操作。如果我们执行 SQRT(X)，则 X REAL 的操作与 X COMPLEX 的操作不同。对于 REAL X，X = -1 将引发错误条件；对于 COMPLEX X，结果将是 1I。但是为什么当 X 是 REAL 时不产生 1I 呢？考虑一下毫无戒心的程序员会发生什么

This type of automatic subsetting through defaults, however, will not work unless many details are accounted for. For instance, in PL/I, the built-in functions are generic, in that they adjust their operation according to the type of data passed to them. If we perform SQRT(X), the operation is different for X REAL than for X COMPLEX. For REAL X, X = -1 will cause an error condition to be raised; and for COMPLEX X, the result will be 1I. But why not yield 1I when X is REAL? Consider what would happen to the unsuspecting programmer who writes

A = SQRT(X);

A = SQRT(X);

根本不知道 COMPLEX。如果 1I 是右侧的结果，则 A 的值为零，因为 1I = 0 + 1I，因此只会分配实部。如果程序员不了解复杂的算术知识，那么这样的麻烦是最难发现的，因此如果默认是帮助他在真子集中工作，他必须得到保护。

without knowing about COMPLEX at all. If 1I were the result on the right-hand side, A would be given the value zero, for 1I = 0 + 1I, so only the real part would be assigned. Such a trouble would be most difficult for the programmer to find if he had no knowledge of complex arithmetic, so he must be protected if the default is to help him work in a true subset.

通过以适当的方式消除冗余，我们可以减少乏味和错误。在极限情况下——在一种消除了所有可能的冗余的编程语言中——不可能对程序进行任何语法检查，因为每个可能的字符串在语法上都是正确的程序。这种语言的一个例子是某些系统的机器代码，其中允许所有操作代码并且所有地址规范都是合法的。我们知道机器语言编程可能非常困难——这种困难是否可能是由于缺乏冗余而导致的？

By eliminating redundancy in an appropriate way, then, we can reduce tedium and error. In the limit—in a programming language from which all possible redundancy were eliminated—it would not be possible to have any syntax checking of the program, for every possible string would be a syntactically correct program. An example of such a language is the machine code for certain systems, where all op codes are permitted and all address specifications are legal. We know that machine language programming can be extremely difficult—is it possible that this difficulty is due to lack of redundancy being carried too far?

要回答这样一个问题，我们必须明确区分心理上有用的冗余和心理上无用的冗余。作为一个恰当的例子，考虑 FORTRAN 表达式 A(1 + I)。如果我们的 FORTRAN 禁止这个字符串，编译器将发出错误信号。并非所有的字符串都是允许的，因此可以通过检测非法字符串来进行错误检查。但是编译器在这里真正检查的是什么？禁止 A(1 + I) 的规则并不是为了程序员的心理安慰而制定的，而是为了更容易编译“最佳”代码。虽然这个表达式确实是错误的，但这个错误与我们的问题无关，而只是与 FORTRAN 的限制有关。从某种意义上说，错误的不是程序员，而是语言。

To answer such a question, we must make a clear distinction between psychologically useful and psychologically useless redundancy. As a case in point, consider the FORTRAN expression, A(1 + I). If our FORTRAN prohibits this string, the compiler will signal an error. Not all strings are permitted, so error checking can be done by detecting illegal strings. But what is the compiler really checking here? The rule prohibiting A(1 + I) was not set down for the psychological comfort of the programmer, but, rather, to make it easier to compile "optimum" code. Although it is true this expression is in error, the error has nothing to do with our problem, but only with FORTRAN's restrictions. In a sense, it is not the programmer, but the language, which is in error.

局部性和线性度

LOCALITY AND LINEARITY

在之前的讨论中，我们举了一个例子，说明记忆如何帮助程序员，即使他面前没有程序，他也能将相关信息保存在脑海中。设计得当的编程语言可以像良好的记忆力一样帮助程序员——让相关信息触手可及。

In an earlier discussion, we gave an example of how memory helps a programmer by enabling him to keep the relevant information in his head even when he does not have the program in front of him. A properly designed programming language can help the programmer in the same way that a good memory can—by keeping the relevant information close at hand.

在这方面我们感兴趣的两种人类记忆是所谓的“联觉”记忆和“顺序”记忆。联觉记忆是一种能力，使我们能够在不求助于特定细节的情况下识别出一张脸、一个街区或书中的页面布局。这个词本身来源于希腊语——“syn”意思是“在一起”，“esthetic”意思是“感觉”或“感觉”。因此，我们的联觉记忆是我们记忆的一部分，它使我们能够将事物作为一个整体记住，一目了然。

Two types of human memory that interest us in this regard are the so-called "synesthetic" and "sequential" memories. Synesthetic memory is the faculty that enables us to recognize a face, a neighborhood, or the layout of a page in a book—without recourse to specific details. The word itself is derived from the Greek—"syn" meaning "together," and "esthetic" meaning "feeling" or "sensing." Our synesthetic memory, then, is that part of our memory that enables us to remember things as a whole, all taken in one glance.

顺序记忆可能与听觉事物更相关，例如我们可以在听到前九小节后吹出曲调的第十小节，但如果单独要求则不会。我们拥有的顺序记忆似乎是像单向链条一样构造的——如果你愿意的话，就像语音一样——链条中每个链接的出现都会触发下一个链接的记忆。当我们背诵一首诗时，我们会表现出顺序记忆，当我们穿过某个地方时会记住去往某个地方的路线，有时当我们记住一个清单时。

Sequential memory may be more related to auditory things, as when we can whistle the tenth bar of a tune after hearing the first nine bars, but not if it is asked for alone. The sequential memories we have seem to be constructed like unidirectional chains—like speech, if you like—chains in which each link's appearance triggers the memory of the next. We exhibit sequential memory when we recite a poem, remember the route to a certain place as we traverse it, and sometimes when we memorize a list.

在程序中，“局部性”的概念对应联觉记忆，​​“线性”的概念对应时序记忆。我们所说的局部性是指当一个程序的所有相关部分都在同一个地方——也许在同一个页面上——时获得的属性。如果没有良好的局部性，处理程序列表的程序员必须不断翻页——除非他的联觉记忆足够好，可以记住其他页面上与当前页面相关的材料。编程语言鼓励局部性的一种方式是通过压缩。也就是说，如果整个程序适合一页，那么所有相关部分显然都在该页上。

In a program, the concept of "locality" corresponds to synesthetic memory, and the concept of "linearity" corresponds to sequential memory. By locality, we mean that property that obtains when all relevant parts of a program are found in the same place—on the same page, perhaps. Without good locality, a programmer working with the listing of a program has to be turning pages constantly—unless his synesthetic memory is sufficiently good to remember the material on the other pages that is relevant to the current page. One way a programming language encourages locality is through compression. That is, if the entire program fits onto one page, all relevant parts are obviously on that page.

在其他方面也鼓励或不鼓励地方性。使用文字的能力是一个很大的帮助，因为我们需要知道的关于文字的所有信息都包含在它的名字中。使用精心选择的助记名称可以产生相同的效果，如果它可以帮助读者记住他需要了解的关于变量的内容，而无需参考变量声明的位置。当然，如果一个变量只在本地使用，如果语言允许我们在那个位置声明它，那将会很有帮助。然而，在某些语言中，通常为了使编译器能够少通过一次，所有声明必须在程序的所有其他部分之前出现。在这种情况下，阅读较长的程序需要不断地来回翻到第一页。

Locality is also encouraged or discouraged in other ways. The ability to use literals is a big help, because all that we need to know about a literal is contained within its name. The use of well-chosen mnemonic names can have the same effect, if it helps the reader to remember what he needs to know about the variable without referring to the place it is declared. Of course, if a variable is only used locally, it is helpful if the language permits us to declare it right at that location. In some languages, however, usually to enable the compiler to make one less pass, all declarations must come before all other parts of the program. In such cases, reading a long program involves constant flipping back and forth to the first page.

然而，即使当语言要求所有声明都在一个地方给出时，也会获得一个特定的地方，因为我们总是可以撕下第一页并将它放在我们当前使用的任何一页旁边。事实上，有些人抱怨像 PL/I 这样的语言，它在选择声明的地方提供了很大的自由。这种自由经常被不理解为什么给予它的程序员滥用。理想情况下，用 PL/I 编写的程序应该将所有全局变量一起声明在一页上——在开头或结尾——以及在使用它们的编码部分中声明的所有局部变量。

Yet even when the language requires all declarations to be given in one place, a certain locality is obtained, for we can always tear off the first page and keep it alongside whichever page we are currently using. Indeed, some people complain about languages such as PL/I, which give great freedom in the choice of where declarations are made. This freedom is often abused by programmers who do not understand why it is given. Ideally, a program written in PL/I should have all global variables declared together on one page—at the beginning or end —and all local variables declared within the section of coding that uses them.

作为非局部性引起的问题类型的一个例子，考虑由这样一个循环引起的典型情况：

As an example of the type of trouble that non-locality causes, consider the typical situation arising from such a loop as

我是否 = 1 到 10；

DO I = 1 TO 10;

PUT 列表(I,F(I)); 结尾;

PUT LIST(I,F(I)); END;

其中 F 是程序员定义的子例程，例如

where F is a programmer-defined subroutine, such as

F：程序（J）返回（浮动）；

F: PROCEDURE(J) RETURNS(FLOAT);

小号 = 0

S = 0

我 = 1 到 J；

DO I = 1 TO J;

S = S + 我;

S = S + I;

结尾;

END;

返回（S）;

RETURN(S);

结束 F；

END F;

因为变量 I 不是子程序的局部变量，我们会发现主循环只输出了五对输出值：

Because the variable I is not made local to the subroutine, we will find that the main loop only puts out five pairs of output values:

(1 1)

(1 1)

(3 6)

(3 6)

(5 15)

(5 15)

(7 28)

(7 28)

(9 45)

(9 45)

而不是程序员可能期望的十个。他期望有 10 个值，因为他认为 I 在他的 DO 循环中是局部的——他在他面前看不到的任何东西都不会影响 I。但是，碰巧的是，I 在 F 内部使用，而不是在 F 内部声明，因此每次输入 F 时 I 都会更改。（回想一下，当 DO 循环 DO I = 1 TO J; 正常结束时，I 的值为 J + 1。）

instead of the ten the programmer probably expected. He expected ten values because he thought that I was local to his DO-loop—that nothing he could not see right in front of him would affect I. But, as it happens, I is used inside of F and not declared inside of F, so I changes each time F is entered. (Recall that when the DO-loop DO I = 1 TO J; is finished normally, I has the value J + 1.)

通常，这种错误会造成很大的困难，因为当我们找不到错误时，通常是因为我们找错了地方。在这种情况下，我们看错了地方，因为我们假设——这很自然——只有我们此刻在鼻子前看到的才会影响 I 的值。无论我们使用哪种编程语言，在调试时，我们必须了解非局部效应会以何种方式表现出来。例如，在 PL/I 中，子程序调用（通过全局变量或通过“按地址”传递的参数）、ON 单元（类似于无参数子程序调用，但可以在本地根本不提及 ON 单元的情况下调用),

Typically, this sort of bug causes great difficulty, for when we are not able to find a bug, it is usually because we are looking in the wrong place. In this case, we are looking in the wrong place because we assume —as is quite natural to do—that only what we see at the moment in front of our nose is what affects the value of I. In whichever programming language we use, when debugging we must learn in what ways nonlocal effects can manifest themselves. For example, in PL/I, subroutine calls (through global variables or through arguments passed "by address"), ON-units (which are similar to parameterless subroutine calls but can be invoked without any local mention of the ON-unit at all), and defining of one variable on another can lead to effects that are not to be found by looking at the place in the program where they seem to be arising.

一种可能导致非局部性的语言特征通常不会仅仅因为语言设计不佳而存在，否则它们可能会被淘汰，没有人会为它们的逝去而哀悼。例如，在另一个变量上定义一个变量，这样就可以实现压缩——这本身就可以帮助定位。因此，语言在防止因不良编程实践或错误引起的非局部性方面可以走多远是有限的。然而，在上面给出的示例中，对于 PL/I 语言设计者来说，让变量（例如 F 中的 I 或 S）自动成为 F 的本地变量可能是一个更好的决定，除非程序员明确声明相反。当然，假设他对 I 或 S 做出任何类型的明确声明，如

Features of a language that can lead to non-locality are not usually there just because of poor language design, otherwise they could be eliminated and nobody would mourn their passing. Defining one variable on another, for example, is provided so compression can be achieved—which in itself can help locality. Therefore, there is a limit to how far the language can go in preventing non-locality from arising from poor programming practices or mistakes. In the example given above, however, it might have been a better decision on the part of the PL/I language designers to have variables, such as I or S within F, be automatically local to F unless the programmer made explicit declaration to the contrary. Of course, suppose he makes any kind of explicit declaration of I or S, as in

声明 I 固定二进制，S 浮动；

DECLARE I FIXED BINARY, S FLOAT;

如果声明在 F 内，它会将它们的范围限制在 F 内。因此，程序员可以通过始终声明所有变量来克服这个困难，即使他只写

If the declaration is within F, it will restrict their scope to F. Thus, the programmer can overcome this difficulty by always declaring all variables, even if he only writes

声明我，S；

DECLARE I, S;

PL/l 的 ON 单元代表了一个特别有趣的非局域性案例，因为 ON 单元的基本功能是允许我们获得线性。事实上，就 ON 单元通常用于处理异常情况（某些程序中可能永远不会出现的情况）而言，它可以被认为是实现额外局部性的一种方式。首先，通过不强迫我们按名称提及条件，PL/I 允许我们在代码主体中实现更大的压缩。其次，统计压缩的发生是因为当我们考虑普通情况时，例外情况被排除在我们的视线之外。因此，ON-unit 允许我们忘记异常情况，这简化了编码——但是当我们需要记住 ON-unit 时，这需要付出代价。

The ON-unit of PL/l represents a particularly interesting case of non-locality, because the basic function of ON-units is to permit us to obtain linearity. In fact, in the sense that the ON-unit is ordinarily used to handle an exceptional case—one that may never arise in some programs—it can be thought of as a way of achieving additional locality. In the first place, by not forcing us to mention the condition by name, PL/I permits us to achieve greater compression in the main body of code. Secondly, a statistical compression occurs because the exceptional case is taken out of our sight when we are considering ordinary cases. Thus, the ON-unit permits us to forget about exceptional cases, which simplifies coding —but which exacts a price when we need to remember the ON-unit.

但是 ON 单元帮助我们实现线性度，这有助于我们的顺序记忆。在类似编程的情况下解决问题的实验表明，以严格线性顺序排列的一系列决策通常比分支或循环序列更容易处理。编程语言的经验似乎证明了这一点，因为众所周知，具有大量 GO TO 语句或其他分支的程序难以理解或调试。这种困难的部分原因是简单的非局部性，因为分支地址可能在不同的页面上。在一个 50 页的程序中，这种类型的分支会导致大量的翻页。

But the ON-unit helps us to achieve linearity, which aids our sequential memory. Experiments with problem solving in programming-like situations indicate that a series of decisions arranged in a strictly linear sequence is typically easier to handle than a branching or looping sequence. Experience with programming languages seems to bear this out, for programs with numerous GO TO statements or other branches are notoriously difficult to understand or debug. Part of this difficulty comes because of simple non-locality, for the branch address may be on a different page. In a 50-page program, this type of branching can cause a lot of page turning.

然而，即使分支地址与分支在同一页上，也会出现混淆。一方面，可能一些未被注意的分支也导致相同的点，因此我们无法轻易弄清楚我们是如何在执行中到达哪里的。另一方面，每个分支都打破了我们扫描程序或思考程序的正常顺序模式。即使我们没有翻过一页，我们的自然进程也被打断了，更容易出错。

Confusion can arise, however, even when the branch address is on the same page as the branch. For one thing, it may be that some unnoticed branch also leads to the same point, so we cannot easily figure out how we got where we got in execution. For another, each branch breaks our normal sequential mode of scanning the program or thinking about it. Even though we don't turn a page, our natural progression has been interrupted, making error more likely.

许多高级语言特性可以帮助我们掩盖典型存储程序机器的非线性。IF 语句允许执行附加到 IF 的语句。DO 或 BEGIN 允许我们在 THEN 或 ELSE 子句下将多个语句组合为一个。逻辑连接词使我们能够在一个 IF 语句下对决策进行分组。迭代 DO 允许我们消除显式分支。数组操作使我们能够消除显式迭代 DO 循环。ON 单元允许我们处理异常情况，甚至无需提及，甚至无需考虑。所有这些和其他特性都有助于消除程序中的非线性。事实上，在 PL/I 和其他语言中，许多程序员认为分支语句标签的存在是代码构造不佳的标志。

Many higher-level language features can help us mask the nonlinearity of the typical stored-program machine. The IF statement allows a statement to be executed to be attached to the IF.
