The DO or BEGIN allow us to group several statements as one under the THEN or ELSE clause. The logical connectives enable us to group decisions under one IF statement. The iterative DO permits us to eliminate explicit branching. The array operations enable us to eliminate explicit iterative DO loops. The ON-unit permits us to handle the exception condition without even mentioning it, or even thinking about it. All these and other features help to banish the nonlinearity from a program. Indeed, in PL/I and other languages, many programmers regard the presence of a statement label for branching to be a mark of poorly constructed code. Although we might not want to go that far, it does seem true that the GO TO is the one "major" statement that could be eliminated from PL/I with the least loss to the programmer.

传统与创新

TRADITION AND INNOVATION

一种编程语言能够以最少的错误实现易于表达的最重要方法之一是“自然”。正如我们所见，实现自然的一种方法是通过一致性，但一致性只适用于那些对语言有一定经验的程序员。当我们开始使用一种语言时，我们无法注意到其统一性——相反，我们会注意到语言中那些似乎与我们先前存在的“正确性”感觉不符的东西。我们从哪里得到这种感觉？它可能有两个来源：自然语言——英语、法语、中文——和编程语言——FORTRAN、ALGOL、COBOL——我们在开始学习新语言之前就知道了。通过使编程语言在某种意义上与用户可能知道的其他语言一致，

One of the most important ways a programming language can achieve ease of expression with a minimum of error is by being "natural." One way of achieving naturalness, as we saw, was through uniformity, but uniformity only applies to those programmers who have some experience with the language. When we begin to use a language, we are not able to notice the uniformities—instead we notice those things in the language that do not seem to correspond to our preexisting sense of "rightness." Where do we get this sense? Probably, it comes from two sources: the natural languages—English, French, Chinese—and the programming languages—FORTRAN, ALGOL, COBOL—which we know before we start to learn the new language. By making a programming language in some sense consonant with the other languages the user is likely to know, we may simplify his entry into its strange new world.

作为我们引入编程语言的自然语言概念的一个例子，考虑重要空白的情况。在欧洲语系的正字法中，显着空白的概念是很自然的。然而，在 FORTRAN 中，没有像有意义的空白这样的东西——除了在文字字符串中。

As an example of the natural language concepts we bring to a programming language, consider the case of the significant blank. In the orthographic forms of the European families of languages, the concept of the significant blank is quite natural. In FORTRAN, however, there is no such thing as a significant blank—except within a literal string.

此外，“多个空格等于一个空格”的概念在某种程度上是自然的，就像分隔符或空格的概念一样。“orate”这个词与“or ate”这两个词不同。然而，省略空格通常是可以纠正的，因为由于冗余会出现一些语法或语义违规，但不一定，如“他给了你，或吃了”。“他给你的，你说吧。” 当省略的空白将句子变成无意义的句子时，读者通常能够更正它，但几乎总是有意识地插入一个空白：“他失去了它或吃了它。” “他把它弄丢了。” 然而，分隔符旁边的空格通常可以被忽略而不被注意，例如在逗号后没有空格的这句话中：

Moreover, the concept of "multiple blanks equal one blank" is natural, up to a point, as is the concept of a delimiter or a blank. The word "orate" is not the same as the two words, "or ate." Elision of the blank, however, would usually be correctible, since some grammatical or semantic violation would occur, due to redundancy, but not necessarily, as in, "He gave it to you, or ate it." "He gave it to you, orate it." When the elided blank changes the sentence to a meaningless one, the reader will usually be able to correct it, but almost always with the conscious insertion of a blank: "He lost it or ate it." "He lost it orate it." The blank next to a delimiter, however, can be left out without usually being noticed, as in this sentence with no blank after the comma:

“别管它，好吗！”

"Leave it alone,will you!"

当编程语言与这些空白的自然语言规则不一致时，它可能更难学习，或者至少更难调试。例如，在 FORTRAN 中，有一种经典类型的错误，它的典型代表是语句

When the programming language is not in consonance with these natural language rules for blanks, it may be more difficult to learn, or at least more difficult to debug. In FORTRAN, for instance, there is the classical type of bug which is typified by the statement

做 33 我 = 1。20

DO 33 I = 1 . 20

此处，逗号已更改为句号（可能是由于输入错误），结果整个语句被解释为

Here, the comma has been changed to a period—perhaps by mis-keying—with the result that the entire statement is interpreted as

DO331=1.20

DO331=1.20

这里的空白让我们误以为 DO、33 和 I 是三个独立的实体，但根据 FORTRAN 规则空白不重要，它们实际上只形成一个变量 D033I。

The blanks here fool us into thinking that DO,33, and I are three separate entities, but they actually form only a single variable, D033I, under FORTRAN rules that blanks are not significant.

OS/360 的作业控制语言的语法中出现了一个代价高得多的空白错误处理。此处，操作数字段（如在汇编语言中）以第一个空白结束。这种奇怪的约定用于允许注释跟在操作数字段之后，就像在 System/360 汇编语言中所做的那样。但是简单地从汇编语言继承这个想法——尽管就 OS/360 设计者而言是一致的——被证明对其他用户来说是一个糟糕的选择。首先，FORTRAN、COBOL 和 PL/I 用户不熟悉该约定。其次，没有人真的想像他们在汇编语言中那样在作业控制上使用注释。最后，在作业控制中使用延续卡的频率比在汇编语言中要高得多，后者仅在使用宏时才频繁出现。

A much more costly mishandling of blanks arises in the syntax of the job control language for OS/360. Here, the operand field—as in assembly language—is terminated by the first blank. This strange convention was used to permit comments to follow the operand field, as is done in the System/360 assembly language. But simply carrying this idea over from the assembly language—though consonant as far as the OS/360 designers were concerned—proved to be a poor choice for other users. First of all, FORTRAN, COBOL, and PL/I users were not familiar with the convention. Secondly, nobody really wanted to use comments on job control the way they did in assembly language. Finally, the frequency of continuation cards in job control usage was much greater than in assembly language, where continuation arises frequently only in the use of macros.

这种不加思索的设计遗留导致的典型错误可能如下：

A typical mistake caused by this unthinking design carry-over might be the following:

//XX DD DSNAME=ABC, DISP=(NEW,KEEP), C

//XX DD DSNAME=ABC, DISP=(NEW,KEEP), C

程序员在键入时，无意识地在“ABC”后的逗号后留下了一个空白。他没有意识到这个空白很重要，因为在英语或 FORTRAN 中，它没有意义。然而，计算机注意到了它，因此将其作为评论字段的开头。因此，DISP 参数被完全忽略，程序员发现他的数据集没有保存，因为假设 DISP=(NEW,DELETE)。

The programmer, in keying, unconsciously leaves a blank after the comma following 'ABC.' He does not realize this blank is significant because in English, or FORTRAN, it has no significance. The computer notices it, however, and thus takes it to be the beginning of the comment field. Consequently, the DISP parameter is ignored entirely, and the programmer finds that his data set is not saved, since DISP=(NEW,DELETE) is assumed.

可以构建更糟糕的情况，并且很难估计由于这个设计错误而浪费了多少数十亿美元的机器时间和程序员时间。实际上，这当然不是设计错误，因为从设计 PL/I、FORTRAN 或 COBOL 的意义上说，作业控制语言并不是真正设计的。作为操作系统的一部分，作业控制根本不被认为是一种“编程”语言，所以有人只是从最近的可用资源中继承了一种相当令人满意的技术——结果是灾难性的。（另请参见图 10-1 和 10-2。）

Much worse cases can be constructed, and it is difficult to estimate how many billions of dollars of machine time and programmer time have been wasted because of this design error. In effect, of course, it is not a design error, for the job control language was not really designed, in the sense that PL/I, FORTRAN, or COBOL were designed. Being part of the operating system, job control was not thought of as a "programming" language at all, so somebody just carried over a technique which was fairly satisfactory from the nearest available source—with disastrous results. (See also Figures 10-1 and 10-2.)

编程语言可以与自然语言更加协调的另一个领域是拼写。当我们阅读自然语言文本时，我们经常会在没有注意到的情况下忽略拼写错误，即使它们是无意义的单词。在说话时，允许有更大的灵活性，因为我们可以理解亚特兰大人说“馅饼”，奥马汉人说“牛奶”，波士顿人说“院子”。然而，编程语言在拼写方面常常迂腐到极致，即使在意思本可以非常清楚的情况下也是如此。当然，缩写是替代拼写；但是这个概念可以更进一步——甚至可以像许多商业系统现在所做的那样猜测——关于正确的拼写。

Another area in which programming languages could be more consonant with natural languages is spelling. When we read natural language text, we often pass over misspellings without notice, even when they make nonsense words. In speaking, even greater flexibility is allowed, for we can understand the Atlantan when he says "pie," the Omahan when he says "milk," and the Bostonian when he says "yard." Programming languages, however, are often pedantic to the extreme when it comes to spelling, even in cases where what was meant could have been perfectly clear. Abbreviations, of course, are alternate spellings; but the concept could be carried much further—even to the point of making guesses—as many commercial systems now do—as to a correct spelling.

当然，拼写只是自然语言中更普遍的“松散”概念的一个例子。我们可以说

Spelling, of course, is only one example of a more general concept of "looseness" found in natural language. We can say either

“拿过来好吗？”

"Bring it here, will you?"

或者

or

“你会把它带到这里吗？”

"Will you bring it here?"

没有人会注意到差异。然而，编程语言很少像自然语言那样灵活，尽管我们确实有一些回旋余地。COBOL 中的干扰词是灵活性的一个例子，它允许程序员获得一些额外的与英语一致的感觉。在 PL/I 中，有许多地方允许对语句的一部分进行重新排序，如

Nobody will notice the difference. Programming languages, however, are rarely as flexible as natural languages, although we do have some leeway. Noise words in COBOL are one example of flexibility which permits the programmer to achieve some additional feeling of consonance with English. In PL/I, there are a number of places where reordering of part of a statement is permitted, as in

DO I = 1 TO N BY K; DO I = 1 BY K TO N;

DO I = 1 TO N BY K; DO I = 1 BY K TO N;

声明一个固定的二进制文件；声明一个固定的二进制文件；

DECLARE A FIXED BINARY; DECLARE A BINARY FIXED;

放置跳过列表（A）；PUT LIST(A) 跳过；

PUT SKIP LIST(A); PUT LIST(A) SKIP;

通过允许只有一种可能存在的两种可能性，语言应该更容易学习，因为每个用户都可以选择对他来说最简单或最自然的形式。然而，他可能没有意识到自己已经做出了选择。他可能永远不会看到另一种形式出现在他面前，可能是因为他的老师更喜欢另一种形式。或者，他可能会觉得两种形式之间存在语义差异，因此一旦他觉得自己了解另一种就不敢使用另一种。

By permitting two possibilities where only one might have existed, the language should be easier to learn, because each user can choose the form easiest or most natural for him. He may not, however, be conscious that he has made a choice. He might never have had the alternative form presented to him, possibly because his teacher prefers the other one. Or, he may get the impression there is some semantic difference between the forms, and so be afraid to use one once he feels he knows the other.

而且，确实，可能存在语义差异，尽管这些差异可能非常轻微，在普通程序员的一生中都不会被注意到。两种说法

And, indeed, there might be semantic differences, although these might be as slight as to be unnoticed in the ordinary programmer's lifetime. The two statements

DO I = 1 TO N BY K; DO I = 1 BY K TO N;

DO I = 1 TO N BY K; DO I = 1 BY K TO N;

在 PL/I 中并不完全相同。表情也不行

are not quite precisely the same in PL/I. Nor are the expressions

(A=2)&(B=3) (B=3)&(A=2)

(A=2)&(B=3) (B=3)&(A=2)

除了心理上的差异——人与人之间，或者阅读和写作之间——还可能存在性能差异，这些差异总是潜伏在后台，可能会阻止程序员利用他可用的松散性。

Aside from the psychological differences—from one person to another, or between reading and writing—there are possible performance differences which, by always lurking in the background, may discourage the programmer from taking advantage of the looseness available to him.

就像语言内部的一些差异很重要而另一些则不重要一样，语言之间的一些差异也是微不足道的——或者至少意义不大，不值得费心去保留。例如，最初我们的语言是否需要

In the same way that some differences within a language are significant and some are not, so too are some differences between languages insignificant—or at least of so little significance as to not be worth the bother of trying to preserve. For instance, it may make some difference initially whether our language requires

我是否 = 1 到 N 乘以 3；

DO I = 1 TO N BY 3;

或者

or

FOR I:= 1 步骤 3 直到 N;

FOR I:= 1 STEP 3 UNTIL N;

但是任何有能力的程序员都应该能够以绝对最小的难度从一个转移到另一个。事实上，它们之间的区别是如此微不足道，以至于可以很容易地允许它们以相同的编程语言存在。然而，在关于编程语言优劣的争论中，我们常常发现最热的是那些差异最小的点，因为只有在这些点上才能直接比较两种语言。也许有一天会有人进行实验，看看 DO 或 FOR 是这种情况下的“最佳”关键字，但事实很少会扰乱这样的争论。

but any capable programmer should be able to move from one to the other with an absolute minimum of difficulty. Indeed, the difference between them is so insignificant that both could easily be permitted to exist in the same programming language. In arguments about the relative merits of programming languages, however, we often find the most heat about those points where there is the least significant difference, for it is only at those points that the two languages can be directly compared. Perhaps someone will someday perform an experiment to see whether DO or FOR is the "best" keyword in this situation—but there is little chance that mere facts would disturb such an argument.

当我们设计一种与另一种常用语言相似的新编程语言时，我们绝对可以通过尽可能保持早期传统来加快早期学习。然而，我们以一种有趣的方式为这种早期学习付出代价，因为没有两种编程语言是完全相同的——否则它们就是同一种语言。

When we design a new programming language to be similar to another commonly used one, we can definitely speed up early learning by remaining within the earlier tradition wherever possible. We pay for this early learning in an interesting way, however, for no two programming languages are exactly alike—otherwise they would be the same language.

如果语言稍有不同，就会出现抑制心理现象。抑制有两种形式——追溯和主动。当早期学习材料的相似性干扰了后来材料的学习时，就会发生主动抑制。因此，例如，FORTRAN 程序员在学习使用 PL/I 中的 F 或 E 等格式项时会遇到异常多的困难，因为尽管它们相似，但并不完全相同。PL/I 使用逗号，而 FORTRAN 使用句点。当我们查看 FORTRAN 程序员的 PL/I 程序时，我们经常会发现 F(10.2) 这样的格式项——其结果总是让 FORTRAN 程序员感到困惑。

If the languages are slightly different, then the psychological phenomenon of inhibition will occur. Inhibition comes in two forms—retroactive and proactive. Proactive inhibition occurs when the similarity of earlier learned material interferes with the learning of later material. Thus, for instance, FORTRAN programmers have an inordinate amount of difficulty learning to use format items such as F or E in PL/I, because, although they are similar, they are not identical. PL/I uses a comma where FORTRAN uses a period. When we look at the PL/I programs of a FORTRAN programmer, we often find such format items as F(10.2)—the results of which never fail to confound the FORTRAN programmer.

正是语言之间的相似性导致了抑制，这可以通过检查 FORTRAN 程序员对图片格式的使用看出。这样的 PL/I 初学者在学习编写 P'SSSSSSSV.99' 时几乎没有困难，因为 FORTRAN 中没有类似的结构。（当然，COBOL 程序员确实有麻烦。）追溯抑制也取决于相似性，但它适用于以前学过的语言。因此，通常情况下，学习过 PL/I 的 FORTRAN 程序员发现很难再回去编写 FORTRAN 程序——这不仅仅是因为时间已经过去了。

It is the similarity between the languages which causes the inhibition, as can be seen by examining the use of picture formats by the FORTRAN programmer. Such PL/I beginners have little or no difficulty learning to write P'SSSSSSSV.99', because there is no comparable structure in FORTRAN. (But, of course, COBOL programmers do have trouble.) Retroactive inhibition also depends on similarity, but it works on the previously learned language. Thus, typically, the FORTRAN programmer who has learned PL/I finds it difficult to go back to writing FORTRAN programs—and not just because some time has elapsed.

因此，抑制是我们为使两种语言在某些特征上相似但不相同而付出的代价。可能更好，当身份不可能时，使两者更明显不同，这样抑制力就会减弱。但是，抑制成本并不是我们为使一种编程语言与较早的编程语言相匹配而付出的唯一代价。旧结构可能根本不适合我们正在尝试做的新事物，在这种情况下，语言的整体统一性将受到影响。在这种情况下，早期学习会减慢后期学习——学习新的强大技术。或者，我们可能无法使新的技术适应旧的语言，因此试图实现和谐可能最终只能达到贫瘠。

Inhibition, therefore, is the price we pay for making two languages similar but not identical in some feature. It might be better, when identity is not possible, to make the two more clearly dissimilar, so inhibition will have less force. But the cost of inhibition is not the only price we pay for trying to make one programming language match an earlier one. The old structures simply may not fit in with the new things we are trying to do, in which case the overall unity of the language will suffer. In this case, early learning slows down later learning—learning of new and powerful techniques. Alternatively, we may not be able to fit the new techniques to the old language, so trying to achieve consonance may wind up achieving only sterility.

因为每个程序员之间的差异如此之大，所以我们可以使我们的语言与程序员已经知道的想法和结构保持一致的程度是有限的。可以肯定的是，我们完全可以指望所有程序员都能识别数字文字和简单的算术表达式等形式，但我们很快就会遇到不同的人喜欢不同的做事方式的领域。松散是编程语言允许个体差异的一种方式——允许在两个或多个内置事物之间进行选择。因此，从某种意义上说，一种松散的语言可以适应个别程序员的喜好。

Because individual programmers are so different from one another, there is a definite limit to how far we can make our language consonant with the ideas and structures the programmer already knows. To be sure, we can pretty well count on all programmers recognizing such forms as numeric literals and simple arithmetic expressions, but we soon run into areas where different people prefer different ways of doing things. Looseness is one way a programming language allows for individual differences—by permitting a selection among two or more built-in things. Thus, in a sense, a loose language can adapt to preferences of individual programmers.

但是语言可以通过其他方式进行调整。这些方式的特点是创造新事物，一些用于单个程序，一些用于整个程序类。这种适应性的一个常见例子是定义函数和其他子程序的能力。另一个是定义新数据类型的能力——例如结构和列表。一些语言允许定义或重新定义运算符，但这些毕竟只是另一种类型的函数。最后，有些语言具有更精细的元语言——例如，编译时设施，或在执行时动态生成代码——这可以允许改变语言的整个外观。

But there are other ways a language can be adaptable. These ways are characterized by the creation of new things, some for a single program and some to be used across a whole class of programs. One familiar example of such adaptability is the ability to define functions and other subroutines. Another is the ability to define new data types—structures and lists, for example. Some languages permit the definition or redefinition of operators, but these are, after all, just another type of function. Finally, there are languages with more elaborate metalanguages—compile-time facilities, for instance, or dynamic generation of code at execution—which can permit changing the entire face of the language.

当我们使用这些设施进行改编时，我们可能能够在一定程度上与我们的特质保持一致，这是语言设计者无法直接接近的。但是，在越来越接近我们自己特定的思维和表达方式时，我们可能会很容易地与其他人的方式越来越远。编程不仅仅是人与机器之间的交流。其他人可能必须阅读并理解该程序；但是，如果自适应设备的使用过于广泛，程序可能会像精神分裂症患者的私人语言一样对它们关闭。

When we use these facilities for adaptation, we may be able to gain a degree of consonance with our idiosyncrasies which cannot be approached by the language designer directly. But in getting closer to our own specific modes of thought and expression, we may easily get further and further from the modes of other people. Programming is not just communication between one man and a machine. Other people will probably have to read and understand the program; but if the use of adaptive devices is too extensive, the program may be as closed to them as is the private language of a schizophrenic.

在安装中，一定程度的改编可能有利于调整语言以适应当地工作类型的精确需求。当然，在某些时候，这种重新定义会成为一种新语言的设计——这是一项业余爱好者不能轻易承担的工作。如果使用的语言确实与安装的需要相去甚远，那么在进行修改之前搜索更接近需要的语言可能会更好。当然有足够多的语言可供选择。

Within an installation, a certain amount of adaptation may be advantageous to adjust the language to the precise needs of the local type of work. Of course, at some point this type of redefinition becomes the design of a new language—a job not to be undertaken lightly by amateurs. If the language being used is really so far from the needs of the installation, it might be better to search for a language that is closer to the needs before modifications are made. There certainly are enough languages to choose from.

特殊用途、多用途和玩具语言

SPECIAL-PURPOSE, MULTIPURPOSE, AND TOY LANGUAGES

在某种程度上，我们对语言的讨论一直偏向于专业程序员的语言，评论的是业余爱好者的需求。但所涉及的原则是深刻的，它们也适用于业余语言，尽管重点有所改变。如果我们为特定的应用领域设计一种特殊的语言，我们会立即开始通过限制话语范围来获得心理回报。因此，统计语言不必具有复杂算术的功能，字符串处理语言根本不需要太多算术，而机床控制语言可能更多地涉及几何而不是算术。然而，有时，这些限制只是通过限制容量来施加的，假设该领域的问题永远不会超过一定规模。因此，

To some extent, our discussion of languages has been biased toward the languages of the professional programmer, with comments on the needs of the amateur. But the principles involved are deep ones, and they apply to amateur languages as well, although with modified emphasis. If we design a special language for a particular application area, we start immediately reaping psychological rewards by limiting the universe of discourse. Thus, a statistics language does not have to have facilities for complex arithmetic, a string processing language does not have to have much arithmetic at all, and a machine-tool control language might have more of a geometry than an arithmetic. Sometimes, however, these limitations are imposed simply by limiting the capacity, under the assumption that problems in that field never get any larger than a certain size. Thus, a simulation language might have no facilities for using auxiliary storage, which means that many language features can be dropped entirely—but it also means that certain problems cannot be simulated.

论域的限制对于专用语言的设计非常重要，它应该是第一个也是最仔细考虑的步骤。例如，APL 的大部分成功都与它可以处理的宇宙的谨慎限制有关，尽管大多数 APL 程序员认为它是一种“多用途”语言。但仅仅通过将语言限制在终端情况、相对较小的工作空间并且没有辅助文件，设计者就能够提供一个卓越的问题解决工具——用于解决其范围内的问题。该语言的成功可以归因于大量的人的存在，他们的问题属于那个有限的范围——或者至少在他们学习 APL 的时候属于这个范围。进展到数据处理问题的程序员，在处理大量数据的过程中，很快就会发现它们已经“超出”了 APL。然而，对该系统的大部分热情并没有意识到它内置的局限性，并在很大程度上解释了它的成功。

Limitation of the universe of discourse is so important for the design of special-purpose languages that it should be the first and most carefully considered step. Much of the success of APL, for example, had to do with the careful limitation of the universe with which it could deal, although most APL programmers think of it as a "multipurpose" language. But simply by limiting the language to terminal situations, to relatively small workspaces, and to no auxiliary files, the designers were able to provide a problem-solving tool par excellence—for problems within its scope. The success of the language can be attributed to the existence of large numbers of people whose problems fall within that limited scope—or at least fall within it while they are learning APL. Programmers who progress to, say, data-processing problems, in which large quantities of data are processed, soon find they have "outgrown" APL. Much of the enthusiasm for the system, however, doesn't take cognizance of the limitations that are built into it and account for a good deal of its success.

限制对用户不如对非用户那么明显的原因之一是编程语言确实塑造了思维过程。我们在这里说的不是简单的抑制作用，而是对程序和数据组织的更大影响。在教授由 COBOL、FORTRAN 和基本汇编语言程序员以及根本没有编程语言的人组成的初级 PL/I 课程时，我最清楚地意识到了这种影响。当我阅读第一次作业上交的程序时，我突然想到我可以推测程序员的背景，并且我记录了每个人的猜测。我没有关于程序员的任何背景资料，所以我无法通过外部方式了解他们的经历。

One reason why the limitations are not as obvious to users as they are to nonusers is that the programming language does indeed shape thought processes. We are not speaking here of simple inhibition effects, but of larger effects on the organization of programs and data. I became aware of this effect most clearly when teaching a beginning PL/I class composed of COBOL, FORTRAN, and Basic Assembler Language programmers—as well as people with no programming language at all. As I was reading the programs handed in for the first assignment, it struck me that I could conjecture the background of the programmer, and I recorded my guess for each one. I did not have any background sheets on the programmers, so there was no external way in which I could know their experience. The next day I checked my guesses with the class and obtained the results shown in Figure 12-3.

 

图12-3 猜猜编程背景。

Figure 12-3 Guessing programming background.

 

可以肯定的是，许多猜测都因特定的特征线索而变得简单，例如在 F 格式项目中使用小数点而不是逗号。但是这些具体的线索也让我做出了几个错误的猜测；我猜 BAL 程序员使用“FORTRAN”是因为他使用了这样的小数点，而“COBOL”用于一个没有经验的程序员，因为他使用 PART_COST 等符号的方式，下划线代表 COBOL 连字符。（原来他曾看到一位 COBOL 程序员这样做，并复制了这种风格。）

To be sure, a number of guesses were made simple by specific feature clues, such as the use of a decimal point instead of a comma in an F-format item. But these specific clues also led me to make several wrong guesses; I guessed "FORTRAN" for a BAL programmer because he used such decimal points, and "COBOL" for an inexperienced programmer because of the way he used symbols such as PART_COST, with the underscore standing for the COBOL hyphen. (It turned out that he had seen one of the COBOL programmers doing this and copied the style.)

由于语言对思维的影响，一个人试图解决的问题受到一个人所知道的编程语言及其了解程度的限制。因此，人们往往会对一种特殊用途的编程语言以及一个人当前的知识水平产生一种自我实现的满足感。就专用语言以这种方式限制思维的程度而言，它们对可能有更大问题需要解决的用户是有害的。COBOL 的情况特别有启发性。

As a consequence of the influence of language on thought, the problem that one will attempt to solve is limited by the programming language one knows and how much of it he knows. Therefore, there tends to be a self-fulfilling satisfaction with a special-purpose programming language, as well as with one's current level of knowledge. To the extent that special-purpose languages act as limits to thought in this manner, they are harmful to the user who potentially has larger problems to solve. The situation with COBOL is particularly instructive.

人们已经忘记了COBOL设计者的初衷。引用其中一位 Jean Sammet 的话：

People have lost sight of the original intention of COBOL's designers. To quote one of them, Jean Sammet:

设计 COBOL 的用户实际上是那些关心业务数据处理问题的人的两个子类。一种是相对缺乏经验的程序员，对他们来说，COBOL 的自然性将是一种优势，而另一种类型的用户基本上是最初没有编写过该程序的任何人。换句话说，COBOL 程序的可读性将为所有可能希望检查程序的人（包括监督或管理人员）提供文档。很少尝试迎合专业程序员。. . .

The users for whom COBOL was designed were actually two subclasses of those people concerned with business data processing problems. One is the relatively inexperienced programmer for whom the naturalness of COBOL would be an asset, while the other type of user would be essentially anybody who had not written the program initially. In other words, the readability of COBOL programs would provide documentation to all who might wish to examine the programs, including the supervisory or management personnel. Little attempt was made to cater to professional programmers. . . .

 

COBOL 设计人员费了很大的劲才看到这些目标确实得到了满足。例如，他们努力的一个结果是，COBOL 商店的编程经理确实比其他类型的团队的经理阅读程序的次数多一些。然而，在编程经理之外，是否有许多经理确实阅读过 COBOL 程序，或者阅读过它们有什么好的效果，这值得怀疑。

The COBOL designers went to considerable trouble to see that these objectives were actually met. One result of their efforts for instance, is that programming managers in COBOL shops do seem to read programs somewhat more than do managers in other types of groups. Outside of the programming managers, however, it is doubtful whether many managers do read COBOL programs, or read them with any good effect.

然而，COBOL 在 60 年代成功地让非专业人士编写程序这一事实被证明是 70 年代进步的障碍。一般而言，COBOL 程序员团队不是可以构建在线快速响应系统的资产。COBOL 强加的排序心态甚至阻碍了向有效使用随机访问文件的过渡。在我就操作系统问题咨询过的 COBOL 安装中，75% 本质上是将它们的随机访问文件用作顺序设备，最好的情况是获得更快的排序，最坏的情况是获得比磁带更慢的顺序处理。目前，COBOL 和 COBOL 用户是否可以随着可用设施的扩展而增长是一个悬而未决的问题。

However, the fact that COBOL was successful in getting nonprofessionals to writing programs in the sixties is proving to be an impediment to progress for the seventies. A crew of COBOL programmers is not, in general, an asset upon which an installation can build, say, on-line, fast response systems. Even the transition to effective use of random access files has been impeded by the sorting mentality that COBOL imposes. Seventy-five percent of the COBOL installations with which I have consulted on operating systems problems were essentially-using their random access files as sequential devices, at best to get faster sorts, and at worst to get slower sequential processing than with tapes. Whether COBOL and COBOL users can grow with the expanding facilities available to them is an open question at the moment.

似乎没有办法摆脱这个悖论——一种编程语言在其设计的特殊目的上做得越好，如果他们面临潜在的新领域，它在使用它的人的头脑中就越受限制的应用程序。事实上，这是费希尔自然选择基本定理的另一个例子。专业程序员不能掉进自己不适应的陷阱，但我们不一定事先知道谁注定要成为专业人士。只有研究特殊用途语言适应其特殊环境的方式，我们才有希望了解如果有必要从业余或半专业人士转变为专业人士，重塑思维过程将涉及什么。

There seems to be no way out of this paradox—the better job a programming language does for the special purpose for which it was designed, the more limiting it is on the minds of those who use it, if they are faced with potentially new areas of application. In fact, this is another example of Fisher's Fundamental Theorem of Natural Selection. The professional programmer cannot afford to fall into the trap of being so adapted he is not adaptable, but we don't necessarily know in advance who is destined to become a professional. Only by studying the ways in which special-purpose languages adapt to their special circumstances do we have any hope of understanding what will be involved in reshaping thought processes if it is necessary to create a professional from an amateur or semiprofessional.

专用语言也成功地利用了对应于用户在其特殊领域中的需求的特殊数据结构，同时实现了紧凑性和与先前学习的对应。例如，我们希望社会科学研究中使用的一种语言能够提供诸如问卷调查结果之类的数据数组，或者进行代数运算的语言具有多项式或其他符号表达式的标准数据形式。事实上，他们确实做到了，这在很大程度上决定了他们的成功——或者失败，如果他们未能成为正确的结构。

Special-purpose languages are also successful in exploiting special data structures which correspond to the user's needs in his special area, simultaneously achieving compactness and correspondence with previous learning. We would expect, for example, that a language to be used in social science research would provide for arrays of data such as questionnaire results, or that a language for doing algebraic manipulations would have standard data forms for polynomials or other symbolic expressions. And, indeed, they do, which accounts for a large part of their success—or failure, if they fail to be the right structures.

除了特殊的数据结构，我们还找到了对这些结构进行熟悉处理的特殊例程。这样，我们的社会科学研究语言无疑会有各种制表和数据归约原语，代数语言会有解析乘法、微分、表达式化简等原语。当然，这些函数和结构的名称会选择给用户一种他在熟悉的领域工作的感觉，以便利用已有的学习。

Along with special data structures, we find special routines for doing familiar processes on those structures. Thus, our social science research language would undoubtedly have various tabulation and data reduction primitives, and the algebraic language would have such primitives as analytical multiplication, differentiation, and simplification of expressions. Of course, the names of these functions and structures will be chosen to give the user the feeling that he is working in familiar territory, so as to take advantage of pre-existing learning.

在主要用户将是非程序员的专用语言中，使用预先存在的学习是一个主要的设计目标，以免用户在真正有机会使用它之前就离开系统。不幸的是，许多发明的特殊用途语言——我真的不能让自己说“已开发”——只与现有学习提供的对应关系。一个人能够足够快地使用它们，但很快就会发现他无法解决他的实际问题——只能解决与他的实际问题相似的“玩具”问题。即使语言在理论上能够描述他的问题，系统也可能与计算的内部现实不相符。解决实际问题的能力并不存在——无论是在时间上还是在空间上。一旦遇到这种情况，临时用户很可能会成为一名卷入的批评者——这是有充分理由的。

In a special-purpose language where the main users will be non-programmers, the use of pre-existing learning is a major design objective, lest the user turn away from the system before he really has a chance to use it. Unfortunately, many of the special-purpose languages invented—I cannot really bring myself to say "developed"—have only a correspondence with pre-existing learning to offer. A person is able to use them quickly enough, but soon finds he cannot solve his real problems—only "toy" problems resembling his real problems. Even when the language is theoretically able to describe his problem, the system may be out of correspondence with the internal realities of computing. The capacity to solve the real problem does not exist—either in time or in space. Once he reaches this situation, the casual user is likely to become an involved critic—with good reason.

特殊用途的编程语言经常以随意的方式被扔进这个世界，这是编程语言设计行业的耻辱。并不是说该企业在其自己的后院——多用途语言中是一个如此闪亮的例子。不过，当我们走出计算机专业人士的核心圈子时，我们就有了额外的社会责任。我们应该保护那些不能指望知道如何保护自己免受不良编程语言侵害的人。这又是一次推销：让我们停止像成熟的女神一样从我们的额头上搅动这些语言，并开始在可以在其设计和测试中使用合理的行为原则的环境中开发它们。让我们成为专业的设计师和专业的程序员。

The casual way in which special-purpose programming languages are often thrown into the world is a disgrace to the programming language design business. Not that the business is such a sparkling example in its own backyard—multipurpose languages. Still, when we move outside the inner circle of computer professionals, we have an additional social responsibility. We ought to protect those who cannot be expected to know how to protect themselves against a bad programming language. And here comes the pitch yet one more time: let's stop churning these languages out of our foreheads like full-blown goddesses and start developing them in an environment where sound behavioral principles can be used in their design and testing. Let's become professional designers as well as professional programmers.

概括

SUMMARY

在 Jean Sammet 的书Programming Languages: History and Fundamentals的封面上，有一张让人想起 Brueghel 的通天塔的图片。原画在维也纳艺术史博物馆，但墙上大小的复制品装饰着 IBM 维也纳实验室的会议室，PL/I 通用语言文档就在这里出生于。在世界各地，在程序员聚集的地方，人们很可能会看到一些关于通天塔的文学或图片参考。翻开 Sammet 书的封面，不难发现原因——装饰这座塔的是 117 种编程语言的名字。其实有118个，因为虽然没有列在这本综合性书籍的索引中，但曾经有一种编程语言叫做BABEL——塔顶的名字。

On the slip cover of Jean Sammet's book, Programming Languages: History and Fundamentals, there is a picture reminiscent of Brueghel's Tower of Babel. The original painting is in Vienna, in the Kunsthistoriches Museum, but a wall-sized reproduction graces the conference room of the IBM Vienna Laboratory, where the PL/I Universal Language Document was born. All around the world, where programmers gather, one is likely to see some literary or pictorial reference to the Tower of Babel. Looking at the cover of Sammet's book, the reason is not hard to find—decorating the tower are the names of 117 programming languages. Actually, there are 118, for, although it is not listed in the index of this comprehensive book, there was once a programming language named BABEL-—the name which tops the tower.

事实上，据我所知，有许多语言（甚至不包括“汇编”语言，Sammet 甚至没有试图在她的列表中涵盖这些语言）没有被列出——幸好如此。117 种代表语言涵盖了大约十五年的时间，从 1952 年（简码）到 1967 年，这是给出的最新语言参考。每年（值得一提）八种新语言的平均值具有误导性，因为在此期间的前十年，平均每年不超过两到三种。在此期间的最后五年中，平均每年使用近 20 种语言，并且在接近尾声时还在增加。Sammet 的 785 页大部头似乎将是同类作品中的最后一部——至少是最后一部能合而为一的作品。如果我的推断是正确的，

Indeed, to my knowledge, there are a number of languages (not even including "assembler" languages, which Sammet doesn't even attempt to cover in her list) that are not listed—and mercifully so. The 117 represented languages cover a period of about fifteen years, from 1952 (Short Code) to 1967, the latest language reference given. This average of eight new languages a year (worth mentioning) is misleading, since for the first ten years of the period the average was no more than two or three a year. The average for the last five years of the period is closer to twenty languages per year, and increasing toward the end. It seems likely that Sammet's 785 page tome will be the last work of its kind—at least the last to fit in one volume. If my extrapolations are correct, in 1972 programming languages will be invented at the rate of one a week—or more, if we consider the ones which never even make the literature, and enormously more if we consider dialects.

这种语言的泛滥是不是很糟糕，就像游泳洞里的藻类泛滥一样？还是急需的原创努力的健康流露？我们已经度过了可以简单地“发明”一种语言然后应用到文献中，或者应用到特定安装或使用特定机器的所有程序员的广泛支持的时代。我们现在必须提高我们的眼光，对这位未来的语言发明者提出更多要求——我们必须要求他表现出一些迹象表明他的语言在心理上是有用的。

Is this bloom of languages bad, like the bloom of algae in a swimming hole? Or is it a healthy outpouring of a much needed original effort? We have passed the time when a language can simply be "invented" and then cast upon the literature, or upon the broad backs of all the programmers in a particular installation or working with a particular machine. We must now raise our sights and ask more of the would-be language inventor—we must ask him to show some indication of psychological usefulness of his language.

尽管如此，发明者并不是唯一的罪魁祸首——编程语言理论家长期以来一直忽视他们交易的心理方面。编程不是数学的一个分支，它是一种独特的交流形式，人类在其中发挥积极作用，而机器通常是被动的。也许我们使用编程语言的麻烦源于通信的单向性。只有当理论家转向编程“语言”的“对话”方面时，他们才会最终被迫承认他们不是符号操作的学生，而是人类行为的学生。

Still, the inventors are not the only ones to bear the blame—the programming language theoreticians have too long ignored the psychological side of their trade. Programming is not a branch of mathematics, it is a unique form of communication in which human beings take an active role and machines often a passive one. Perhaps our troubles with programming languages stem from the unidirectionality of the communication. Only when the theoreticians turn to the "dialogue" aspects of programming "language" will they finally be forced to recognize that they are not students of symbol manipulation, but of human behavior.

问题

QUESTIONS

对于经理

For Managers

 

1.你们店里用的是什么编程语言？您多久有机会看一次节目？您是否将编程语言视为管理任务的辅助工具，还是将其视为程序员可以在您背后进行交流的秘密语言？

1. What programming languages are used in your shop? How frequently do you have occasion to look at a program? Do you see the programming language as an aid to your managerial task, or do you see it as a secret language in which programmers can communicate behind your back?

2. 在决定将一种新的编程语言引入您的商店时，您会考虑哪些心理因素？你做什么样的实验？

2. What psychological factors do you consider when deciding to introduce a new programming language into your shop? What kinds of experiments do you do?

对于程序员

For Programmers

 

1. 使用你最熟悉的编程语言，给出并讨论以下的几种用途：

1. Using your best-known programming language, give and discuss several uses of:

  • 均匀性

  • uniformity

  • 不均匀

  • non-uniformity

  • 隐蔽类别

  • covert categories

2. 在你所知道的所有语言中，哪种语言最紧凑？是什么让它变得紧凑？它的紧凑性是否取决于您使用它解决的问题范围有限？

2. Of all the languages you know, which is the most compact? What makes it compact? Does its compactness depend upon the limited range of problems for which you use it?

3. 列出你最知名的编程语言产生非本地效果的所有方式。这些效果对调试有什么影响？给出由于非局部性导致的 bug 的例子，以及你最终是如何找到它们的。

3. List all the ways in which your best-known programming language can yield nonlocal effects. What influence do these effect have on debugging? Give examples of bugs due to non-locality, and how you eventually found them.

4. 拿一些别人写的程序，按照给定的程序长度，根据它们的易懂程度对它们进行分类。计算语句标签和分支指令或语句，看看清晰度和缺少分支之间是否存在任何关联。此外，计算分支的平均长度，并清楚地查看具有什么相关性。

4. Take some programs written by others and classify them by the ease with which they can be understood, for a given length of program. Count the statement labels and the branch instructions or statements, and see if there is any correlation between clarity and lack of branching. Also, compute the average length of a branch, and see what correlation that has with clarity.

5. 举例说明您以前了解的编程语言如何影响您现在使用最新语言进行编程的方式。

5. Give some examples of the way in which the programming languages you previously knew affect the way in which you now program in your most recent language.

6. 举例说明您所知道的编程语言如何影响您在编程以外的其他领域的思维过程。

6. Give some examples of ways in which the programming languages you know affect your thought processes in areas other than programming.

7. 如果你知道一种特殊用途的编程语言，请描述它利用的方式：

7. If you know a special-purpose programming language, describe the ways in which it takes advantage of:

  • 论域的局限

  • limitation of the universe of discourse

  • 辅音数据结构

  • consonant data structures

  • 辅音处理功能

  • consonant processing functions

  • 辅音术语

  • consonant terminology

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Rubey, Raymond J., et al., PL/I 指南，卷。1：比较评估，底特律：美国数据处理，1969

Rubey, Raymond J., et al., Guide to PL/I, Vol. 1: Comparative evaluation, Detroit: American Data Processing, 1969

布鲁克斯、FP 等。阿尔。PL/I 指南。卷。2：PL/I 经验，底特律：美国数据处理，1969 年

Brooks, F. P., et. al. Guide to PL/I. Vol. 2: Experiences with PL/I, Detroit: American Data Processing, 1969

这两份文件代表了评估新编程语言价值的两种方法，在本例中为 PL/I。第二种是相当传统的研讨会讨论方法，参与者在其中陈述他们对 PL/I 各个部分和整体价值的看法。然而，第一个是为数不多的从行为上研究程序语言的尝试之一。该方法是通过让同一程序员使用两种不同的语言（COBOL-PL/I、FORTRAN-PL/I 或 JOVIAL-PL/I）编写相同的问题来消除个体差异。该研究的作者显然是程序员，而不是行为科学家，但他们并非没有老练。想要成为实验者的人最好将这项研究与 Sackman 的工作进行比较，这或许会让他们找到介于两者之间的结果。

These two documents represent two approaches to assessing the value of a new programming language, in this case PL/I. The second is a rather conventional seminar-discussion approach, in which participants state their opinions of the value of PL/I in its various parts and as a whole. The first, however, is one of the few attempts to study a program language behaviorally. The method was to eliminate individual variation by having the same programmer program the same problem in two different languages—COBOL-PL/I, FORTRAN-PL/I, or JOVIAL-PL/I. The authors of the study are evidently programmers, not behavioral scientists, but they are not without sophistication. Would-be experimenters would do well to compare this study with Sackman's work, perhaps leading them to something in between.

Sammet, Jean E, Programming Languages: History and Fundamentals , Englewood Cliffs, NJ, Prentice-Hall, 1969 .

Sammet, Jean E, Programming Languages: History and Fundamentals, Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Prentice-Hall, 1969. Along with its other qualities, this book is a gold mine of information on special-purpose languages, and, by induction, their design.

Wirth, N.，PL 360，360 计算机的编程语言，ACM 通讯，15，第 1 期（1968 年 1 月），第 37-74 页。

Wirth, N., PL 360, A Programming Language for the 360 Computers, Communications of the ACM, 15, No. 1 (Jan. 1968), pp. 37-74.

有些人非常强烈地认为，唯一真正通用的语言可能是某种汇编语言。但是汇编语言的困难——尤其是缺乏线性——使这成为一个最令人沮丧的预测。然而，一线希望是 Wirth 采取的方法，将块结构的优势强加到汇编语言上，同时至少在概念上仍然保持对在机器级别生成的代码的完全控制。当然，这是过去十年中出现的系统编程未来最重要的论文之一。

Some people feel quite strongly that the only truly general-purpose language can be some sort of assembly language. But the difficulty of assembly language—particularly the lack of linearity—makes this a most discouraging prognostication. One bright ray of hope, however, is the approach taken by Wirth, to impose the advantages of block structure on an assembly language while still keeping, at least conceptually, full control of the code generated at the machine level. Certainly this is one of the most important papers for the future of systems programming to come out in the last decade.

Weinberg, GM, PL/I Programming: A Manual of Style，纽约，McGraw-Hill 1970。

Weinberg, G. M., PL/I Programming: A Manual of Style, New York, McGraw-Hill 1970.

有关 PL/l 上下文中语言设计原则的详细讨论，请参阅第 2 章。

For detailed discussions of principles of language design in the context of PL/l, see especially Chapter 2.

Klerer, M. 和 J. May，一种面向用户的编程语言，Computer Journal，第 8 期，第 2 期（1965 年 7 月），第 103-109 页。

Klerer, M., and J. May, A User-Oriented Programming Language, Computer Journal, 8, No. 2 (July 1965), pp. 103-109.

从语言设计的角度来看，Klerer 和 May 系统最吸引人的特征是接受——实际上是欢迎——歧义。第二个最有趣的特征是该语言没有名称——要么是谦虚的高度，要么是利己主义的高度。有关更完整的参考资料，请参阅 Sammet。

From a language design point of view, the most intriguing feature of the Klerer and May system is the acceptance—indeed, the welcoming—of ambiguity. The second most intriguing feature is the lack of a name for the language—either the height of modesty or of egoism. For more complete references, see Sammet.

Shaw, CJ, Decision Tables - An Annotated Bibliography , Santa Monica, System Development Corp.（1965 年 4 月），TM-2288/000/000（14 页）。

Shaw, C. J., Decision Tables—An Annotated Bibliography, Santa Monica, System Development Corp. (April 1965), TM-2288/000/000 (14 pp.).

Dixon, Paul，决策表及其应用，计算机和自动化，13，（1964 年 4 月），第 14-19 页。

Dixon, Paul, Decision Tables and Their Application, Computers and Automation, 13, (April 1964), pp. 14-19.

决策表运动在 1960 年代初期蓬勃发展，然后似乎转入地下，现在正在复苏。不幸的是，复兴似乎一方面集中在形式问题上，另一方面集中在构思不当的教科书上。我们还没有看到任何关于决策表在任何心理学意义上的价值的经验数据，鉴于他们声称它们代表了一种比面向过程的语言更自然的编程方式，这尤其令人遗憾。对于那些想要弄清楚这个模糊领域的研究人员，我们提供了上面的参考书目和评论文章，它们应该是 1965 年左右的最新情况。在撰写本文时，似乎真的没有比这更好的了。

The decision table movement flourished in the early 1960s, then seemed to go underground, and now is reviving. Unfortunately, the revival seems to be concentrated on formal problems on the one hand, and ill-conceived textbooks on the other. We have yet to see any empirical data on the value of decision tables in any psychological sense, which is particularly unfortunate in view of the claim they represent a more natural way of programming than procedure-oriented languages. For those researchers who would like to throw some light on this murky field, we offer the bibliography and review article above, which should bring things up to date circa 1965. At the time of this writing, there really seems nothing better.

Weinberg，GM，解决问题的实验（博士论文），安阿伯，大学缩微胶卷，1965 年。

Weinberg, G. M., Experiments in Problem Solving (Doctoral Thesis), Ann Arbor, University Microfilms, 1965.

对受试者在给予选择自由时选择的心理形式的研究，对编程语言中最理想的结构类型有影响。

A study into the mental forms that subjects choose when given the freedom to choose, with implications for the types of structures most desirable in programming languages.

Whorf, Benjamin Lee, Language, Thought, and Reality，剑桥，马萨诸塞州，MlT 出版社，1956 年。

Whorf, Benjamin Lee, Language, Thought, and Reality, Cambridge, Mass., M.l.T. Press, 1956.

沃尔夫是一位人类学家或人类学语言学家，他通过对非“标准-美洲-欧洲”语言的研究，对语言对思想的影响有了深刻的见解——例如隐蔽类别的重要性等见解。其中一些精选著作是对美洲印第安人语言的高度技术性描述，但其他著作可供非语言学家阅读。由于所描述的思维方式不熟悉，它们并不总是易于阅读。谁知道呢，也许连技术文章都有用。我们是否可能如此以种族为中心，以至于相信只有欧洲语言包含有用的计算机编程模型？也许我们可以，但不是在阅读了 Whorf 之后。

Whorf was an anthropologist or anthropological linguist who, through his study of non-"Standard-American-European" languages, gained great insights into the influence of language on thought—such insights as the significance of covert categories. Some of these selected writings are highly technical accounts of American Indian languages, but the others are accessible to the non-linguist. They are not always easy to read because of the unfamiliarity of the modes of thought described. And who knows, maybe even the technical articles would be useful. Can we possibly be so ethnocentric as to believe that only European languages contain useful models for computer programming? Perhaps we can, but not after reading Whorf.

Zipf, GK，《人类行为与最小努力原则》，马萨诸塞州剑桥市，Addison-Wesley，1949 年。

Zipf, G. K., Human Behavior and the Principle of Least Effort, Cambridge, Mass., Addison-Wesley, 1949.

Zipf 和 Whorf 一样，置身于他那个时代的知识分子时尚之外，并且在很长一段时间内才获得认可。任何有兴趣的人都应该阅读他关于语言变化原则的著作，例如，对编程语言的“方言”，尤其是“非冗余”编程感兴趣的人。

Zipf, like Whorf, was outside the intellectual fads of his time, and was a long time in gaining recognition. His work on the principles of language change should be read by anyone who has any interest, for example, in "dialects" of programming language, and particularly in "non-redundant" programming.

Shannon, C. E„ 印刷英语中的预测和熵，贝尔系统技术杂志，卷。30 (1951)，第 50-64 页。

Shannon, C. E„ Prediction and Entropy in Printed English, Bell System Technical Journal, Vol. 30 (1951), pp. 50-64.

请参阅下一个参考资料进行讨论。

See next reference for discussion.

Burton, NG 和 JCR Licklider，印刷英语统计结构中的长期约束，美国心理学杂志，卷。66 (1955)，第 650-653 页。

Burton, N. G., and J. C. R. Licklider, Long-Range Constraints in the Statistical Structure of Printed English, American Journal of Psychology, Vol. 66 (1955), pp. 650-653.

这两篇文章试图测量英文印刷文本中的冗余，并提出了一种测量程序或编程语言冗余的方法。进行这样的实验有很多困难，例如选择合适的程序和文本，但我们的早期结果表明编程语言之间存在一致的差异。

These two articles attempt to measure the redundancy in English printed text, and they suggest an approach to measuring the redundancy of a program or a programming language. There are many difficulties in conducting such an experiment, such as selection of appropriate programs and texts, but our early results indicate that consistent differences exist among programming languages.

Miller, George A.，神奇的数字七，正负二：我们处理信息能力的一些限制，心理评论，63，第 2 期（1956 年 3 月），第 81-97 页。

Miller, George A., The Magical Number Seven, Plus-or-minus Two: Some Limits on Our Capacity for Processing Information, Psychological Review, 63, No. 2 (March 1956), pp. 81-97.

在这篇引人入胜的小文章中，米勒描述了人类大脑的信息容量是如何或多或少地受到限制的，以及它使用什么样的策略来克服这些限制——比如分块的策略。这些策略似乎遵循程序员使用的各种策略。

In this appealing little article, Miller describes how the human mind is limited in its information capacity, more or less, and what kinds of strategies it uses to overcome these limitations—strategies such as chunking. These strategies seem to follow the kinds of strategies programmers use.

Smith, B.，《记忆》，伦敦，Allen and Unwin, Ltd.，1966 年。

Smith, B., Memory, London, Allen and Unwin, Ltd., 1966.

Yates, FA，《记忆的艺术》，芝加哥，芝加哥大学出版社，1966 年。

Yates, F. A., The Art of Memory, Chicago, The University of Chicago Press, 1966.

Minsky, M.，语义信息处理，马萨诸塞州剑桥市，MlT 出版社，1968 年。

Minsky, M., Semantic Information Processing, Cambridge, Mass., M.l.T. Press, 1968.

关于内存的三种截然不同的观点以及编程语言设计或应该设计的各种心理过程。当根据心理学原理设计编程语言时，我们立即会遇到很多关于心理过程的争论，尤其是记忆等“高级”过程，这些过程对编程来说非常重要（或者是？）。

Three very different views of memory and the sorts of mental processes toward which programming languages are designed, or should be designed. When designing programming languages according to psychological principles, we immediately encounter so much controversy over mental processes, especially the "higher" processes such as memory, which are so important (or are they?) to programming.

第12章：程序设计语言设计的一些原则点评

Comments on Chapter 12: Some Principles for Programming Language Design

几年前，一位面试官问道：“您认为您对计算机科学的最大贡献是什么？” （口语问题中隐含了大写字母。）

A few years ago, an interviewer asked, "What do you consider your greatest contribution to Computer Science?" (The capital letters were implied in the spoken question.)

我的第一反应是我对计算机科学（我不认为它是一门“科学”）没有任何贡献，但随后从我嘴里跳出了以下答案。“我对计算的最大贡献是我从未发明一种编程语言。”

My first reaction was that I have contributed nothing to Computer Science (which I don't regard as a "science"), but then the following answer popped out of my mouth. "My greatest contribution to computing is that I never invented a programming language."

我不知道那个答案是从哪里来的，但我现在意识到这完全是一种懦弱的逃避。回顾第一版，我发现我已经像程序员通常做的那样保护自己免受责备——通过转移到元级别。诚然，我从未设计过编程语言，但我确实设计了编程语言所依据的设计原则——也就是说，我是编程语言的元设计师。

I don't know where that answer came from, but I now realize it was entirely a cowardly cop-out. Looking over the first edition, I see I was already protecting myself from blame in the way programmers usually do—by moving to the meta-level. It's true that I never designed a programming language, but I did design principles on which programming languages were designed—that is, I was a meta-designer of programming languages.

作为一名元设计师，我可以坐在场边发表评论，而不用承担任何责任。因此，我现在承认自己是最早的汇编语言的评论员之一；在 FORTRAN 上（我与开发人员共享一台计算机，批评了他们的目标代码，并错误地预测 FORTRAN 永远不会存在）；在 APL 上（我所在的小组中，肯·艾弗森 (Ken Iverson) 首次将他的语言思想公开发表给公众批评）；在 COBOL 上（通过 MetaCOBOL 的努力）；在 PL/I 上；在模拟器上；在 IBM System/360 机器语言和作业控制语言上（坦白并不容易）；在 Pascal 上（与瑞士的 Niklaus Wirth 合作）；关于用于正式描述编程语言的维也纳定义语言（与 IBM 维也纳实验室的 Heinz Zemanek 团队合作）。

Being a meta-designer allowed me to sit on the sidelines and comment, without taking responsibility. Therefore, I now own up to having been one of the commentators on the earliest assembly languages; on FORTRAN (I shared a computer with the developers, critiqued their object code, and wrongly predicted that FORTRAN would never last); on APL (I was in the group to which Ken Iverson first made his language ideas available for public criticism); on COBOL (through the MetaCOBOL effort); on PL/I; on Simula; on IBM System/360 machine language and job control language (confessions aren't easy); on Pascal (with Niklaus Wirth in Switzerland); on the Vienna Definition Language for formal description of programming languages (with Heinz Zemanek's team at the IBM Vienna Laboratories). I even had a few things to say (of unknown influence) on the early versions of Algol(s), C, and Smalltalk, plus (and this is the part I'm most proud of) on dozens of languages that I may have helped be stillborn (including at least three with the name "Magic").

1970 年去东欧旅行时，我震惊地听到自己被称为“编程语言之王”。自我意识就这么多。近年来，我试图忏悔我的“syns”并远离语言评论业务，但这很困难。我所意识到的也许是编程心理学最重要的原则：

On a trip to Eastern Europe in 1970, I was shocked to hear myself referred to as "the King of Programming Languages." So much for self-awareness. In recent years, I've tried to repent my "syns" and stay out of the language-commenting business, but it's been difficult. What I've realized is perhaps the most important principle of programming psychology:

每个程序员都是元语言专家。

Every programmer is a meta-language expert.

 

我认为这是我敢于对名为“程序设计语言设计的一些原则”的一章发表的唯一评论。

I think that is the only comment I dare make on a chapter called "Some Principles for Programming Language Design."

第 13 章其他编程工具

Chapter 13. Other Programming Tools

 

尽管编程语言在印刷品中获得了最大的关注，但工作的程序员还有其他交易工具。他将大部分时间花在阅读和编写文档、研究操作系统以及排除程序中的错误上。在这些任务中，他也可以使用社会科学可能扔给他的任何碎屑。然而，从心理学的角度来看，这些任务比编程语言更容易被忽视。在接下来的部分中，我们将尝试建议如何使用某些见解来更好地设计调试工具、程序级别以上操作的管理以及文档。可供调用的编程资源非常少，但也许这种努力将把这个主题开辟到一个新的设计工作时代。我们当然可以使用它们！

Although programming languages get the lion's share of the attention in print, the working programmer has other tools of the trade. He spends much of his time reading and writing documents, wrestling with the operating system, and wringing the bugs out of his programs. In these tasks, too, he could use whatever crumbs the social sciences might throw him. Yet these tasks are even more neglected than are programming languages—from the psychological point of view. In the following sections we shall try to suggest how certain insights could be used to better the design of tools for debugging, for management of operations above the program level, and for documentation. There are very few programming sources to call upon, but perhaps this effort will open up the subject to an era of new design efforts. We certainly could use them!

程序测试工具

PROGRAM TESTING TOOLS

1962 年 9 月，一则新闻发布称，一枚价值 1800 万美元的火箭在早期飞行中被摧毁，因为“指令磁带中遗漏了一个连字符”。文章没有说这盘“说明书”有多大，但我们可以想象，里面可能有10万条左右的说明书。在任何其他业务中，十万分之一的错误将被视为惊人的可靠性记录，但在编程中，它花费了 1800 万美元。成本可能很高，但故事每天都在重复。事实上，仅从测试的角度来看编程工作就可以富有成果——考虑到编程中唯一真正的问题是让程序正确运行并证明它。

In September of 1962, a news item was released stating that an $18 million rocket had been destroyed in early flight because "a single hyphen was left out of an instruction tape." The article did not say how large the "instruction tape" was, but we can imagine it might have contained 100,000 or so instructions. In any other business, one error in 100,000 would be considered a phenomenal reliability record, but in programming, it cost $18 million. The cost may be exceptional, but the story is repeated daily. Indeed, the job of programming can be fruitfully looked at from the point of view of testing alone—considering that the only real problem in programming is getting the program to work correctly and proving it.

人们说：“高手是避开小错误，大错特错的人”。然而，在编程中，即使是很小的错误也要避免，这绝非易事。实际上，没有“小”错误，因为即使是“单个连字符”也可能导致灾难。编程的本质就是这样，错误的“大小”与其引起的问题之间没有关系。因此，除了“消除所有错误”之外，很难制定任何程序测试目标——这是一项不可能完成的工作。

People say, "the expert is a person who avoids the small errors as he sweeps on to the grand fallacy." In programming, however, avoiding even the small errors is no mean task. In reality, there are no "small" errors, since even a "single hyphen" can result in disaster. The nature of programming being what it is, there is no relationship between the "size" of the error and the problems it causes. Thus, it is difficult to formulate any program testing objective short of "the elimination of all errors"—an impossible job.

显然，我们需要在测试程序方面获得一切可能的帮助，但程序测试问题在编程工具设计者中所受到的关注却很少。此外，在设计测试工具时，测试心理问题很少出现。然而，测试首先是一个心理问题。例如，考虑一下信心问题。理想的测试工具应该使我们对程序的信心与其应得的信心成正比，这样我们既不会通过包含错误的程序，也不会继续探测没有错误的程序。今天有什么程序测试系统能为我们提供这方面的最少信息？

Obviously, we need all the help we can get in testing programs, but the problem of program testing has received less than its share of attention from designers of programming tools. Moreover, when testing tools are designed, the question of the psychology of testing is rarely evident. Yet testing is first and foremost a psychological problem. Consider, for instance, the question of confidence. The ideal testing tool should give us confidence in our program exactly proportional to the confidence it deserves, so we neither pass on a program containing errors nor continue probing a program which is error-free. What program testing system today gives us even the minimum information in this regard?

例如，为了对程序的测试有信心，我们应该想知道我们的测试在多大程度上涵盖了编码。我们的意思是，作为开始，测试系统应该保留并向我们展示在运行测试过程中已执行和未执行的那些编码区域的记录。相信事情如他们所愿是我们社会中人们的天性，因此程序测试工具必须努力向我们展示事物的本来面目。当然，我们可以预料到我们使用的测试工具会继续困扰我们，直到所有代码片段都至少执行一次。

For example, to have confidence in the testing of a program, we should want to know to what extent our tests covered the coding. By this we mean, as a start, that the testing system should keep and present to us a record of those areas of coding that have and have not been executed in the course of running tests. It is in the nature of people in our society to believe that things are as they want them to be, so a program testing tool must struggle to show us things as they are. Certainly, we could expect that the testing tools we use would continue to pester us until all pieces of code had been executed at least once.

由于人们往往对他们的代码状态持乐观态度，因此可以根据破坏信心的原则设计一个好的测试工具——必要时可以恢复的信心。在一个程序（计算 30,000 多个制成品的价格）的案例中，该程序的客户无意中遇到了四种价格错误的情况。他对程序的信心被摧毁了，甚至当程序员能够向他展示只有当某个维度超过某个大小时才会出现错误时，他仍然持怀疑态度。碰巧的是，只有一个额外的案例存在这个错误，但很快就自己找到了四个，客户不会相信程序员。

Since people tend to be optimistic about the state of their code, a good testing tool might be designed on the principle of destroying confidence—a confidence that can be restored when necessary. In the case of one program (which calculated the prices of more than 30,000 manufactured objects) the customer for the program accidentally came across four cases in which the prices were wrong. His confidence in the program was destroyed, and even when the programmer was able to show him that the error occurred only when a certain dimension exceeded a certain size, he remained skeptical. As it happened, there was only one additional case in which this error existed, but having found four by himself rather quickly, the customer was not about to believe the programmer.

程序员的过度自信可能会受到将随机错误引入被测程序的系统的攻击。这些错误的位置和性质将记录在系统内部，但对程序员是隐藏的。他发现并消除这些已知错误的速度可以用来估计他消除未知错误的速度。监视系统经常使用类似的技术，在该系统中，操作员需要连续八个小时查看雷达屏幕，以了解非常罕见的事件，例如不明飞机经过。性能测试表明，有必要引入一些非零的人为事件发生率，以使操作员保持令人满意的唤醒状态。而且，由于这些事件都在系统的控制之下，

Overconfidence by the programmer could be attacked by a system that introduced random errors into the program under test. The location and nature of these errors would be recorded inside the system but concealed from the programmer. The rate at which he found and removed these known errors could be used to estimate the rate at which he is removing unknown errors. A similar technique is used routinely by surveillance systems in which an operator is expected to spend eight hours at a stretch looking at a radar screen for very rare events—such as the passing of an unidentified aircraft. Tests of performance showed that it was necessary to introduce some nonzero rate of occurrence of artificial events in order to keep the operator in a satisfactory state of arousal. Moreover, since these events were under control of the system, it was able to estimate the current and overall performance of each operator.

虽然我们不能引入模拟真实错误的程序错误，也不能像我们可以在雷达屏幕上模拟真实的飞机一样，但这种技术当然可以用于在程序测试中培训和评估程序员。即使错误必须由项目中的其他人手动引入，尝试这种“调试”系统似乎也是值得的。这会给程序员极大的动力，因为他现在知道：

Although we cannot introduce program bugs which simulate real bugs as well as we can simulate real aircraft on a radar screen, such a technique could certainly be employed both to train and evaluate programmers in program testing. Even if the errors had to be introduced manually by someone else in the project, it would seem worthwhile to try out such a "bebugging" system. It would give the programmer greatly increased motivation, because he now would know:

• 他的程序有错误。

• There are errors in his program.

• 他没有把它们放在那里。

• He did not put them there.

• 如果他没有找到它们，其他人就会知道。

• If he didn't find them, other people would know about it.

我们只需将这种情况与目前普遍存在的情况进行对比：

We have only to contrast this state of affairs with the currently prevalent one:

• 他并不真正相信他的程序中存在错误。

• He is not really convinced there are errors in his program.

• 他知道如果有错误，那是“他的”。

• He knows if there are errors, they are "his."

• 如果他找不到他们，他很确定没有人会知道这件事。

• If he doesn't find them, he is pretty sure that nobody will know about it.

然而，我们最终对特定程序测试的信心程度并不仅仅取决于测试过程。程序正确的先验概率对达到给定置信度水平必须进行的测试量有很大影响。以最简单的情况为例，考虑以下两个代码片段：

The amount of confidence we ultimately have in the testing of a particular program, however, does not depend on the testing procedure alone. The a priori probability of a program being correct has a great influence on the amount of testing that has to be done to reach a given level of confidence. To take the simplest possible case, consider the two code fragments:

如果 N = 1 那么 A = A + 1.5；

IF N = 1 THEN A = A + 1.5;

如果 N = 2 那么 A = A + 2.9；

IF N = 2 THEN A = A + 2.9;

如果 N = 3 那么 A = A + 0.1；

IF N = 3 THEN A = A + 0.1;

如果 N = 20 那么 A = A - 3.2；

IF N = 20 THEN A = A - 3.2;

另一方面，

and, on the other hand,

A = A + B(N);

A = A + B(N);

显然，第二种情况不太容易出错，尽管我们当然不能排除在构造数组 B 时的错误。例如，假设第一种情况中的一行被误键，所以在序列中间的某个地方我们发现

Clearly, the second case is less subject to errors although we certainly cannot rule out errors in constructing the array, B. For example, suppose one line in the first case were miskeyed, so that in the middle of the sequence somewhere we found

如果 N = 11 那么 A = A + 4.7；

IF N = 11 THEN A = A + 4.7;

如果 N = 11 那么 A = A + 2.6；[11 应该是 12]

IF N = 11 THEN A = A + 2.6; [the 11 should be 12]

N = 11 和 N = 12 的情况都是完全错误的，但这些情况可能不会出现在测试中。然而，在第二种方法中，每种情况都是独立的，也就是说，如果我们正确地输入了 B 的特定元素，那么 B 中的任何其他元素都不会影响它。此外，第二个程序通过引发 SUBSCRIPTRANGE 条件来处理 N 小于零或大于 20 的情况。第一个程序简单地忽略了那些可能是灾难的情况。

The cases for N = 11 and N = 12 would both be completely wrong, but these cases might not arise in the testing. In the second method, however, each case is independent, that is, if we enter a particular element of B correctly, nothing else in B can influence it. Moreover, the second program handles the case of N less than zero or greater than 20 by raising the SUBSCRIPTRANGE condition. The first program simply ignores those cases, which could be a disaster.

这些例子的心理要点是：经过同等数量的测试后，我们对第二个程序的信心会比对第一个程序的信心大得多。为什么？因为第二个程序显示出第一个程序没有的一致性。对这个程序的单个测试完成对另一个程序的许多测试的工作。无论我们是从我们的编程语言还是从我们对程序结构的特定概念获得这种一致性，效果都是一样的：对于给定数量的测试，我们对程序有更大的信心。因此，最好的测试工具必须基于高度统一的语言和程序结构。

The psychological point of these examples is this: we will have far more confidence in the second program than in the first, after an equal amount of testing. Why? Because the second program displays a uniformity the first does not. A single test on this program does the work of many tests on the other. Whether we get this uniformity from our programming language or from our particular conception of the program structure, the effect is the same: For a given amount of testing, we receive a greater amount of confidence in the program. Thus, the best possible testing tool must be based both on a language and a program structure with a high degree of uniformity.

以类似的方式，我们可以争辩说缺乏局部性和缺乏紧凑性会使程序更难测试。但是，有没有什么方法可以让测试系统衡量程序的一致性、局部性和紧凑性？如果有，一个乱七八糟、零散的、浪费的程序可以在编译后和测试开始前被送回程序员或他的主管进行检查。

In a similar way, we can argue that lack of locality and lack of compactness make a program more difficult to test. But is there some way a testing system could measure the uniformity, locality, and compactness of a program? If there were, a scraggly, scattered, prodigal program could be sent back to the programmer or his supervisor for inspection after compilation and before testing is allowed to begin.

我们没有实验证据表明可以构建这样的测试辅助工具，但我们可以就该问题的研究方向提出一些建议。一方面，局部性可以通过计算标签的数量、GO TO 语句以及对在不同页面上声明的变量的引用来衡量。可以通过计算某种“平均参考距离”来获得更复杂的局部性度量，无论是针对整个程序还是针对其中的某些部分。除了我们今天收到的常见编译器警告之外，还可以计算并警告潜在的问题点，例如部分打开的子例程或更改变量的 ON 单元。

We have no experimental evidence that such a testing aid could be built, but we can make several suggestions about directions for research on the problem. For one thing, locality could be measured by counting the number of labels, GO TO statements, and references to variables declared on a different page. More sophisticated measures of locality could be obtained by calculating some sort of "mean distance of reference," either for the whole program or for sections of it. Potential trouble spots, such as partially open subroutines or ON-units which change variables, could be counted and warned about, in addition to the usual compiler warnings we get today.

一致性和紧凑性可能更难衡量，但在我们开始编写一个程序对于特定工作来说多大才合理之前，有助于判断紧凑性的一些想法。均匀性和紧凑性的一种衡量标准可以是每个变量的引用数量。对一个变量的少量引用可能表明它被不必要地引入并且可以被删除；大量此类引用可能意味着分散的操作可以通过不同的程序结构进行整合。在不使用数组表达式的情况下统计每个数组被引用的次数可能是缺乏一致性的一个合格指标，因为从某种意义上说，数组是同类数据项的集合，因此是同类处理的候选对象。

Uniformity and compactness might be a little more difficult to measure, but an aid in judging compactness would be some idea before we started coding how large a program would be reasonable for a particular job. One measure of uniformity and compactness could be the number of references per variable. A small number of references to a variable could indicate that it has been introduced unnecessarily and could be eliminated; and a large number of such references could mean that scattered operations could be consolidated through a different program structure. A tally of the number of times each array was referenced without using array expressions could be a passable indicator of lack of uniformity, for an array is, in a sense, a collection of homogeneous data items, and therefore a candidate for homogeneous treatment.

另一种检测缺乏一致性和紧凑性的方法是让编译器检测代码中的某些模式。举个简单的例子，考虑在同一个程序中使用类似的名称，例如 N1、N2、N3、N4 和 N5。首先，正如我们所知，这样的名字集会招致错误，因为一个名字对于另一个名字来说可能很容易写或读。但是，如果使用这样的名称确实代表了某种统一的含义，也许可以将它们所代表的变量收集到一个数组中，并以更统一的方式进行处理。模式检测的一个更微妙的例子是重复使用相似的代码序列。这种重复可能表明可以通过循环、子例程或宏定义来实现更多压缩，或者它可能根本没有任何意义。任何状况之下，

Another approach to detecting lack of uniformity and compactness would be for the compiler to detect certain patterns in the code. As a simple example, consider the use of similar names such as N1, N2, N3, N4, and N5 in the same program. In the first place, as we know, such a collection of names is an invitation to error, for one name may be easily written or read for the other. But, if the use of such names really represents some uniformity of meaning, perhaps the variables they represent could be collected into an array and treated in a more uniform manner. A more subtle example of pattern detection would be the repeated use of similar code sequences. Such repetition might indicate that more compression could be achieved by making a loop, a subroutine, or a macro definition, or it might indicate nothing at all. In any case, the field is wide open for the investigator with a few ideas and a knowledge of programming psychology.

另一个众所周知的观察心理偏差是过度依赖“早期”数据回报。在程序测试中，较早获得程序“成功”的程序员很可能过早地停止测试。防止这种错误的一种方法是在测试之前准备测试，如果可能的话，在编码之前准备测试。我们在这里指的是与检测错误存在有关的测试——而不是所有测试。显然，我们无法通过提前构造测试来定位错误源；一旦发现错误，我们也无法构建纠正错误的程序。但是所有的测试都是从检测开始的，所以在测试用例上的前期工作永远不会浪费——除非我们屈服于绕过剩余测试的诱惑，因为我们目前已经取得了“优秀”的结果。

Another well-known psychological bias in observation is the over-dependence on "early" data returns. In program testing, the programmer who gets early "success" with his program is likely to stop testing too soon. One way to guard against this mistake is to prepare the tests in advance of testing and, if possible in advance of coding. We refer here to tests concerned with detecting the presence of errors—not to all tests. Obviously, we cannot construct tests in advance for locating the source of an error; nor can we construct the procedures for correcting the error once it has been found. But all testing begins with detection, so advance work on test cases is never wasted—unless we yield to the temptation to bypass the remaining tests in view of the "excellent" results we have so far.

调试系统可以通过强制我们提前指定我们计划进行的测试量来帮助我们抵制这种诱惑。未能完成此数量的测试可能会导致管理报告或对程序员的某种其他形式的刺激。一般来说，当然，测试系统中任何简化测试用例的准备和执行的东西都将帮助程序员克服过早退出的诱惑。今天使用的一个这样的系统是专门设计用来抵消当对程序进行“小”更改时跳过重新测试的诱惑。如果测试用例存储在系统中并且可以按需自动重新运行，程序员就不太可能跳过重新测试。然而，这种典型的系统会产生大量的输出。如果没有人查看重新运行的结果，那么重新运行测试用例几乎没有用。通过提供旧结果和新结果之间的自动比较，可以在这些系统中实现很大的改进，从而使程序员只关注那些每次运行不同的情况。

The debugging system could help us to resist this temptation by forcing us to specify in advance the amount of testing we plan to do. Failure to complete this number of tests could result in a management report, or some other form of prodding to the programmer. In general, of course, anything in the testing system that simplifies the preparation and execution of test cases will help the programmer to overcome the temptation to quit too soon. One such system in use today is particularly designed to counteract the temptation to skip retesting when a "small" change has been made to the program. If the test cases are stored in the system and can be rerun automatically on demand, the programmer is less likely to skip the retest. The typical system of this sort, however, produces vast amounts of output. It is hardly useful to rerun test cases if nobody looks at the results of the rerun. A great improvement could be wrought in these systems by providing automatic comparison between old results and new ones, thus calling the programmer's attention only to those cases that differ from one run to the next.

最后必须对改进程序测试中涉及的心理行为的可能性进行观察。通常，正如我们在“局部性”概念下讨论的那样，当程序员很难找到错误时，那是因为他找错了地方。这听起来很简单，但一旦程序员“锁定”在错误的地方，就很难让他换个地方看。一般来说，人工调试顾问最好的建议是让客户去别处看看，或者至少在同一个地方做一些不同的事情。可能一个自动调试系统可以迫使程序员在查看同一区域一段时间后将注意力集中到新的编码区域。可以设计各种算法来选择下一个给他看的地方，但最重要的是让他脱离困境。事实上，一个好的系统就是简单地关闭他的终端一段时间，让他有机会看一些树木、草地或迷你裙——除了那段错误的代码之外的任何东西。

One final observation must be made about the possibilities for improvement of the psychological behavior involved in program testing. Typically, as we discussed under the concept of "locality," when a programmer has a difficult time finding a bug, it is because he is looking in the wrong place. As simple as this sounds, that is how difficult it is to get the programmer to look in a different place, once he has "locked in" on the wrong one. In general, the best advice for human debugging consultants is to make the client look somewhere else, or at least do something different with the same place. Possibly an automated debugging system could force the programmer's attention to new areas of coding after he had been looking at the same area for a certain length of time. All sorts of algorithms could be devised for choosing the place to show him next, but the most important thing is just to get him unstuck. In fact, a good system is simply to turn off his terminal for a while, giving him a chance to look at some trees or grass or mini-skirts—anything but that wrong section of code.

操作系统

OPERATING SYSTEMS

编程语言设计中一直存在的争议之一是：调试工具的合适位置是什么——在语言中还是在操作系统中？通过在本节中提出问题，我们似乎在争论中偏袒了一方，但不应得出这样的结论。双方都有很多事情要做。一方面，不应该要求程序员仅仅为了调试他的程序而学习一门全新的语言——转储的恐怖清楚地表明了这一点。另一方面，语言层面向程序员隐藏了实际操作环境的许多现实情况，而正是这些现实可能导致程序测试中的最大问题。

One of the persistent controversies in programming language design is this: What is the proper place for debugging tools—in the language or in the operating system? By raising the question in this section, we may seem to be taking sides in the argument, but no such conclusion should be drawn. Both sides have much going for them. On the one hand, the programmer should not be required to learn an entirely new language just to debug his programs—the horror of dumps makes that point clear. On the other hand, the language level conceals from the programmer many of the practical realities of an actual operating environment, and it is just these realities which may lead to the greatest problems in program testing.

适当的妥协——至少在心理上——似乎是对面向操作环境现实的基本编程语言的一定程度的扩展。但是，不应随意添加此扩展，因为大多数操作系统功能似乎已添加，但应该与语言的其余部分保持高度一致。然而，对统一性的要求给操作系统的实现带来了很大的负担，因为典型的操作系统不仅支持一种编程语言，而且支持多种编程语言。因此，对于操作系统人员来说，提供一种单一的、独立的他们自己的语言似乎更容易，这种语言是使用每种受支持语言的程序员必须掌握的。

The proper compromise—at least on psychological grounds—seems to be a certain amount of extension to the basic programming language which faces up to the realities of the operating environment. This extension, however, should not be added willy-nilly, as most operating system features seem to have been added, but should have a high degree of uniformity with the rest of the language. The requirement for uniformity, however, places a great burden on the operating system implementation, because the typical operating system supports not just one, but several, programming languages. Thus, it seems easier for the operating system people to supply a single, separate language of their own, a language which programmers in each of the supported languages must then master.

例如，在 OS/360 的情况下，这种语言基于 System/360 的汇编语言——我们已经注意到了一些后果。对于操作系统的设计者和实现者来说，这个选择一定是很自然的，因为不是每个人都懂汇编语言？但即使对于那些了解汇编语言的人来说，它的格式可能也不是最适合作业控制语言的——至少设计者选择的是这样。例如，OS/360 作业控制语言在很大程度上依赖于所谓的“位置参数”的使用，而对“关键字参数”的依赖则少得多。但是，当用户非常熟悉该语言的编码并且想要尽可能大的压缩时，位置参数似乎是最有帮助的。然而，在作业控制的典型使用中，用户从未获得太多不同选项的经验，并且更有可能使用他身边打开的手册来创建他的作业控制。在那种情况下，关键字参数的安全和确定标识——没有顺序要记住，没有逗号表示省略的项目，

In the case of OS/360, for example, this language was based on the assembly language for System/360—with some consequences we have already noted. To the operating system designers and implementers, this choice must have seemed entirely natural, for didn't everyone know assembly language? But even for those people who did know assembly language, its format was probably not the most suitable for a job control language—at least as chosen by the designers. For example, the OS/360 job control language relies heavily on the use of so-called "positional parameters" and much less heavily on the "keyword parameters." But positional parameters would seem to be most helpful when the user was very familiar with coding in the language and wanted the greatest possible compression. In the typical use of job control, however, the user never gains much experience with the different options and is more likely to create his job control with the open manual at his side. In that case, the safe and sure identification of keyword parameters—no order to remember, no commas to indicate omitted items, mnemonic names with each keyword—would seem to have favored their use.

我们的两名学生测试了这些关于关键字参数在相对不熟悉的情况下编码的优越性的直觉感受。他们使用经验丰富和缺乏经验的程序员组，先以一种形式编写一些非编程材料，然后再以另一种形式编写。他们发现位置编码速度更快，即使对于新材料和没有经验的人也是如此。但出错率是后者的两倍到四倍。考虑到作业控制的情况——几乎没有时间花在参数的实际编码上，也没有提供帮助来帮助发现其中的错误——3 倍的错误似乎太高了，无法为编码增加 30% 付出代价速度。

Two of our students tested these intuitive feelings about the superiority of keyword parameters for coding in relatively unfamiliar situations. They used groups of experienced and inexperienced programmers, coding some non-programming material first in one form and then in the other. They found that positional coding was somewhat faster, even for new material and inexperienced people. But the rate of making errors was from two to four times as high. Considering the situation in job control—where little time is spent in the actual coding of the parameters and little assistance is given to help find bugs in them—three times as many errors seems too high a price to pay for a 30 percent increase in coding speed.

在选择作业控制格式时可能从未考虑过这些问题，因为这似乎只是实现操作系统问题的一小部分。另一个问题，对于操作系统设计者来说可能看起来很小，是会计问题，或者在一般意义上，性能评估。对于许多程序员来说，调试并不是生产线的终点。该程序可能会运行，但运行成本可能过高。操作系统设计者似乎不愿意询问有关程序将运行多长时间、占用多少内核、在哪些文件上处理了多少记录、使用了多少 CPU 时间等信息。一些愤世嫉俗者甚至建议制造商不希望他们的客户获得此类信息，以免他们看到“巨脑”所做的实际生产有多么少。

Such matters were probably never considered in the choice of a job control format, for that seems such a small part of the problem of implementing an operating system. Another problem, which probably seems quite small to operating system designers, is the matter of accounting, or, in a generalized sense, performance evaluation. For many programmers, debugging is not the end of the line. The program may run, but it may cost too much to run. Operating system designers seem to be reluctant to ask for information on how long a program will run, how much core it occupied, how many records were processed on which files, how much CPU time was used, and so forth. Some cynics have even suggested that manufacturers do not want their customers to have such information, lest they see how little actual production is being done by the "giant brain."

不管制造商的感受如何，性能评估信息都是操作系统任务的重要组成部分。一方面，性能数据通常会提供程序错误的独立线索。运行速度太快的程序可能会绕过某些代码段；并且运行速度太慢的可能会在预期没有循环的地方循环。但是，除了调试的这一附带好处之外，如果程序员要学习编写性能良好的程序，则直接需要此类性能信息。如果没有这些信息的简单自动反馈，那些最需要它的程序员将永远看不到它。此外，良好的会计信息，由程序员分类，帮助安装管理确定哪些程序员需要帮助以及哪些程序员准备提供帮助。令人惊讶的是，我们在计算方面取得了如此大的进步，而无需每个计算机用户都要求制造商为他提供某种最小的会计方案。

Regardless of how the manufacturers feel, performance evaluation information is an essential part of the operating system's task. For one thing, performance figures often give independent clues to program bugs. A program that runs too fast may be bypassing certain segments of code; and one that runs too slow may be looping in a place where no looping was expected. But more than this side benefit for debugging, there is the direct need of such performance information if programmers are ever going to learn to turn out programs that perform well. Without the simple and automatic feedback of such information, those programmers who need it most will never see it. Moreover, good accounting information, sorted by programmer, aids the installation management in determining which programmers are in need of help and which programmers are prepared to give it. It seems astonishing that we can have progressed as far as we have in computing without every computer user demanding that the manufacturer furnish him with some sort of minimal accounting scheme.

计算机制造商有时会争辩说，客户有独特的需求，如果制造商试图告诉他们所需的会计信息类型，他们会被冒犯。很难想象更公然的合理化，而且它让人认为愤世嫉俗者可能是对的，毕竟。我们当然可以确定一组通用要求作为大多数安装的启动器，并在操作系统的标准记帐例程中提供它们。任何对这个程序不满意的顾客都可以用他自己的替换它——当然不会比他现在的更令人困惑。事实上，至少对于一个制造商来说，由于系统从来没有提供任何标准的会计程序，“用户提供”的界面 会计程序有一种随着系统的每个新版本而改变的方式。五六个版本发布后，大多数客户都吸取了教训，不再试图跟上变化。在这个行业的所有人中，制造商似乎对心理学原理的掌握最为务实——至少当这些原理可以用来避免做他们不想做的事情时。

Computer manufacturers sometimes argue that the customers have unique needs and would be offended if the manufacturer tried to tell them the kind of accounting information required. A more blatant rationalization would be hard to imagine, and it makes one think that the cynics might be right, after all. We could certainly identify a common set of requirements to serve as a starter for most installations and provide them in a standard accounting routine for the operating system. Any customer who was dissatisfied with this routine could replace it with his own—certainly no more confusing than what he has now. In fact, with one manufacturer at least, since there was never any standard accounting routine supplied with the system, the interface for the "user-supplied" accounting routine had a way of changing with each new release of the system. After five or six releases, most customers had learned their lesson and had stopped trying to keep up with the changes. Of all the people in the business, the manufacturers seem to have the most pragmatic grasp of psychological principles—at least when the principles can be used to avoid doing something they don't wish to do.

如果我们要列出一份会计程序所需的信息清单，那么批处理系统中典型周转时间的衡量标准将接近顶部。当然，操作系统无法记录完整的周转时间，除非在其监督下有远程信息的进入和退出，但如果没有完整的画面，机器进入和退出之间的时间会回答很多问题。然而，即使我们完全掌握了影响转机的因素，我们仍然不得不面对什么是理想转机的问题——主要是心理问题。

If we were to make a list of the information desired from an accounting routine, a measure of typical turnaround time in batch systems would be near the top. Of course, the operating system is not in a position to record the complete turnaround unless there is remote entry and exit of information under its supervision, but lacking the complete picture, the time between machine entry and exit would answer many questions. Yet, even if we had a complete grasp of the factors affecting turnaround, we would still have to face the problem—largely psychological—of what constitutes ideal turnaround.

我们的一名学生着手调查理想周转的问题。他对程序员和他们的经理进行了调查，使用的技术隐藏了个人身份，但可以知道组成员身份。他的第一个重要发现是，不同的群体往往对转变有不同的感知需求，但在一个群体内，意见相对稳定。据推测，不同种类的工作需要不同种类的服务。

One of our students undertook to investigate the question of ideal turnaround. He polled both programmers and their managers, using a technique in which individual identities were concealed but group membership could be known. His first important finding was that different groups tended to have different perceived needs for turnaround, but that within a group the opinion was relatively stable. Presumably, different kinds of work require different kinds of service.

第二个发现是，在几个小组中，经理和小组成员对小组需求的看法截然相反。在一个小组中，当小组成员觉得他们需要的是——因为他们正在调试操作系统的输入输出部分——有更多机会在机房时，经理正在推动远程访问设备“以改善周转时间”他们跑了。

A second finding was that in several groups, the manager and the group members had diametrically opposed ideas about the group's needs. In one group a manager was pushing for remote access equipment "to improve turnaround" when the group members felt that what they needed—because they were debugging the input-output section of an operating system—was more opportunity to be in the machine room when their runs were made.

有时，经理们倾向于认为程序员想要“零周转”——即刻接受并返回工作岗位。这项调查和其他观察结果证明与这种印象相矛盾，因为程序员的要求似乎很低。在另一项旨在比较两种不同编程语言的功效的研究中，一些参与者抱怨说转变太好了！为了便于研究，他们被给予了特别的优先权，结果是从作业通过窗口到输出被放置在输出表上，测量的平均周转时间为 31 分钟。抱怨是，如果周转时间稍差一些，他们就会花更多的时间进行更正，并仔细阅读输出以寻找更多错误。

Sometimes, managers are inclined to think the programmers want "zero turnaround"—instant acceptance and return of their jobs. This survey and other observations give evidence to contradict this impression, for the programmers' demands seem quite modest. In another study—one designed to compare the efficacy of two different programming languages—several of the participants complained that the turnaround was too good! They had been given special priority in order to facilitate the study, with the result that the measured average turnaround was 31 minutes from the time the job was passed through the window until the time the output was placed on the output table. The complaint was that if turnaround had been a little poorer, they would have spent a bit more time in making corrections and in perusing their output for additional errors.

那么，在某种程度上，如果程序员在一次运行中投入的等待时间非常少，他可能会倾向于认为运行较少——这一观察似乎也适用于某些终端系统。在另一个极端，非常差的周转时间使程序员在提交运行时几乎处于神经质状态。犯最小错误的代价是如此之大——他可能会在等待的过程中损失一个星期——以至于他可能会发现自己因为纯粹的紧张而犯错误。而且，他会尽量把自己能想到的都投入到跑中，这样就增加了他犯错的机会，也增加了跑的时间。车间陷入糟糕的周转情况是很常见的，因为每个人都出于自卫而进行超长运行，而这些超长运行导致周转情况恶化。

In a way, then, if the programmer has invested very little waiting time in a run, he may tend to value that run less—an observation which seems to hold for certain terminal systems as well. At the other extreme, very poor turnaround puts the programmer in an almost neurotic state when he submits a run. The cost of making the smallest error is so great—he might lose a week while waiting—that he may find himself making errors out of sheer nervousness. Moreover, he will try to put everything he can think of into the run, thus increasing his chance of making an error and also increasing the run time.
