It is common for a shop to drift into a poor turnaround situation with everyone making extra-long runs out of self-defense, and with these very extra-long runs causing the turnaround situation to deteriorate.

因为每次运行的工作类型不同，所以真的不可能为周转时间规定一个单一的最佳数字。通常，同一工作每天运行超过四次或可能五次就不能得到充分利用，少于两次就会开始引起焦虑和不正确的做法。然而，对于最初的工作，当程序员刚刚从他的代码中得到语法和键入错误时，终端访问似乎是可取的。然而，在保证每天运行四次的商店里的人显然不像在经营不佳的商店里的程序员那样为这些“微不足道的”错误而烦恼。

Because the type of work differs from run to run, it is really impossible to state a single optimal figure for turnaround time. Usually, more than four, or possibly five, runs per day of the same job cannot be utilized fully, and fewer than two begins to induce anxiety and unsound practices. For initial work, however, when the programmer is just getting syntax and keying errors out of his code, terminal access would seem to be desirable. However, people in shops where four runs per day are assured are apparently not as troubled about these "trivial" errors as are programmers in less well-run shops.

正如我们之前在其他情况下所指出的，平均时间并不是唯一重要的心理因素。如果周转时间非常不确定——一天运行 6 次，而下一次则没有——程序员就无法有效地计划他的工作。在短时间内，程序员将通过设置他们的测试运行来保护自己免受最坏情况的影响，从而对不确定性做出反应，从而产生浪费和不好的感觉。

As we have noted before in other contexts, the mean time is not the only important psychological factor. If the turnaround is very uncertain —six runs one day and none the next—the programmer is not able to plan his work effectively. In a short time, programmers will react to uncertainty by setting up their test runs to defend themselves against the worst situation, with resultant waste and bad feeling.

对周转产生不良感觉的另一个来源是放弃优先权。我们的一项研究中的程序员抱怨说，某些（其他）人似乎无缘无故地获得了优先的机器访问权限。当针对某些特定的工作特征（例如预期运行时间）以统一的方式给出优先级时，没有明显的敌意。然而，当没有给出理由或理由不一致时，敌意似乎同时针对授予者（经理）和受赠者（程序员）。由于这两种形式的敌意对编程团队来说都不是非常健康，最好完全放弃这种特殊的恩惠。

Another source of bad feeling with respect to turnaround is the doling out of priority. Programmers in one of our studies complained that certain (other) people seemingly got favored machine access for no apparent reason. No particular rancor was evident when priority was given out in a uniform way with respect to some particular job characteristic, such as expected running time. Nevertheless, when no reason was given, or when the reason was inconsistent, enmity seemed to be directed against both the grantor (the manager) and the grantee (the programmer). Inasmuch as neither form of enmity would appear to be terribly healthy for a programming group, it might be best to dispense with such special favors altogether.

当建立优先系统以优先于某些类型的工作时，最初可能会有一些阻力，或者至少是焦虑，但随着新系统的影响变得明显，这种情况通常会减少。良好的运行统计数据的存在和发布显然有助于获得认可，因为每个程序员都可以自己判断某些行为的后果并相应地调整他的运行。一种典型的情况是，较长的作业、占用超过一定数量核心存储的作业或需要特殊设置的作业被赋予较低的优先级。起初，每个人似乎都觉得他的工作应该成为这些规则的例外；但如果对于那些在限制范围内的人来说，效果实际上是更好的转变，那么提交的工作的性质很快就会开始改变。

When a priority system is established to favor certain types of jobs over others, there may be some initial resistance, or at least anxiety, but this usually diminishes as the effects of the new system become evident. The existence and publication of good operating statistics apparently help in gaining acceptance, for then each programmer can judge for himself the consequences of certain actions and adjust his runs accordingly. A typical situation is one in which lower priority is given to longer jobs, jobs that take more than a certain amount of core storage, or jobs that require special setups. At first, everyone seems to feel that his jobs should be made an exception to these rules; but if the effect is actually better turnaround for those who fall within the limits, the nature of the jobs being submitted soon begins to change. Estimates of running time and core storage become better, and special setups that were once fervently defended as "essential" now seem to disappear.

这种情况只是适用于操作环境的“效果法则”的又一个例子。无论操作环境是好是坏，程序员最终都会以尽其所能的方式适应它。因此，如果程序员因对整个操作有害的行为而受到奖励——或者即使他根本没有因此受到惩罚——所有程序员最终都会采用适合他们的行为。例如，一些安装要求程序员对他们的工作进行时间估计，以便操作员可以更好地安排工作。如果以一个实际案例为例，所有估计时间十五分钟或更短时间的工作都以同样的方式处理，

Such a situation is just one more example of the "law of effect" as applied to the operating environment. Whatever the operating environment—be it good or bad—the programmers will eventually adapt to it in ways to do the best they can for themselves. Thus, if a programmer is rewarded for behavior detrimental to the operation as a whole—or even if he is simply not penalized for it—all programmers will eventually be adopting that behavior if it suits them. For example, some installations require that the programmers make time estimates of their jobs so that the operators can schedule the work better. If, to take one actual case, all jobs of fifteen minutes or less estimated time are treated in the same way, all programmers will eventually discover that it is best —for them—to put down an estimate of fifteen minutes even if they think they will need only one minute.

事实上，要求程序员做出比操作系统准备采取行动更精细的判断是没有意义的。安装可能只是要求程序员将他的工作分类为“不到两分钟”、“两到十五分钟”或“超过十五分钟”，可能同时指示每个选择的优先级结果。类似地，如果系统是多道程序并且只有两种大小的作业分区，则应要求程序员选择其中一种——而不是给出精确到最接近字节的空间估计。设置不强制执行的规则，或设置不使用的限制，只会导致那些必须在这些规则和限制下工作的人对系统的蔑视。

In fact, there is no sense bothering to ask the programmer to make finer judgments than the operating system is prepared to act upon. The installation might simply ask the programmer to classify his job as "under two minutes," "two to fifteen minutes," or "over fifteen minutes," possibly indicating at the same time the priority consequences of each choice. Similarly, if the system is multiprogramming and there are only two sizes of job partitions, the programmer should be asked to select one or the other—not give a space estimate down to the nearest byte. Setting rules that are not enforced, or setting limits that are not used, can only result in contempt for the system by those who must work under those rules and limits.

效果法则的作用可以是显而易见的，也可以是极其微妙的。而且，涉及的不仅仅是通常的“系统”。程序员适应影响其工作表现的环境的任何方面，无论系统管理员是否将其视为其系统的一部分。例如，萨克曼 (Sackman) 在他的一项研究中观察到，对于有四个以上问题的受试者来说，等待工作或终端的时间大幅下降，他用以下方式解释这一点：“看起来学员在他们的时间策略上变得更有效率了因为他们获得了更多经验而请求计算机服务。”

The action of the law of effect can be blatantly obvious or surpassingly subtle. Moreover, it is not just the usual "system" that is involved. Programmers adapt to any aspect of the environment that affects the performance of their jobs, regardless of whether or not the system manager considers it part of their system. Sackman, for instance, observed in one of his studies that waiting time for jobs or terminals dropped substantially for subjects with more than four problems, which he interprets in the following way: "It seems as if the cadets became more efficient in their timing tactics for requesting computer service as they gained more experience."

虽然萨克曼称这个结果“出乎意料”，但他的惊讶可能是因为他是一名心理学家，而不是程序员。任何专业程序员都观察到他自己和其他人对系统的特性进行了这样的调整，而系统的运行在很大程度上决定了他的成败。GH Stange 在我们的编程课程心理学研究中，研究了两个旨在取代调度系统的远程输入系统的引入。他观察到调度员的日程安排和特点有很多变化，但其中最不寻常的是观察到一项工作的周转时间取决于卡片的包装方式！用橡皮筋包裹的甲板是最好的（50% 的工作在不到三个小时内恢复），其次是硬纸板卡盒（32% 的用户返回），金属卡盒最差（同一时间段内只有 12% 的用户返回）。Stange 检查了容器与时间或核心需求之间可能存在的相关性，但没有发现任何相关性。显然，越小找工作得到了操作员的优待——一些程序员已经开始意识到其中的区别。作为补偿，他们尽一切努力使他们的套牌看起来尽可能小；将小甲板放在金属盒子里将是一场灾难。

Although Sackman calls this result "unexpected," his surprise can probably be attributed to his being a psychologist and not a programmer. Any professional programmer has observed himself and others making such adaptations to the peculiarities of the system whose operation determines in large measure his success or failure. G. H. Stange, in a study for our psychology of programming class, studied the introduction of two remote entry systems which were intended to replace a dispatcher system. He observed many adaptations to the dispatcher's schedule and peculiarities, but the most unusual of these was the observation that the turnaround time of a job depended on the way the cards were packaged! A deck wrapped with a rubber band was the best (50 percent of the jobs were back in less than three hours), a cardboard card box was next (32 percent were back), and a metal card box was worst (only 12 percent back in the same interval). Stange checked on a possible correlation between container and time or core requirements and found none. Evidently, the smaller looking jobs got preferential treatment by the operators—and some of the programmers had begun to be aware of the difference. To compensate, they made every effort to make their decks look as small as possible; placing a small deck in a metal box would be a disaster.

当远程工作输入系统被引入这家商店时，这种对甲板的优惠待遇在理论上被取消了，但 Stange 继续展示其他因素如何导致程序员能够适应的差别待遇。第一个因素是对新系统的了解，这导致了学习如何使用它并防止其他人知道的某种动机。但后来人们开始清楚，未经培训的人使用该系统会导致卡片卡住和其他故障，只会干扰其他人的工作。这时，知识渊博的人开始四处游荡，充当接线员，以确保自己的工作不会被耽误。由于这种保护性等待，系统明显节省的大部分时间都丢失了，

When a remote job entry system was introduced into this shop, such preferential treatment of decks was theoretically removed, but Stange goes on to show how other factors led to differential treatment to which the programmers could adapt. The first factor was knowledge of the new system, which led to a certain incentive to learn how to use it and to keep others from knowing. But then it began to be clear that untrained people using the system led to card jams and other malfunctions that only interfered with other people's work. At this point the more knowledgeable people began to hang around and act as operators, so as to be sure that their own jobs would not be delayed. Because of this protective waiting, much of the apparent savings of the system was lost, because the programmers did nothing while waiting except make sure that nobody messed up the system.

最终，程序员聚集在终端周围导致了其他影响——特别是将程序暴露给其他人。打印机速度极慢，所以聚集的人群可以观看打印出来的节目并发表评论。此外，人们还讨论了 RJE 系统本身以及编程的其他方面。这种增加的社会接触最终会做什么还不得而知，因为它被一个人作为非官方“操作员”的出现打断了。当系统经常崩溃时，他接受了这份工作以保护自己的利益——他重新进入所有工作，但总是设法先得到他的。这种为他的工作提供的改进服务显然是他运行该系统的唯一回报，但其他人接受了这个价格，以换取不必在入口室等待。所以，在短暂的扰动之后，系统恢复到一种看起来非常像旧的加速器模式的模式，在程序员和“系统”之间插入了另一个人。完成工作的工作再次变成了操纵人而不是操作系统本身的工作。此外，旧的 expediter 系统并没有被移除，因为 expediter 也为该地区的其他程序员服务。当 RJE 系统表现不佳时，他的服务被用作备份，作为一种在不占用 RJE 的情况下运行具有许多卡片或大量打印输出的作业的方法，以及作为一种在不需要 RJE 所需关注的情况下获得夜​​间作业服务的方法。第二个 RJE 系统被一些程序员使用。它有一个 CRT 设备，被发现在甲板的初始准备中很有用，

Ultimately the congregation of programmers around the terminal led to other effects—in particular, to exposure of programs to other people. The printer was extremely slow, so the assembled throng could watch programs coming off and make comments. Also, people conversed about the RJE system itself and about other aspects of programming. What this increased social contact would have done eventually is not known, because it was cut short by the emergence of one individual as unofficial "operator." He took the job to protect his own interests when the system would break down often—he reentered all jobs, but always managed to get his in first. This improved service for his jobs was apparently his only reward for operating the system, but others accepted this price in return for not having to wait in the entry room. And so, after a short perturbation, the system settled back to a pattern that looked very much like the old expediter pattern, with another human being interposed between the programmers and the "system." The job of getting one's work done became once again the job of manipulating a human being rather than the operating system itself. Moreover, the old expediter system was not removed, since the expediter served other programmers in the area as well. His service was used as a backup when the RJE system was behaving badly, as a way of running jobs with many cards or large printout without tying up RJE, and as a way of getting overnight service on jobs without the attention needed for RJE. The second RJE system was used by some programmers. It had a CRT device, and was found to be useful in initial preparation of decks, but particularly for monitoring the progress of jobs submitted by the other two methods.

总的来说，这两个系统的安装最终产生了预期的效果——增加了每个程序员每天的工作数量并缩短了周转时间。这种改进并不是简单地通过解决设备问题来实现的，而是通过提供一个丰富的环境——一组更多的选择，程序员可以根据这些选择调整他们提交工作的策略。当然，我们不知道为该组提供的更大灵活性是否是以其他一些用户为代价的。最终，必须建立一些规则和限制来维持各种竞争用户之间的平衡。

Overall, the installation of these two systems eventually had the desired effect—an increase in the number of jobs per programmer per day and a reduction in turnaround time. This improvement was not achieved simply by overpowering the problem with equipment, but by providing an enriched environment—an increased set of choices to which the programmers could adapt their strategy of submitting jobs. We do not know, of course, whether the increased flexibility available to this group was at the expense of some other users. Eventually, some rules and limits have to be established to maintain a balance among the various competing users.

然而，如果要建立合理的规则和限制，操作系统必须具有足够的灵活性来接受它们并根据它们采取行动。在设置使用它的过程时，操作系统的灵活性也是可取的。确保高效且有效地使用系统的最佳方法是使高效且有效的方法最容易使用。在一个设计良好的操作系统中，可以通过制作经常使用或应该经常使用的作业控制语言的“编目程序”来改变系统的整体面貌。通过这种方式，可以通过使工作更轻松的奖励来引导程序员以更好的方式使用机器。

If sensible rules and limits are to be established, however, the operating system must have sufficient flexibility to accept them and act upon them. Flexibility in the operating system is also desirable when setting up the procedures by which it is to be used. The best way to ensure that the system is used efficiently and effectively is to make the efficient and effective ways the easiest to use. In a well-designed operating system, the entire face of the system can be changed by making "catalogued procedures" of job control language that is, or should be, frequently used. In this way, the programmer can be guided into better ways of using the machine by the reward of making the job easier.

鉴于对每个安装中会计程序的专门需求的争论，有趣的是观察某些制造商如何倾向于——即使不总是口头上，也通过行动——鼓励客户使用他们的“标准”工作控制程序，而不是而不是自定义构建自己的。当然，标准程序必须足够通用以适应任何配置和任何词语组合，因此它们通常不是任何特定工作或安装的最佳选择。也许我们这里有一个在更大范围内运作的效果法则的例子。毕竟，如果使用更多的机器时间，计算机制造商会得到更多的报酬。因此，他们应该不鼓励使用可能会提高效率的东西（例如会计程序），这是很自然的，买者自负！

In view of the arguments about the specialized needs for accounting routines in each installation, it is interesting to observe how certain manufacturers tend—by deed if not always by word-—-to encourage customers to use their "standard" job control procedures, rather than custom building their own. The standard procedures, of course, must be sufficiently general to-fit any configuration and any mix of words, so they are not usually optimal for any particular work or installation. Perhaps what we have here is an example of the law of effect operating on a grander scale. After all, computer manufacturers get paid more if more machine time is used. It is only natural, therefore that they should discourage the use of things (such as accounting routines), which might lead to greater efficiency, and encourage the use of things (overgeneralized job control procedures), which might lead to lessened efficiency. Caveat emptor!

分时与批处理

TIME-SHARING VERSUS BATCH

对计算机制造商的怀疑最大的莫过于对引入分时系统的反应。经常听到老前辈嘀咕，分时不过是另一种让计算效率更低的方案，进一步中饱资本家的腰包。当然，与其他计算机创新一样，分时技术是在没有进行任何心理调查的情况下大规模实施的。人们认为它会起作用，或者想认为它会起作用，所以它被推向市场，战斗开始了。

Suspicion of computer manufacturers is nowhere greater than in the reaction to the introduction of time-sharing systems. Old-timers are often heard muttering that time-sharing is merely another scheme to introduce even more inefficiency into computing, so as to further line the pockets of the capitalists. Certainly time-sharing, like other computer innovations, was undertaken on a large scale with no psychological investigation whatsoever. People thought it would work, or wanted to think it would work, so it was pushed onto the market and the battle began.

总的来说，分享者和批次之间的斗争是在骂人的层面上进行的。然后，突然间，随着 Sackman 出版了他的书《人机问题解决：分时和批处理的实验评估》，我们在争论中呼吸到了实验性的新鲜空气。那些仍然怀疑心理学方法解决计算问题的能力的读者应该从头到尾阅读 Sackman 的书，就像分时与批处理争论中任何一方的所有支持者一样。

By and large, the fight between the sharers and the batchards has been conducted on the level of name-calling. Then, suddenly, we had a breath of experimental fresh air rushing through the argument, as Sackman published his book, Man-Computer Problem Solving: Experimental Evaluation of Time-Sharing and Batch Processing. Those readers who still doubt the ability of psychological methods to clear up computing problems should read Sackman's book from cover to cover, as should all advocates of either side in the time-sharing versus batch controversy.

我们不能希望在这里像 Sackman 那样深入地调查这个问题，但是我们不能不对分时与批处理的争论给我们的教训类型做一些评论，因为这是我们拥有的一个领域大多数经验信息。

We cannot hope here to survey the problem in the depth that Sackman has obtained, but we cannot leave without some comments on the kinds of lessons the time-sharing versus batch controversy has given us, since this is the one area in which we have the most empirical information.

一个很好的起点是潜入一个领域的假设类型，即使是最彻底的调查者也可能认为这是理所当然的。在 Sackman 的案例中，个人作为适当研究单位的想法根本没有受到质疑，这并不出人意料，因为该假设已内置于所有分时系统的硬件和软件中！例如，我们没有适合两个或更多人一起工作的终端，没有终端，我们就完全缺乏支持它们的软件甚至软件创意。此外，Sackman 的假设被他进行大部分测试的学校环境所强化。当然，在空军学院，任何项目合作都将被视为作弊——老天爷禁止！

One good starting place is the types of assumptions which creep into a field and may be taken for granted by even the most thorough investigator. In Sackman's case, the idea of the individual as the proper unit of study is never questioned at all, which is hardly unexpected since that assumption is built into the very hardware and software of all time-sharing systems! We do not, for example, have terminals that are suitable for two or more people working together at them and, lacking the terminals, we completely lack the software or even software ideas to support them. Moreover, Sackman's assumption Is reinforced by the school environment in which most of his tests were conducted. Certainly at the Air Force Academy any cooperative work on a program would be regarded as cheating—heaven forbid!

Sackman 工作的另一个教训是，即使是最彻底的调查员也偶尔会对他的结果做出错误的解释。在他的一项研究中，Sackman 在批处理模式下绘制了语法错误的平均数与会话数的关系图，并找到了“经典的错误消除曲线”。虽然错误确实“消失”了，但这根本不是心理学家观察到的消失，例如，当一个受试者连续尝试记住一个列表时，错误的数量就会减少。

Another lesson from Sackman's work is that even the most thorough investigator can occasionally make a wrong interpretation of his results. In one of his studies, Sackman plots mean number of syntax errors versus session number in the batch mode and finds "the classic error-extinction curve." Although it is true that errors are "extinguished," this is not at all the extinction which psychologists observe, for instance as a subject reduces the number of errors made on successive attempts to memorize a list.

如果我们的研究与 Sackman 的小组有任何相关性，那么典型的批量工作的程序员会经历两个阶段。首先，他致力于他的第一个无错误编译，这可能需要运行 0-5 次。一旦他有了这个，他就开始一次改变一个语句，在通常情况下，当他收敛到一个语义正确的程序时。他可能会在这一条语句中出错——特别是如果他是我们之前假设的“自信”类型的话——但他的大部分语句从未被触及，因此无需程序员自己的努力就可以保持无错误。打孔卡“消除”错误，而不是程序员的记忆。

If our studies have any relevance to Sackman's group, the typical programmer working in batch goes through two phases. First he works toward his first error-free compilation, which might take 0-5 runs. Once he has that, he proceeds to change a single statement at a time, in the usual case, as he converges toward a semantically correct program. He may make an error in this single statement—especially if he is the "assertive" type we postulated earlier—but the bulk of his statements are never touched and thus remain error-free through no effort of the programmer himself. The punched card "extinguishes" errors, not the programmer's memory.

好吧，只要错误被消除，谁来消除又有什么关系呢？对于系统设计者来说，这应该很重要。让我举个例子。几年前，我走进一家编程商店，当时他们正在为远程输入环境确定语法检查器的规范。PL/I 的检查器让我感兴趣，我查看了规格。编写它们的人曾要求检查器能够在单个语句的上下文中检测到“批处理编译器可以检测到的任何错误”。这里的图像是一个程序员试图在他的第一次尝试中获得完美的编译，这无论如何是不可能的，因为一次一行的语法检查器无法检测到全局错误。为了确定这样一个检查器的价值，

Well, so what does it matter who does the extinguishing, as long as the errors are extinguished? To the systems designer, it should matter a great deal. Let me give an example. A few years ago, I walked into a programming shop at the time they were firming up specifications for a syntax checker for a remote entry environment. The checker for PL/I interested me, and I took a look at the specifications. Whoever had written them had asked that the checker be able to detect "any error the batch compiler could detect" within the context of a single statement. The image here was of a programmer attempting to get a perfect compilation on his first try, which would be unlikely anyway because of global errors not detectable by a line-at-a-time syntax checker. To determine how valuable such a checker could be, one has to have an accurate model of the error patterns to be fed on it.

我们的模型为 PL/I 程序员提供了下图。在第一次编译成功之前，多次编译排除语法错误的主要原因是没有关闭注释或字符串，导致大段代码根本逃避语法检查。但这正是批处理编译器检测不到的两个错误，它们将被排除在语法检查器之外！通过简单地检查这两件事而不是其他任何事情，达到无错误状态的平均编译次数可能会减少一次，并且方差会减少更多。

Our model gives the following picture for PL/I programmers. Before the first successful compilation, the major cause of multiple compilations to eradicate syntax errors is the failure to close comments or strings, which causes large segments of code to escape syntax checking at all. But these are precisely the two errors not detectable by the batch compiler, and they were going to be left out of the syntax checker! By simply checking those two things and nothing else, the average number of compilations to reach an error-free state could probably be reduced by one, and the variance reduced even more.

一旦进行了第一次成功的编译，语法错误主要是最粗略的错误，例如由草率键入引起的错误。这些错误通常是全局性的，在某种意义上，名称被打错了，而在其他方面则相当微不足道，例如不匹配的括号和拼写错误的关键字。这里最有用的检查器是发现粗略错误，然后检查与从以前的编译中保存的符号的兼容性。当然，如果每个新会话都导致程序发生重大变化，那么保存符号表就没有意义了，只有程序员行为的明确模型才能告诉我们如何设计我们的系统。

Once the first successful compilation has been made, syntax errors are largely the most crude errors, such as those are caused by hasty keying. These errors are often global, in the sense that a name is miskeyed, and are otherwise rather trivial, such as unmatched parentheses and misspelled keywords. The most useful checker here would be one that finds crude errors and then makes a check for compatibility against the symbols saved from a previous compilation. If, of course, each new session results in major changes in the program, saving the symbol table will not be worthwhile, and only an explicit model of programmer behavior tells us how to design our system.

如果我们和 Sackman 一样相信每次新的批处理本质上都是一个新的开始，其中语法错误已经通过程序员的学习“消除”，我们将选择进行不参考先前编译的语法检查。但是，如果我们相信程序员的语法知识在解决一个问题的过程中基本保持不变（尽管显然不是完全如此），并且他只是通过一次消除一个语句来“消除”错误，那么我们将选择一个完全不同的系统设计——一个能给程序员更大的满足感和更高效的系统性能的设计。

If we believe, with Sackman, that each new batch run is essentially a fresh start in which syntax errors have been "extinguished" by learning by the programmer, we will choose to make a syntax check that makes no reference to the previous compilation. But, if we believe the programmer's knowledge of syntax remains largely unchanged (although obviously not completely so) over the course of one problem, and he "extinguishes" errors simply by eliminating them one statement at a time, then we will choose a rather different system design—one that will give greater programmer satisfaction and even more efficient system performance.

系统性能问题贯穿于 Sackman 的工作中，尽管他像每位优秀的科学家都应该尝试的那样，试图分离出可以解释行为的组件，但他始终遇到交互效应，这使得这种分离成为不可能。例如，程序员将“语言”与“系统”混淆，性能差异可能归因于批处理系统中使用 ALGOL 和在线 BASIC。但是即使在两个系统中使用“相同”的语言，它们也不相同，因为每个系统都有其特殊的控制语句，这些语句必须从批处理到在线不同，以及某些在一个环境中必不可少且无用的功能在另一个。

The question of system performance pervades Sackman's work, and although he tries, as every good scientist should, to isolate the component that can account for a behavior, he consistently runs up against interaction effects, which make such separation impossible. For example, "language" is confused with "system" by the programmers, and differences in performance might be attributable to the use of ALGOL in the batch system and BASIC on-line. But even if the "same" language is used in both systems, they are not the same, since each system has its special control statements, which must differ from batch to on-line, as well as certain features essential in one environment and useless in the other.

使批处理系统和联机系统“具有可比性”的另一个问题是终端可用性与周转时间的关系问题。六小时的周转时间与正负三小时的差异是否与终端用户在 90% 的时间可用的终端上只能拍摄 15 分钟的在线系统具有可比性？Sackman 不断遇到诸如此类无法解决的问题，最终他得出结论，一个糟糕的终端系统比一个好的批处理系统更糟糕，而一个好的终端系统比一个糟糕的批处理更好。有些人可能认为这是一个微不足道的结论，但它代表了朝着远离诸如“在线优于批量”或“批量优于在线”等空洞陈述的方向迈出的重要一步。现在我们必须继续 Sackman' 我们的工作是识别那些使批处理系统良好的因素，以及那些使终端系统良好的因素。不幸的是，我们可能无法像我们希望的那样巧妙地分离“因素”，因为我们的系统确实是系统。

Another problem in making batch and on-line systems "comparable" is the question of terminal availability versus turnaround time. Is a six-hour turnaround with a variance of plus or minus three hours comparable to an on-line system in which terminal users are limited to fifteen-minute shots on terminals that are available 90 percent of the time? Sackman is constantly running up against unsolvable questions such as this, and eventually he concludes that a bad terminal system is worse than a good batch system, whereas a good terminal system is better than a bad batch. Some may think this to be a trivial conclusion, but it represents a major step in the direction away from such vacuous statements as "on-line is better than batch," or "batch is better than on-line." Now we must continue Sackman's work to identify those factors that make a batch system good, and those that make a terminal system good. Unfortunately, we probably won't be able to separate "factors" as neatly as we would like, since our systems really are systems.

最后，考虑到每个回合都会发现个体差异，无论如何都可能不值得付出努力。也许我们应该让萨克曼用他自己的话总结整个案例，并向我们展示批处理与在线争论现在应该转向哪里：

Finally, it may not be worth the effort anyway, in view of the individual variations found at every turn. Perhaps we should let Sackman summarize the entire case in his own words, and show us where the batch-versus-on-line controversy should now turn:

也许这些研究的中心结果是，没有真正实质性的案例可以证明一种模式优于另一种模式的压倒性通用优势。与所有研究一样，性能上的个体差异无一例外地掩盖了计算机系统差异。在提高人机效率方面取得重大突破的关键似乎在于个体差异的性质和结构以及人类解决问题的方式。无论一个机构的目标是有效地教授计算机科学还是生产具有成本效益的计算机程序，有效实现系统和机构目标的途径是人机通信中解决人类问题的基本知识。

Perhaps the central result from these studies is that no really substantive case can be made for the overwhelming general-purpose advantage of one mode over the other. As in all studies, without exception, individual differences in performance overshadow computer system differences. The key to major breakthrough in improved man-computer effectiveness seems to lie in the nature and structure of individual differences and in human problem-solving styles. Whether the object of an institution is to teach computer science effectively or to produce cost-effective computer programs, the path to effective achievement of system and institutional goals is fundamental knowledge of human problem-solving in man-computer communication.

 

文档

DOCUMENTATION

文档是编程的蓖麻油——管理者认为它对程序员有好处，而程序员却讨厌它！事实上，经理们知道它一定很好，因为程序员非常讨厌它，就像我们过去知道碘对膝盖磨损有好处一样，因为我们能感觉到刺痛。好吧，民间医学在编程和在家一样顽固，因此很难推销文档本身没有内在价值的想法。文档的价值只有在文档做好的情况下才能实现。如果做得不好，那将比根本没有文档更糟糕。

Documentation is the castor oil of programming—managers think it is good for programmers, and programmers hate it! In fact, the managers know it must be good because programmers hate it so much, just the way we used to know that iodine was good for that abrasion on our knee because we could feel the sting. Well, folk medicine dies hard, in programming as at home, so it is going to be difficult to sell the idea that documentation, as such, has no intrinsic value. The value of documentation is only to be realized if the documentation is well done. If it is poorly done, it will be worse than no documentation at all.

就可以确定的而言，没有办法强制程序员编写好的文档。有些程序员可能被迫制作文档，就像有些孩子可能被迫服用蓖麻油一样。不幸的是，破坏文档有用性的方法太多，强制使用只会导致文档不值得用于打印它们的纸张。那么，要生成好的文档，唯一的希望就是让程序员相信这样做对他有利。如果生成文档的行为对程序员没有价值，那么该工作将始终以尽可能少的方式完成；但是，如果生成文档具有可证明的良好效果，那么将无法阻止相当好的文档。

As far as can be determined, there is no way to force programmers to produce good documentation. Some programmers can be forced to produce documentation, just as some children can be forced to take castor oil. Unfortunately, there are so many ways to sabotage the usefulness of documentation that forcing only results in documents that are not worth the paper used to print them on. The only hope, then, for producing good documentation is to convince the programmer that it will benefit him to do so. If the act of producing the document has no value to the programmer, the job will always be done in the minimum possible way; but if producing the document has demonstrable good effects, there will be no way of preventing reasonably good documentation.

我们所说的相当好的文档是什么意思？我们的重点实际上是“合理”这个词，因为我们通常错误地对文档期望过高。首先，不同的人在查看程序的文档时有不同的需求，因此没有文档系统能够同样好地满足他们。我们应该设定一个合理的目标，并努力实现符合该目标的良好文档。如果它碰巧很好地实现了其他目标，那是一种奖励；但如果没有，那么我们将不得不为不同的目标制作一些不同的文件，或者不用。其次，有些事情是文档永远做不到的。这些事情中最主要的是让一个未经训练的人有可能用 25 个或更少的单词来理解关于一个程序的所有知识。

What do we mean by reasonably good documentation? Our emphasis is really on the word "reasonably," for we usually err in expecting just too much from documentation. In the first place, different people have different needs when they look at the documentation for a program, so that no system of documentation is going to satisfy them all equally well. We should set a goal that is reasonable and try to achieve good documentation which meets that goal. If it happens to meet some other goal reasonably well, that is a bonus; but if not, then we shall have to produce some different documents for the different goal, or do without. Secondly, there are certain things no documentation will ever do. Primary among these things is making it possible for an untrained person to understand all there is to know about a program in twenty-five words or less.

使用程序的文档总是需要一些工作和一些最低限度的先决条件知识。如果读者不懂英语，他就不会理解用英语编写的程序文档，没有人会为此责怪文档编写者。但指望不懂 FORTRAN 的人也能完全理解用 FORTRAN 编写的程序，同样是不合理的。如果一个程序被设计为供人们使用，而不是作为更大系统中的一个小齿轮——如果他了解该程序的预期用途，则可能期望他了解如何使用该程序。然而，我们不能指望未通过高中代数的人可以理解使用求解微分方程的程序。我们至少可以期待的是，

Using the documentation for a program will always require some work and some minimum prerequisite knowledge. If the reader does not understand English, he is not going to understand a program document written in English, and nobody would blame the documenter for that. But it is equally unreasonable to expect that someone who does not understand FORTRAN can understand fully a program written in FORTRAN. He may be expected to understand how to use a program, if it is designed to be used by people, rather than to fit as one small cog in a larger system—if he understands the use for which the program was intended. We must not, however, expect that the use of a program for solving differential equations can be made understandable to a person who has not passed high-school algebra. What we can expect, as a minimum, is that if the reader has a high school education, he should be able to see from the first page of the documentation that he will not be able to understand it if he should get in any deeper.

“深度”是最重要的文档概念之一，尤其是对于大型系统。如果一个系统有任何规模，文档的不同用户在他们提取的信息中将需要不同程度的详细信息。最高级别应该足够详细，以告诉用户他是否能够阅读文档。在每个级别——因为我们永远无法确定哪个文档会落入用户手中——文档中第一个也是最显眼的东西应该是对其上方和下方文档的深度引用，以及对文档的深度的指示。本文档的内容以及读者使用它必须具备的知识。

"Depth" is one of the most important documentation concepts, especially for large systems. If a system is of any size at all, different users of the documentation will need different levels of detail in the information they extract. The highest level should be just sufficiently detailed to tell the user whether or not he will be able to read the documents. At each level—because we can never be sure which document will fall into the user's hands—the first and most conspicuous thing in the document should be a reference to the documents above and below it in depth, along with an indication of the depth to which this document goes and the knowledge the reader must have to use it.

没有这种最低限度的自描述结构，任何文档系统都不可能成功，但用户也必须花时间理解这种结构信息并加以使用。我们不能指望我们随意拿起的任何文件都是理解系统的正确切入点，就像我们开始阅读第 353 页的《卡拉马佐夫兄弟》时我们不能指望理解 Aloysha 的角色一样。在小说中，当然，假设读者知道有一个标准结构，它极大地简化了作者的任务，因为他知道大多数认真的读者都会从头开始读到最后。然而，在记录一个大系统时，作家们——除了遭受不是陀思妥耶夫斯基或詹姆斯的不足之外——还必须与那些不 不知道从哪里开始。因此，每个物理文档都必须包含一些指导信息。

Without this minimum of self-describing structure, no system of documentation can be expected to succeed, but the user must also take the time to understand this structural information and to use it. We cannot expect that any random document we pick up will be the proper entry point to the path of understanding a system, any more than we can expect to understand the role of Aloysha if we start reading The Brothers Karamazov on page 353. In novels, of course, there is a standard structure which the reader is assumed to know, and it simplifies the author's task no end to know that most serious readers are going to start at the beginning and read toward the end. In documenting a large system, however, the writers—in addition to suffering the deficiency of not being a Dostoevsky or a James—have to contend with readers who don't know where to begin. Thus, each physical document must contain some guiding information.

当然，将我们的思维局限在书本等实物文献上，未免有些短视。最有可能的是，在我们开始使用我们的数据处理机器以创造性的方式记录他们自己的程序之前，编程文档的问题不会真正得到解决。可以肯定的是，我们现在已经朝着这个方向开始了——就像我们通常开始走向自动化一样——通过机械化我们在机械化之前所做的相同功能。因此，排版和组合是通过“管理终端系统”完成的，具有自动协助更新的所有好处——这是编程中非常常见的问题。但是，我们与文档用户交流的内容大体上仍然受限，因为我们仍在通过书籍这一媒介进行工作。

Of course, it is a bit shortsighted of us to confine our thinking to physical documentation such as books. Most likely, the problems of programming documentation will not really be solved until we start using our data-processing machines to document their own program in a creative way. To be sure, we have started in this direction now—as we usually start toward automation—by mechanizing the same functions we used to do before mechanization. Thus, typesetting and composition are done with "administrative terminal systems," with all the benefits of automatic assistance of updating—that oh-so-frequent problem in programming. But, we are still by and large limited in what we can communicate to the user of the document because we are still working through the medium of books.

现在，一个作者过于强烈地谴责继续使用书籍是不明智的，但这种媒介的正常运作是有限度的。首先，书籍并不是接受和传播最新材料的最灵活的媒介。从这些文字印在打字纸上到第一位读者亲眼看到它们，已经有足够的时间来制作婴儿，从基本成分开始。在某些情况下，在金钱或准确性或两者兼而有之的情况下，时间跨度可以稍微缩短一些，但对于那些变化与大型系统的程序文档一样快的材料，媒体本身的速度不够快。

Now, it would not be smart for an author to decry too violently the continued use of books, but there are limits to the proper functioning of this medium. In the first place, books are not the most flexible medium for accepting and disseminating updated material. From the time these words are impressed on the typing paper until they are seen in print by the first reader's eyes, sufficient time will have elapsed in which to make a baby, starting with the basic ingredients. In some cases, at somewhat increased cost in money or accuracy or both, the time span can be reduced a bit, but the medium is not inherently fast enough for material which changes as fast as program documentation for a large system.

其次，无论手捧一本舒适的书依偎在火炉前多么惬意，很少有人在那种环境下使用编程文档。对于一般概述文档（用于教授和学习系统的一般概念），书籍可能是合适的媒介。但是对于特定技术问题的答案，还需要其他东西。我们不能相信用户可以在复杂系统必须存在的文档迷宫中找到自己的出路，因此我们必须提供一个以主动方式引导用户的系统。在这种主动指导方面，有什么能比通过合适终端的窗口查看的计算机更好的呢？

In the second place, no matter how nice it is to cuddle up before the fire with a cozy book in your hand, few people use programming documentation in that environment. For a general overview document—for teaching and learning general concepts of a system—a book might be the suitable medium. But for answers to specific technical questions, something else is needed. We cannot trust the user to find his way about in the maze of documentation which must of necessity exist for a complex system, so we must provide a system that guides him in an active manner. What could be better at this kind of active guidance than a computer, viewed through the window of a suitable terminal?

好吧，当然，这一切都是有代价的。谁来支付？从心理上讲，文档成本问题总是打击很大，因为我们总是措手不及。为什么？因为我们还没有习惯于将文档成本视为编程成本的一部分。那么，归根结底，当你谈论经理们谈论的东西——金钱——时，你会发现他们也将文档视为编程的一个独立的或可分离的部分。拥有好的文档是一件很棒的事情，但如果必须付费就不是了。

Well, of course, there is the cost of it all. Who shall pay? Psychologically, the question of cost of documentation always strikes a hard blow, for we are always unprepared. Why? Because we have not accustomed ourselves to thinking of the cost of documentation as a part of the programming cost. At bottom, then, when you talk in terms of what managers talk in terms of—money—you find that they, too, think of documentation as a separate, or separable, part of programming. It's a wonderful thing to have good documentation, but not if it has to be paid for.

有时，会提出某种形式的程序“自动记录”的方案——这些方案被认为是无痛的或无成本的或两者兼而有之。这种类型的一个例子是现存的许多流程图程序。如果您将您的程序作为输入提供给这些程序之一，它会吐出一个流程图作为输出。当然，这个过程是——或者可以是——无痛的，而且，事实上，结果并不是很昂贵。但它是文档吗？可能不是。它可能是——这没什么好小瞧的——是调试工具库的又一武器。

From time to time, schemes are brought forth for some form of "automatic documentation" of programs—schemes which are supposed to be painless or costless or both. One example of this type is the many flow charting programs which exist. If you feed one of these programs your program as input, it spews out a flow diagram as output. Certainly the process is—or can be—painless, and, in fact, turns out not to be very expensive. But is it documentation? Probably not. What it may be—and this is nothing to sneeze at—is one more weapon for the debugging arsenal.

程序员，如果他一直在没有自己的流程图的情况下工作，可能会发现很难理解他的程序正在做什么，特别是当它的局部性不是很好时。正确构建的流程图可以帮助将许多非本地流程点收集到二维形式中，以便可以在一页上看到它们。这种新的程序视图可能对程序员非常有帮助，不仅可以揭示诸如无限循环或未连​​接分支之类的严重错误，还可以显示他的代码是否实现了他的意图。

The programmer, if he has been working without flow diagrams of his own, may find it difficult to follow just what his program is doing, particularly if its locality is not very good. A flow diagram, properly constructed, can help to gather many nonlocal points of flow into a two-dimensional form so that they may be seen on one page. This new view of the program may be extremely helpful to the programmer, not only revealing such solid errors as endless loops or unconnected branches, but showing whether or not his code has realized his intentions.

如果程序员一直在用流程图工作，可以用机器绘制的图表进行比较，这肯定会揭示从图表到代码的转录过程中的任何错误。在更线性的语言中，例如 PL/I，流程图的二维优势就失去了优势。当一个没有任何标签的 PL/I 程序被放入其中一个流程图程序中时，出来的是原始程序，按照原始顺序，在不同的代码片段周围绘制了漂亮的小方框。流程图绘制者不能做的是在框内添加任何新内容，尽管看到代码周围有框可能会帮助程序员看到他没有注意到的某些事情。

If the programmer has been working with a flow diagram all along, the machine-drawn chart can be used for comparison, which will certainly reveal any errors in transcription from the diagram to the code. In more linear languages, such as PL/I, the two-dimensional advantages of the flow diagram lose their strength. When a PL/I program without any labels was put into one of these flow charting programs, what came out was the original program, in the original order, with nice little boxes drawn around different pieces of code. What the flow diagrammers cannot do is add anything new inside the boxes, although seeing the code with boxes around it may help the programmer see certain things he had failed to notice.

然而，如果除了最初的程序员之外，其他人都不清楚方框的内容，那么从它们自动绘制的流程图——用任何语言——对需要文档的人来说都没有多大帮助。如果评论具有误导性，它们仍然会产生误导——除非它们误导了分支的目的地。如果符号选择不当，它们将在流程图上保持相同的符号。我们进行了一些试点研究来测试这种自动绘制的流程图的文档价值，但我们没有发现原始编码加流程图比原始编码本身更容易理解的证据——除了原始编码员。或许一些销售此类流程图程序的公司会赞助对这个问题进行更仔细的控制研究。

However, if the contents of the boxes are obscure to all but the original programmer, the flow diagram drawn automatically from them—in any language—is not going to be much help to the person who needs documentation. If the comments were misleading, they will still be misleading —unless they mislead about the destination of a branch. If symbols were poorly chosen, they will remain the same symbols on the flow diagram. We have made a few pilot studies to test the documentation value of such automatically drawn flow diagrams, and we find no evidence that the original coding plus flow diagram is any easier to understand than the original coding itself—except by the original coder. Perhaps some of the companies that sell such flow charting programs would sponsor more carefully controlled studies into this problem.

当然，流程图只是表示实际代码中信息的一种替代方式。即使事实证明它的总价值很小，但有几个理由不放弃它作为一种文档技术。首先，由于它是由计算机执行的自动程序，我们可以预期，随着计算机功能的增强，这样做的成本会降低，而不是增加。其次，它具有直接从代码本身提取的绝对突出优势，因此维护文档与维护代码完全相同。因此，不存在滑动的可能性——所有文档系统的死机。

A flow diagram, of course, is but one alternative way of representing the information that is in the actual code. Even if its total value turns out to be quite small, there are several reasons not to give up on it as a documentation technique. First of all, since it is an automatic procedure carried out by computer, we can expect that the cost of doing it will decrease, rather than increase, as computers get more powerful. Secondly, it has the absolutely outstanding advantage of being drawn directly from the code itself, so that maintaining the documentation is precisely the same act as maintaining the code. Therefore, there is no possibility of slippage—the death rattle of all documentations systems.

Klerer 和 May 关于他们的系统表达了文档应该源自代码本身这一观点的一个极端例子。他们的系统的书面文档不仅可以放在一张纸的两面，而且他们明确表示，他们不希望程序员从文档中学习如何使用他们的系统，而是从系统的实验中学习本身。Klerer 和 May 没有用成千上万的单词来解释一个晦涩难懂的点，而这些词汇是十分之九的程序员永远不会使用的，而是将清除晦涩难懂的工作留给了机器本身。毕竟，这只是回到我们多年来一直采用的正常做法。该机器现在是，而且永远是文档纠纷的最后审判庭。

One extreme example of the view that the documentation should spring from the code itself is expressed by Klerer and May about their system. Not only can the written documentation for their system be placed on two sides of a sheet of paper, but they expressly state that they do not expect the programmer to learn how to use their system from the documentation but, rather, from experiments with the system itself. Instead of loading up the documentation with thousands of words to explain an obscure point that nine-tenths of the programmers will never use, Klerer and May leave the work of clearing up obscurities to the machine itself. This is, after all, only a return to the normal practice which we have been using for years. The machine is, and always will be, the court of last resort on documentation disputes.

然而，在过去，机器一直是一个相当沉默寡言的记录员。为了更多地依赖机器本身，我们必须使用更多的想象力让机器以尽可能多的替代方式讲述它的故事。每种特定的方式，例如流程图，可能只会使程序的清晰度增加一小部分，但是观点上的许多小变化加起来可能比其部分的总和大得多。如果正如我们所相信的那样，程序调试和程序理解的主要障碍是心理定势，那么任何让头脑摆脱困境的技术都应该作为调试和文档的可能工具进行探索。

In the past, however, the machine has been a rather uncommunicative documenter. In order to rely more on the machine itself, we must use more imagination in getting the machine to tell its story in as many alternative ways as possible. Each particular way, such as flow diagramming, may give but a small addition to the clarity of a program, but many small changes in viewpoint may add up to a sum much greater than its parts. If, as we believe, the main impediment to program debugging and program understanding is psychological set, any technique for getting the mind unstuck should be explored as a possible tool of debugging and documentation.

我们一直在对各种不同的查看程序的方法的有用性进行一系列研究。我们试图从任何灵感来源中汲取灵感，提出不同的观点。例如，想一想画家，他发现对物体的熟悉可能会导致他扭曲对物体实际颜色的感知。为了克服他的设置，他弯下腰，通过他的腿颠倒地观看场景。以类似的方式，我们正在试验向后打印程序——按字符或按符号——只是为了看看会发生什么。

We have been conducting a series of studies on the usefulness of various alternative ways of looking at a program. We have tried to draw on any source of inspiration in coming up with alternative views. For instance, think of the painter, who finds that familiarity with objects may cause him to distort his perception of their actual color. To overcome his set, he bends over and views the scene upside down through his legs. In a similar manner, we are experimenting with printing programs backwards—either by character or by symbol—just to see what will happen.

我们正在尝试的其他一些方法更为熟悉，但列出这些方法可能有助于激发读者思考其他方法：

Some of the other methods we are trying are more familiar, but a list of them may help inspire the reader to think of others:

• 以粗体或下划线分隔关键字。

• Set off keywords in boldface or underline.

• 以粗体或下划线分隔非关键字。

• Set off non-keywords in boldface or underline.

• 以小写字母分隔关键字或非关键字。

• Set off keywords or non-keywords in lower case.

• 更改多用途符号，例如不明确的等号和不同嵌套级别的括号。

• Change multi-use symbols, such as the ambiguous equals sign, and parentheses at different levels of nesting.

• 标记潜在的问题点——例如在可能需要参考的地方创建的假人或在可能需要假人的地方使用的参考。

• Mark potential trouble spots—such as dummies created where references might be desired or references used where dummies might be wanted.

• 从列表中删除评论，在一页上显示“裸”列表，在另一页上显示评论。

• Strip comments from a listing and present the "naked" listing on one page and the comments on another.

• 以类似的方式剥离文字。

• Strip literals in a similar way.

• 重命名所有变量。

• Rename all variables.

• 展开所有缩写，或缩写所有扩展。

• Expand all abbreviations, or abbreviate all expansions.

• 将选项置换为标准顺序，或简单地置换为与程序员使用的顺序不同的顺序。

• Permute options to a standard order, or simply to a different order than the programmer used.

• 按字母顺序列出符号，以及作为引用使用、设置或传递的位置的引用。

• List symbols in alphabetical order, together with references to where used, set, or passed as references.

• 根据特定属性分组列出符号，例如所有EXTERNAL 变量或所有FLOAT 变量一起，根据多个属性多次列出。

• List symbols in groups according to specific attributes, such as all EXTERNAL variables or all FLOAT variables together, with multiple listing according to multiple attributes.

• 列出符号的范围。

• List the scope of symbols.

• 列出潜在的歧义。

• List potential ambiguities.

• 在 DO、BEGINS 和 PROCEDURES 的连续嵌套级别上分别提取和打印组。

• Extract and print separately groups at successive levels of nesting of DOs, BEGINS, and PROCEDURES.

• 将条件语句分解为某种规范形式，可能包括决策表。

• Decompose conditional statements into some canonical form, perhaps including decision tables.

• 去除表达式并列出它们及其在包含变量的几组值下计算出的值。

• Strip out expressions and list them with their values calculated under several sets of values of their contained variables.

• 执行样本流路。

• Execute sample flow paths.

这些观点都不是为了改变程序的物理意义，而是为了改变它的心理意义。我们希望做的是向程序员的眼睛（也许还有其他感官）和头脑展示丰富的观点，他可以在这些观点上应用他的天赋作为一个自适应系统。换句话说，我们并不是要让机器解决调试问题和文档问题。我们正在努力让机器帮助人们利用他们拥有的巨大心理资源来克服他们巨大的心理缺陷。

None of these viewpoints are intended to change the physical meaning of a program, but all are intended to change its psychological meaning. What we are hoping to do is present the programmer's eyes (and perhaps other sense organs) and mind with a richness of views on which he can apply his native talents as an adaptive system. In other words, we are not trying to make the machine solve the debugging problem and the documentation problem. We are trying to make the machine help people take advantage of the immense psychological resources they have in overcoming their immense psychological shortcomings.

当然，如果这些程序确实解决或部分解决了文档问题，那就太好了。在这个方向上的另一个有价值的努力需要程序员做更多的工作，但也很有用。在这个系统中，当程序员完成程序后，他坐在终端前，计算机会询问每个程序和数据元素在编码中的功能。他所做的回复被存储起来，并可能发送给任何请求该程序副本的人。反过来，用户可以转到终端并询问有关他们感兴趣的程序和数据元素的问题——计算机将对大量文档材料进行分类的工作从他们身上拿走。他们不可能去错误的地方获取信息，

It would be nice, of course, if these programs did solve, or partially solve, the documentation problem. Another worthy effort in this direction involves a bit more work by the programmer, but also promises to be useful. In this system, when the programmer has finished the program, he sits down at a terminal and is interrogated by the computer about the function of each of the various program and data elements in the coding. The replies he makes are stored away and presumably shipped to anybody who requests a copy of the program. The users, in turn, can go to a terminal and ask questions about the program and data elements that interest them—the computer keeping from them the job of sorting through the mass of documentation material. There is no chance of their going to the wrong place for the information, for they always go to the same place—the terminal.

这种系统似乎确实解决了用户不理解文档结构的问题，但它仍然留下了最初输入文档数据的问题。与计算机的交流肯定会成为一些程序员的激励因素；但即使是最积极的程序员，如果他不会写一个英文句子，也不会被这个系统转化为一个能干的沟通者。一种可能的修改是将计算机仅用作程序员与许多“典型”用户之间对话的裁判。用户会通过他们的终端提问，而程序员会尝试通过他的终端来回答他们。计算机甚至可以通过提示用户提出某些问题来帮助用户，但不会记录程序员的“ 的答案，直到他们被用户接受为他们提供了他们想要的信息。然后可以对整组答案进行分类并与程序一起发送，供其他用户查询。

This type of system really seems to get at the problem of the user who does not understand the structure of the documentation, but it still leaves the problem of entering the documentation data originally. The intercourse with the computer will certainly be a motivating factor for some programmers; but even the most motivated programmer, if he cannot write an English sentence, will not be transformed into an able communicator by this system. One possible modification would be to use the computer merely as a referee in a dialogue between the programmer and a number of "typical" users. The users would ask questions through their terminals, and the programmer would attempt to answer them through his. The computer might even help the users by prompting them to ask certain questions, but would not record the programmer's answers until they had been accepted by the users as giving them the information they desire. The entire set of answers could then be classified and shipped with the program for other users to interrogate.

当然，更好的是，虽然在未来概念上更进一步，但将是对此类问题的单一中央答案库。系统的任何用户或潜在用户都可以询问中央池。如果他在电脑的指引下获得了他需要的信息，那就是——虽然可以对频繁的请求进行统计，以便将来更直接地回答。然而，当用户无法从池中已有的答案中满足他的信息需求时，计算机将向编程设施中的某个人发出请求以与用户连线。在接下来的对话中，这个问题最终会得到解答，但最坏的情况下可能需要几天时间。然而，一旦得到答案，

Even better, of course, though conceptually further in the future, would be a single central pool of answers to such questions. Any user, or potential user, of the system could interrogate the central pool. If he obtained the information he needed under the computer's guidance, that would be that—although statistics could be kept on frequent requests so that they might be answered more directly in the future. When, however, the user could not satisfy his information needs from the answers already in the pool, the, computer would issue a request to someone at the programming, facility to get on the line with the user. In the ensuing dialogue, the question would eventually be answered, but it might take a few days in the worst cases. Once the answer had been obtained, however, it would be added to the records and thus made available for future users.

这样一个系统所做的——随着引入的变化进行适当的更新——是让我们更接近文档是程序员自己的时代。在一家小商店里，在一个小程序上，很少有人注意明确的文档，因为去原创者那里获得答案总是更容易。毕竟，你可能不得不问他才能找到文档。事实上，在如今这样的情况下，这恐怕是最好的办法了。任何程序员对他的程序的了解都远远多于他永远无法将其放入其文档中，或者即使将其放入文档中也无法根据需要找到的任何人。这种方法的主要问题是当程序员离开时商店，但如果实行无私的编程——如果管理不至于糟糕到所有程序员立即离开——这个问题就会最小化。

What such a system does—with suitable provision for updating as changes are introduced—is to take us back closer to the time when the documentation was the programmer himself. In a small shop, on a small program, little attention was paid to explicit documentation, for it was always easier to go to the originator to get the answer. After all, you probably had to ask him in order to find the documentation. In fact, in such a situation today, this is probably the best method. Any programmer knows a lot more about his program than he will ever be able to put in his documentation, or than anyone would be able to find as needed even if it had been put in. The major problem with this method is when a programmer leaves the shop, but if egoless programming is practiced—and if the management is not so bad that all the programmers leave at once—this problem is minimized.

当然，这种个性化方法也有局限性。一个特别奇怪的情况发生在 1961 年，涉及我 1956 年在旧金山工作时编写的网络分析程序。在那些年里，这个程序被非正式地分发并被广泛使用，但与此同时，我却四处游荡，最后在纽约暂时歇了下来。然后，有一天，我接到了斯德哥尔摩打来的长途电话。电话的另一端是一个绝望的程序员，他已经跟踪了我三天。他解释说，他正在尝试修改程序以处理某种情况，但该情况不在问题的最初构想中，然后问道：“如果我将位置 1003 的符号更改为减号，是否可以解决问题？”

There are, of course, limits to this personalized method. One particularly strange situation occurred in 1961 concerning a network analysis program I had written in 1956 while working in San Francisco. The program had been distributed informally and used widely during those years, but I had in the meantime wandered from place to place, finally resting for the moment in New York. Then, one day, I received a long-distance call from Stockholm. At the other end of the line was a desperate programmer who had been tracking me down for three days. He explained he was trying to modify the program to handle a certain case which was not in the original conception of the problem, and then asked, "If I change the sign of location 1003 to minus, will that do the job?"

五年多来，横跨整个大陆，我几乎不记得写过这个程序，更不用说对 1003 号位置的记忆了。快速计算跨大西洋电话的费用并将其与计算机时间的费用进行比较，我告诉来电者，“是的，应该可以了。你为什么不把它放在机器上试试呢？如果不行，给我回电话。” 幸运的是，我再也没有听到这个瑞典人的消息。

Over five years, and across the continent, I had hardly retained the memory of having written the program, let alone a memory of what was in location 1003. Quickly calculating the cost of a transatlantic telephone call and comparing it with the cost of computer time, I told the caller, "Yes, that should do it. Why don't you put it on the machine and try it out. If it doesn't work, call me back." Fortunately, I never heard from this Swede again.

即使程序员保持不动，他们的记忆也会消失。很少有程序员能回忆起他们五年前编写的任何程序的任何位置（符号的或绝对的）的内容，此后就再也没有看过。但是，在如此长的时间跨度内，很少有单人类型的程序可以继续使用。它达到了一个点，即使有最好的文档，也值得放弃一个程序并重新开始。

Even when programmers remain fixed, their memories fade. Very few programmers can recall what was in any location—symbolic or absolute —of any program they wrote five years ago and have not looked at since. But then, very few programs of one-man type can be expected to remain in use over such a long time span. It reaches a point, even with the best documentation, that it pays to throw a program away and start over.

那么，在决定如何为程序编写文档时，我们必须考虑的是谁将使用它、如何使用它、用户在哪里以及它将使用多长时间。如果它只在本地使用，用于它设计用于处理的工作类型，由了解程序员的人使用，并且使用一两年或三年，那么也许可以把本可以花在详细文档上的钱花在更好地用于其他项目。如果远程位置的许多人要使用它，则必须从一开始就考虑到详细文档的成本，并且程序员必须从一开始就参与使文档成为可能。

What we must consider, then, when deciding how to document a program, is who will use it, how it will be used, where the users will be, and for how long it will stay in use. If it will only be used locally, for the type of work it was designed to handle, by people who know the programmers, and for a year or two or three, then perhaps the money that might have been spent on elaborate documentation could be put to better use on some other project. If many people in remote locations are going to use it, the cost of elaborate documentation must be reckoned with from the first, and the programmer will have to be involved from the beginning in making documentation a possibility.

请注意，我们没有说“制作文档”，而是“使文档成为可能”。当一个程序将被用作可销售的商品时——不管它是否真的被出售——用户有权期望文档像编程一样专业地完成。而且，冷静地考虑这件事，没有理由相信一个专业的程序员将有资格成为一个专业的文档编写者。因此，如果要做专业的文档，应该在程序员的协助下完成，而不是由程序员来完成。如果文档本身提升到专业地位，那么文档编写者就可以与程序员并肩工作而不自卑，我们有权利希望文档能够改进。

Notice that we did not say "in making documentation" but, rather, "in making documentation a possibility." When a program is going to be used as a marketable commodity—whether or not it is actually sold—the users have a right to expect the documentation be done as professionally as the programming. And, considering the matter coolly,there is no reason to believe a professional programmer will be qualified as a professional documenter. Thus, if professional documentation is to be done, it should be done with the assistance of the programmer, but not by the programmer. If documentation is elevated to a professional status all its own, so the documenter can work side by side with the programmer without being made to feel inferior, we have the right to hope documentation will improve.

我们在编程中经历了一个奇怪的循环，从创建编程本身作为人类活动开始。对知识一知半解的高管们认为任何人都可以编写程序，而直到现在，程序员才开始赢得他们作为真正专业人士的认可的战斗。不是任何人，无论有任何背景，或接受过任何培训，都可以出色地完成编程工作。程序员知道这一点，但为什么他们认为从街上捡到的任何人都可以做文档呢？人们只需花一个小时看研究生写的论文，就会意识到沟通能力并非普遍具备的程度。因此，当我们谈论计算机程序文档时，

We have come through a strange cycle in programming, starting with the creation of programming itself as a human activity. Executives with the tiniest smattering of knowledge assume anyone can write a program, and only now are programmers beginning to win their battle for recognition as true professionals. Not just anyone, with any background, or any training, can do a fine job of programming. Programmers know this, but then why is it they think anyone picked off the street can do documentation? One has only to spend an hour looking at papers written by graduate students to realize the extent to which the ability to communicate is not universally held. And so, when we speak about computer program documentation, we are not speaking about the psychology of computer programming at all—except insofar as programmers have the illusion that anyone can do a good job of documentation, provided he is not smart enough to be a programmer.

概括

SUMMARY

本章的主要教训很简单：系统是复杂的。一个计算机系统不只是硬件，不只是软件，更不只是人加硬件加软件。与系统一起发展的正式和非正式程序是系统的一部分；各种组件的当前负载也是如此，用户的态度和体验也是如此。即使在普遍接受的系统“部分”之间，也不存在明确的分隔线。硬件与操作系统融为一体，操作系统与编程语言融为一体，编程语言与调试工具融为一体，调试工具与文档融为一体，文档与培训融为一体，这一切都与系统所处的社会氛围融为一体。

The main lesson of this chapter is simple: Systems are complex. A computer system is not just hardware, not just software, not even just people plus hardware plus software. The procedures, formal and informal, that have evolved with the system are part of the system; so is the current load on various components, and so is the attitude and experience of the users. Even among the commonly accepted "parts" of a system, clear lines of separation do not exist. Hardware merges with operating system, operating system merges with programming language, programming language merges with debugging tools, debugging tools merge with documentation, and documentation merges with training, and all of them mingle with the social climate in which the system is used.

这种复杂性一方面意味着实验证据是双重必要的，但另一方面也意味着它更加难以获得和解释。是时候把这些神话从我们的壁橱里扫除，并尽可能用确凿的实验证据取而代之。并不是说这些问题中的任何一个都会被“解决”——复杂性太大了。但是有什么有价值的问题被解决了呢？无论如何，我们需要的与其说是解决方案，不如说是尝试获得这些解决方案的经验。

This complexity means, on the one hand, that experimental evidence is doubly essential, but, on the other hand, that it is doubly difficult to obtain and interpret. The time has come to sweep the myths out of our closet and replace them, if possible, with hard experimental evidence. Not that any of these problems will ever be "solved"—the complexity is too great for that. But what worthwhile problems are ever solved? It's not so much the solutions we need, anyway, but the experience in trying to get them.

问题

QUESTIONS

对于经理

For Managers

 

1. 你有没有得到过“调试编译器”或其他调试帮助？你是如何决定是否购买它的？

1. Have you ever been offered a "debugging compiler" or other debugging aid? How did you decide whether or not to purchase it?

2. 你是否要求你的程序员估计他们对“已调试”程序的信心水平？您是否尝试自己估计置信度？你在做出这个判断时使用了哪些因素？

2. Do you ask your programmers to estimate their level of confidence in their "debugged" programs? Do you try to make your own estimate of confidence? What factors do you use in making this judgment?

3. 描述您的商店中使用的程序性能评估系统。作为经理，您如何使用它们？您希望他们提供哪些额外信息？他们现在提供哪些对您无用的信息？

3. Describe the systems of program performance evaluation in use in your shop. How do you use them in being a manager? What additional information would you like to have them supply? What information do they now supply that is useless to you?

4. 你认为在你的批处理系统中什么是理想的周转时间？您认为在您的在线系统中访问终端的理想方式是什么？您的程序员如何看待这些问题？

4. What do you consider to be ideal turnaround in your batch system? What do you consider to be ideal access to terminals in your on-line system? What do your programmers think about these issues?

5. 你是否给予某些程序员优先使用批处理系统？联机系统？你有没有观察到你的偏爱的不利影响？你认为你在未来可以做些什么来确定优先次序而不会产生不好的感觉？有可能造成的不良情绪造成的伤害大于优先事项应该带来的好处吗？

5. Do you give certain programmers priority in using the batch system? The on-line system? Have you ever observed adverse effects of your favoritism? What do you think you could do in the future to give priorities without creating bad feeling? It is possible the bad feelings created do more harm than the priorities are supposed to do good?

6. 在线编程和批量编程哪个更好？

6. Which is better for programming, on-line or batch?

7、你们店里的记录员是怎么选择的？您的文档规则是否足够灵活以允许针对不同类型的程序使用不同类型的文档？对文档工作有怨恨吗？如果是这样，您认为来源是什么，对此可以做些什么？

7. How are the documenters chosen in your shop? Are your documentation rules sufficiently flexible to permit different kinds of documentation for different types of programs? Is there resentment against documentation work? If so, what do you think is the source, and what can be done about it?

对于程序员

For Programmers

 

1. 从你的经历中回想一个最终代价巨大的“微小”错误。哪些调试工具或技术可以防止该错误？他们的代价是否会大于那个错误的代价？

1. Recall from your experience a "tiny" error that had a huge ultimate cost. What debugging tools or techniques could have prevented that error? Would their cost have been greater than the cost of that one error?

2. 举例说明你在程序测试中何时因“早期回报”而产生偏见，无论好坏。举例说明影响你的调试策略的其他因素，例如取悦你的经理的愿望、程序结构的知识，或者与其他程序或程序员的交互。

2. Give examples of when you have been biased in your program testing by "early returns," both good and bad. Give examples of other factors that have biased your debugging strategy, such as desire to please your manager, knowledge of program structure, or interaction with other programs or programmers.

3. 你认为在你的批处理系统中什么是理想的周转时间？您认为在您的在线系统中访问终端的理想方式是什么？您的经理如何看待这些问题？

3. What do you consider to be ideal turnaround in your batch system? What do you consider to be ideal access to terminals in your on-line system? What does your manager think about these issues?

4. 以自己为主体，举一个行为适应系统特征的例子。

4. Give an example of behavioral adaptation to system features, using yourself as the subject.

5. 在线编程和批量编程哪个更好？

5. Which is better for programming, on-line or batch?

6. 您还希望您的操作系统和编译器提供其他哪些程序视图？解释这些观点如何帮助你，并为每个观点提供具体的例子。

6. What other views of a program would you like supplied by your operating system and compiler? Explain how these views could help you, giving specific examples for each.

7. 您如何看待文档工作？您如何看待做好文档工作的人？必须改变什么才能使您做好文档工作？

7. What do you think of documentation work? What do you think of people who do a good job of documentation? What would have to be changed to make you do a good job of documentation?

参考书目

BIBLIOGRAPHY

Rosenthal, Robert，论心理实验的社会心理学，美国科学家，1963 年 6 月。

Rosenthal, Robert, On the Social Psychology of the Psychological Experiment, American Scientist, June 1963.

罗森塔尔率先研究了潜入实验的观察偏差，尤其是由于实验者的期望。与调试的相似之处很明显，因此程序员应该能够将本文中的结果直接转化为他们自己的工作实践。

Rosenthal has pioneered In studying the observational biases that creep into experimentation, especially because of expectations on the part of the experimenter. The parallels with debugging are obvious, so that programmers should be able to translate the results in this article directly into their own work practices.

Parzen, Emanuel，现代概率论及其应用，纽约，Wiley，1960 年。

Parzen, Emanuel, Modern Probability Theory and Its Applications, New York, Wiley, 1960.

关于先验概率对特定测试结果置信度的影响，请参见第 119-120 页。一般而言，程序员会受益于将调试视为一个概率过程，而 Parzen 的书将是一个很好的起点。

On the matter of the influence of a priori probability on the confidence in the results of a particular test, see, for example, pp. 119-120. In general, programmers would benefit from thinking of debugging as a probabilistic process, and Parzen's book would be a good starting place.

Weinberg, GM, PL/I Programming—A Manual of Style，纽约，McGraw-Hill，1970 年。

Weinberg, G. M., PL/I Programming—A Manual of Style, New York, McGraw-Hill, 1970.

有关在程序测试中使用正确的语言和正确的程序结构的优势的讨论，请参见第 4 章。

For a discussion of the advantages of proper language and proper program structure in program testing, see Chapter 4.

Berkeley, Edmund C.，交互式编程计算机的个性、计算机和自动化，1965 年 12 月，第 42-46 页。

Berkeley, Edmund C., The Personality of the Interactive Programmed Computer, Computers and Automation, Dec. 1965, pp. 42-46.

这篇文章有点肤浅，但提出了一个有趣的问题，即系统呈现给用户的“个性”。正如 Sackman 所表明的，用户对系统的态度会影响他在使用该系统时的表现，而且用户对系统的尊重会随着熟悉程度的提高而增长。毫无疑问，系统的个性在这种接受中起着一定的作用，并且可以测试用户对不同系统的个性的感知，以便尝试确定程序员喜欢与哪些个性一起工作。

This article is a bit superficial, but raises the interesting question of the "personality" which a system presents to the user. As Sackman has shown, the attitude a user has towards a system influences his performance in using that system, and also that the user's respect for the system grows with increased familiarity. No doubt the personality of the system plays a part in this acceptance, and users could be tested for their perception of the personality of different systems, in order to try to determine which personalities programmers like to work with.

Sackman, Harold，人机问题解决：分时和批处理的实验评估，新泽西州普林斯顿，奥尔巴赫出版社，1970 年。

Sackman, Harold, Man-Computer Problem Solving: Experimental Evaluation of Time-Sharing and Batch Processing, Princeton, N.J., Auerbach Publishers, 1970.

正如副标题所暗示的那样，正如我们之前指出的那样，这本书总结了该领域迄今为止的工作，对于任何要比较操作系统的人来说都是必不可少的先决条件阅读。

As the subtitle suggests, and as we have previously indicated, this book summarizes the work to date in this field, and is essential prerequisite reading for anyone about to compare operating systems.

Stange, GH，安装两个远程计算机访问系统的初始影响。未发表的课堂报告。

Stange, G. H., The Initial Effects of the Installation of Two Remote Computer Access Systems. Unpublished class report.

Salsbury, RG，理想的转机——意见调查。未发表的课堂报告。

Salsbury, R. G., Ideal Turnaround—An Opinion Survey. Unpublished class report.

Heiss、William J. 和 Frederick Schwartz，位置与关键字编码。

Heiss, William J., and Frederick Schwartz, Positional versus Keyword Coding.

这些未发表的课堂报告为所有相关人员提供了学习经验，并证明无需深入研究即可完成该领域的有用工作。

These unpublished class reports provided learning experiences for all involved, and demonstrate that useful work in this field can be done without going off the deep end.

Rosin, Robert F.，监督和监控系统，计算调查，1，第 1 期（1969 年 3 月）。

Rosin, Robert F., Supervisory and Monitor Systems, Computing Surveys, 1, No. 1 (March 1969).

在十几页的篇幅中，Rosin 设法阐明了操作系统中的一般轮廓和重要问题。从历史的角度来看，他能够展示每一代操作系统的设计或多或少是为了修补上一代遗留的问题。人们开始猜测未来的操作系统在开始修补当前系统留下的心理漏洞时会是什么样子。

In little more than a dozen pages, Rosin manages to make clear the general outlines and important issues in operating systems. By taking an historical view, he is able to show how each successive generation of operating system design was more or less intended to patch up the problems left over from the previous generation. One is led to speculate on the way operating systems of the future will look as they begin to patch up the psychological holes left by present systems.

London, Ralph L., Bibliography on Proving the Correctness of Computer Programs, Machine Intelligence , 5, New York, 美国爱思唯尔, 1970.

London, Ralph L., Bibliography on Proving the Correctness of Computer Programs, Machine Intelligence, 5, New York, American Elsevier, 1970.

所有调试人员的梦想是有一天能够让机器证明程序是否正确。关于这个问题正在做大量的工作，尽管它在一般情况下肯定是无法解决的。迄今为止所做的工作都没有真正应用于调试，但阅读其中一些论文肯定会对调试器产生影响。还没有或还不能写出明确的工作总结，所以这份参考书目就足够了。

The dream of all debuggers is to someday be able to have the machine prove whether or not a program is correct. A great deal of work is being done on this problem, although it is certainly unsolvable in general. None of the work done to date has any real practical application to debugging, but reading some of these papers will definitely have an effect on the debugger. No definitive summary of work has been written, or can yet be written, so this bibliography will have to suffice.

Weinberg, G. M„ 和 GL Gresset，程序自动验证实验，ACM 通信，6, 10（1963 年 10 月），第 610-613 页

Weinberg, G. M„ and G. L. Gresset, An Experiment in Automatic Verification of Programs, Communications of the ACM, 6, 10 (October 1963), pp. 610-613

在这项早期研究中，作者试图展示编译器的错误检测特性如何取决于使用它们的错误环境。我们提出了许多改进实际环境中错误检测性能的建议。这些建议中几乎没有在任何主要编译器中执行过。

In this early study, we authors tried to show how error detection properties of a compiler depend upon the error environment in which they are used. We made a number of suggestions for improvement of error-detection performance in an actual environment. Few of these suggestions have yet been carried out in any major compiler.

Irons, ET，纠错解析算法，ACM 通信，6, 11（1963 年 11 月），第 669-673 页。

Irons, E. T., An Error Correcting Parse Algorithm, Communications of the ACM, 6, 11 (November 1963), pp. 669-673.

LaFrance, Jacques，语法导向解析算法中错误恢复的优化，ACM SIGPLAN 通知，5，第 12 期（1970 年 12 月），第 2-17 页。

LaFrance, Jacques, Optimization of Error Recovery in Syntax-Directed Parsing Algorithms, ACM SIGPLAN Notices, 5, No. 12 (December 1970), pp. 2-17.

关于编译器自动更正语法错误的主题，Irons 的论文代表了最早的论文，而 LaFrance 的论文是最新的论文之一。任何“校正”方案的基础都必须是“接近度”的概念，它规定如果检测到错误就尝试构造。该领域的工作人员希望有一个独立于用户心理的“亲近度”概念，但这似乎是一种奢望，至少在一开始，通过分类将取得重大进展。最常犯的错误来自使用该语言和系统的工作程序员的实际研究，然后提供特殊的例程来解读这些错误。例如，在康奈尔大学开发的 PL/C 编译器中，纠正和成功编译 PL/I 程序的一个主要步骤是简单地通过限制用户使用不从一张卡运行到下一张卡的注释和字符串来完成。这限制了错误传播的范围，并大大增加了正确更正或至少进行更有意义的编译的机会，以便可以在更多运行中更正所有内容。只有在这些特别的方法消除了错误的主要心理原因之后，我们才能被迫求助于这些论文中建议的更优雅的方法。这限制了错误传播的范围，并大大增加了正确更正或至少进行更有意义的编译的机会，以便可以在更多运行中更正所有内容。只有在这些特别的方法消除了错误的主要心理原因之后，我们才能被迫求助于这些论文中建议的更优雅的方法。这限制了错误传播的范围，并大大增加了正确更正或至少进行更有意义的编译的机会，以便可以在更多运行中更正所有内容。只有在这些特别的方法消除了错误的主要心理原因之后，我们才能被迫求助于这些论文中建议的更优雅的方法。

Irons' paper represents the earliest, and LaFrance's one of the most recent, on the subject of automatic correction of syntax errors by compilers. Underlying any "correction" scheme must be a concept of "closeness" which dictates that construction is to be tried if an error is detected. Workers In this field would like to have a concept of "closeness" which is independent of the psychology of the user, but this seems to be a vain hope, At the very beginning, at least, the major progress will be made by classifying the most frequently made errors taken from actual studies of working programmers using that language and system and then providing special routines to unscramble these errors. For instance, in the PL/C compiler developed at Cornell University, a major step in correcting and successfully compiling PL/I programs is made simply by limiting the user to comments and strings that do not run from one card to the next. This limits the scope of propagation of an error and greatly increases the chances of a proper correction or at least a more meaningful compilation so that everything can be corrected in one more run. Only after the major psychological causes of error have been eliminated by these ad hoc methods should we be forced to resort to more elegant methods as suggested in these papers.

Teltelman, W„ PILOT: A Step Towards Man-Computer Symbiosis（博士论文，麻省理工学院），剑桥，马萨诸塞州，1966 年 6 月。

Teltelman, W„ PILOT: A Step Toward Man-Computer Symbiosis (Doctoral Dissertation, M.I.T.), Cambridge, Mass., June 1966.

PILOT 系统是一个用 LISP 编写的工具，用于帮助 LISP 程序员完成修改程序的工作。它包含许多有趣的特性，但不清楚这个系统对习惯使用它的程序员有多大帮助——或者与简单的错误检测相比有多大用处。沿着这条线的研究将是有用的。

The PILOT system is a tool written In LISP for assisting LISP programmers with the job of modifying programs. It contains many interesting features, but it is not clear just how helpful this system is to programmers who habitually use it—or how useful it is compared with simple error detection. Studies along this line would be useful.

Stockham, Thomas G., Jr.，一些图形调试方法，IBM 人机通信科学计算研讨会论文集，1966 年。

Stockham, Thomas G., Jr., Some Methods of Graphical Debugging, Proceedings of the IBM Scientific Computing Symposium on Man-Machine Communication, 1966.

Stockham 回顾了使用 CRT 设备进行动态调试的情况，至少将其历史追溯到 1958 年。他哀叹这些早期实验没有演变成普遍做法，他将失败归因于“各种技术和经济原因”。但可能是因为缺乏关于这些系统价值的任何真实行为数据，所以没有动力去克服技术和经济原因。当然，糟糕的调试成本具有足够的经济潜力，足以证明大的技术推动是合理的，如果我们能够证明回报的话。

Stockham reviews the use of CRT devices for dynamic debugging, tracing its history back to 1958, at least. He bemoans the fact that these early experiments did not evolve into common practice, a failure which he attributes to a "variety of technical and economic reasons." But it could be that lacking any real behavioral data on the value of these systems, there was no motivation to overcome the technical and economic reasons. Certainly there is sufficient economic potential in the cost of poor debugging to justify a big technical push, if we can but demonstrate the rewards.

Mills, Harlan D„ PL360 语法指导文档，ACM 通信，13, 4（1970 年 4 月）。

Mills, Harlan D„ Syntax-Directed Documentation for PL360, Communications of the ACM, 13, 4 (April 1970).

米尔斯提出了一个相当雄心勃勃的方案，即在编写程序时提取文档材料作为与计算机交互过程的一部分，然后通过计算机处理在以后的时间使文档可用。这种方法似乎在两个方面触及了问题的核心——它似乎不需要高度积极的人来制作文档，它似乎也不需要人们必须独自阅读大量印刷文档。不过，从某种意义上说，这是典型的计算机用户解决问题的方法——“让我们看看能否让机器来做吧。” 这是一个值得测试的想法，首先看看它是否真的产生了可以使用的文档，然后看看那是不是我们真正想要的。

Mills presents a rather ambitious scheme for extracting the material for documentation as a part of the interaction process with the computer when the program is being written, then making the documentation available through computer processing at a later time. This approach seems to get to the heart of the matter in two ways—it does not seem to require highly motivated people to produce the documentation, nor does it seem to require masses of printed documentation through which one must wade unassisted. In one sense, though, it is the typical computer user's approach to the problem—"let's see if we can make the machine do it." This is an idea that deserves testing, first to see if it really produces documentation that can be used, and then to see if that is what we really want.

Klerer, M. 和 J. May，参考手册，修订版，Dobbs Ferry，纽约，哥伦比亚大学哈德逊实验室，1965 年 7 月。

Klerer, M., and J. May, Reference Manual, Revised ed., Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., Columbia University Hudson Labs., July 1965.

这是用户开始探索 Klerer-May 系统的两页文档。整个文档连同一页附录，在 Sammet 的“编程语言”中重印（参见上一章末尾的参考书目）。

This is the two-page document with which the user starts his exploration of the Klerer-May system. The entire document together with the one-page appendix, is reprinted in Sammet's "Programming Languages" (See Bibliography at the end of the previous chapter).

Leeds、HD 和 GM Weinberg，计算机编程基础/基于 IBM System/360，纽约，McGraw-Hill，1970 年。

Leeds, H. D., and G. M. Weinberg, Computer Programming Fundamentals/Based on the IBM System/360, New York, McGraw-Hill, 1970.

在本书中，您会发现比编程文本中常见的程序文档更广泛的讨论。一章涉及流程图，另一章涉及文章，文档的其他方面在整个过程中都结合相关主题进行了讨论。尽管如此，它远非关于这个主题的完整或最后一句话。

In this book, you will find a more extensive discussion of documentation of programs than is habitual in programming texts. One chapter deals with flow diagramming, another with write-ups, and other aspects of documentation are discussed throughout in connection with related topics. Still, it is far from the complete or last word on the subject.

第 13 章：其他编程工具的评论

Comments on Chapter 13: Other Programming Tools

如果我今天写这本书，我会把关于编程语言的两章减少到两段，我会把工具这一章扩展到五卷甚至十卷。当我在第 4 部分的开头写下我对今天的工具（drool-tools？）流口水的评论时，我不是在写语言，而是在写 25 年前我们下意识地认为是次要的许多工具。

Were I writing this book today, I would reduce the two chapters on programming languages to two paragraphs, and I would expand this tools chapter to five or even ten volumes. When I wrote at the opening of the Part 4 comments that I drooled at the tools of today (drool-tools?), I was not writing of languages, but of the many tools we subconsciously considered as secondary a quarter-century ago.

许多长期存在的偏爱语言而不是其他工具的偏见今天仍然存在，正如我们在考虑测试和测试工具这个主题时最容易看到的那样。最初的部分充满了我们刚刚构建或渴望构建的工具的梦想——代码覆盖分析器、静态和动态结构分析器、测试数据库、规范语言、测试工具和驱动程序——现在它们都可以使用，而且数量众多，和其他人一起，我们当时甚至不敢梦想。然而，这些工具在实际开发工作中的应用却很少——当然是考虑到当我们不使用它们时代码质量差的总体风险。今天剩下的是完全自我编程的问题和专业测试人员的社会地位问题。显然，

Much of the long-standing prejudice favoring languages over other tools remains today, as we can see most easily when we consider the subject of testing and testing tools. The original section was filled with dreams of tools we were just building or yearned to build—code coverage analyzers, static and dynamic structure analyzers, test data bases, specification languages, test harnesses and drivers—and now they are all available, in profusion, along with others we didn't even dare dream about back then. Yet the penetration of these tools into actual development work is quite minor—certainly in the light of the overall risks of poor code quality when we don't use them. What remains today is the problem of ego-full programming and the social-status problem of professional testers. Evidently, the solutions to these problems are not to be found through improved testing tools, but through improved management.

个人电脑的出现模糊了编程语言和操作环境之间的界限。因此，原章这两节中的许多要点现在被视为方便的问题，而不是主要的心理重要性问题。尽管如此，不方便执行的工作更容易被搁置。尽管我们在软件任务集成方面已经取得了长足的进步，但大部分集成仍然是由充当其 PC 操作系统的个人自己完成的——也许使用脚本语言将自己转变为元操作系统设计者。

The emergence of the personal computer blurred the distinction between the programming language and the operating environment. Thus, many of the main points in these two sections of the original chapter are now seen to be matters of convenience, not matters of primary psychological importance. Still, jobs that are inconvenient to perform are more readily left undone. Although we've come a long way toward integration of software tasks, much of the integration is still done by individuals themselves acting as the operating systems of their PCs—perhaps using scripting languages to transform themselves into meta-operating system designers.

尽管我在 1971 年写了这些，但在为软件开发人员提供完全集成的开发/测试/维护环境方面，我们还有很长的路要走。如果这两个版本的观点具有任何指导意义，我们可能甚至看不到存在整合机会的地方。没有办法预见随着集成的进行会出现什么行为，只能预测我们今天认为是基本的编程工作明天将被视为无关紧要的内务处理。为什么要证明这个预测？因为编程的过去总是展示了这种从本质到非本质的转变。

Despite what I wrote in 1971, we still have a long way to go in providing software developers with totally integrated development/testing/maintenance environments. If the perspective of these two editions is any guide, we probably don't even see where opportunities for integration exist. There's no way to foresee what behaviors will emerge as integration proceeds, except to predict that what we think of today as essential programming work will be seen tomorrow as inessential housekeeping. Why justifies this prediction? Because the past of programming has always demonstrated this transformation of essential to inessential.

我们还可以预测，今天的大多数程序员不会喜欢改变他们基础工作的定义——我们知道，因为我们不喜欢它。嘿，双手拿着你的程序台，用两条橡皮筋牢牢固定，真的很令人满意；小心地取下那些橡皮筋；将牌组放入读卡器；按下开始按钮；看着那些卡片堆叠在托盘中；按文件结尾以用完最后一个；删除它们；搅动它们以去除任何乍得；在特殊平台上将它们摆正；更换橡皮筋；并将坚固的甲板带回您的办公桌！那是真正的融合，我们中的一些人怀念控制感。

We can also predict that most of today's programmers won't enjoy changing the definition of their fundamental work—we know, because we didn't enjoy it. Hey, there was something really satisfying about carrying your program deck in both hands, securely fastened with two rubber bands; carefully removing those rubber bands; placing the deck in the card reader; pressing the start button; watching those cards stack up in the tray; pressing end-of-file to run out the last of them; removing them; riffling them to drop out any chad; squaring them up on the special platform; replacing the rubber bands; and carrying that solid deck back to your desk! That was true integration, and some of us miss the feeling of control.

好吧，实际上，我并不太想念卡片（而且我想念的纸带更少！），但我是一个足够的堕落者，渴望一些被迫的延误——延误让我有时间思考我的事情正在做。无论编程的未来如何，我坚信它仍然会奖励思考而不是盲目。这是否标志着我无可救药地过时了？或者我们应该做更多的事情来支持那些想要时间反思的程序员——而更多地支持那些不想思考的人？

Well, actually, I don't miss cards too much (and I miss paper tape even less!), but I'm enough of a reprobate to yearn for some of the forced delays—delays that gave me time to think about what I was doing. Whatever the future of programming may bring, I firmly believe it will still reward thinking over mindlessness. Does that mark me as hopelessly old-fashioned? Or should we be doing more to support the programmer who wants time to reflect—and a lot more to support the one who doesn't?

对我们大多数人来说，分时已经成为一个垂死的问题，被技术仁慈地杀死了。当时它为我们所做的是提出了界面设计的问题，我和 Tom Gilb 在Humanized Input中探讨了这个问题。尽管那本开创性的书很快就被技术事件淘汰了，但界面设计当然仍然是一个活生生的问题，并且是一个受心理学研究影响的领域，而这正是我最初写《心理学》的目标。我们现在有专门研究计算机人机界面的期刊和专业协会，但没有专门针对编程或界面以外的编程的其他心理方面。

Time-sharing has become a moribund issue for most of us, mercifully killed by technology. What it did for us back then was raise the issue of interface design, an issue Tom Gilb and I explored in Humanized Input. Although that pioneering book was rapidly made obsolete by technological events, interface design, of course, is still a live issue, and is the one area subject to the kind of psychological research that was my goal in writing Psychology originally. We now have journals and professional societies devoted to the computer-human interface, though none specifically directed at programming or other psychological aspects of programming beyond the interface.

在我看来，这些研究成果对程序员的工作几乎没有直接影响。一方面，工具设计者和流程设计者的工作似乎是基于直觉，而不是科学结果。另一方面，这项研究表明，人们的适应能力很强，他们几乎可以使用任何界面工作——并且认为它对用户友好。最后，如果这些直观设计的界面之间存在差异，那么它还不足以成为复杂编程工作的主要因素。

It seems to me that these research results have had little direct influence on the job of the programmer. For one thing, tool designers and process designers seem to work on the basis of intuition, not on scientific results. For another, this research has shown that people are so adaptable they are able to work with almost any interface—and think it user-friendly. And, finally, if there is a difference among these intuitively designed interfaces, it's not big enough to be a major factor in the complex job of programming.

然后是文档的主题。这本书提供了一种文档，25 年后，我已经忘记了最初出版它时遇到的大部分麻烦。我确实记得它流行后的美好时光，但即使我没有，我仍然很高兴我写了它。不管文档的任何其他价值如何，能够记住您去过的地方，以便预测您可能要去的地方，这很好。

And then there is the subject of documentation. This book provides a kind of documentation, and after twenty-five years, I'd forgotten most of the troubles I had first getting it published. I do recall the good times after it became popular, but even if I didn't, I'm still glad I wrote it. Regardless of any other value to documentation, it's nice to be able to remember where you've been, in order to anticipate where you might be going.

就软件文档而言，二十五年来我们似乎并没有走多远。当然，我们有一些简洁的新工具，如代码格式化程序、在线文档和超文本，但内容仍然最重要，很少有工具能真正增强内容。更容易地访问您最初不想要的信息并没有多大意义——正如 Internet 经常展示的那样。（我确实认识到现在无处不在的常见问题解答文档是我当时提出的用于捕获最常见问题的系统。）
